loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda has a small cafe where she sells lunches. She started out by working as a cook in a cafe, but her earnings were not sufficient, so she started her own business with the help of some money given to her by the godfather of one of her children. Now she has a solid clientele and is very well-known in the area for her good cooking.

Glenda used her first loan with Mifex and Kiva to invest in the purchase of bigger pots, an industrial stove, and benches for her business. With this investment her sales increased and she had enough income to enroll her 3 children in school. For that, her children are very grateful. The second loan Glenda is requesting will be used to make improvements to her home and business. She wants all of her customers to feel welcome and comfortable in her café.

Glenda is 37 years old single mother. She depends completely on this business to support her family. The father of her children abandoned her when the youngest daughter was just three years old. She is very concerned about the education of her children. She is an enterprising woman and she knows that her business will grow and will provide the financial security she needs.

loans.use: Make improvements to her home and business

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is a 38 year old married mother of 3 children. She sells baby clothes, strollers, and toys. She began her business with $100 dollars from a friend. At first, she only sold strollers and toys for babies. Now she sells baby walkers, diaper bags, and a range of baby products. This is a profitable business as very few stores are dedicated to baby products. Marcia saw another opportunity in carrying lotions, shampoo and soaps. She used her first loan to purchase these items in bulk. This benefited her business and helped it grow.

Marcia knows that gifts for babies and children are especially popular during the holiday season. She is requesting a second loan with Mifex and Kiva to invest in these products. Her clients have actually requested them from her so she is confident the profit from these sales will give her family economic security and help her improve her business.

Marcia’s dream is to make improvement to her home so her family lives more comfortably. She is thankful for the ongoing support of Mifex and Kiva.

loans.use: Buy more diverse line of gifts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in different types of products for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy gifts to sell during the christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in higher quality fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a new point of sale

loans.name: Martina Durán

texts.en:
Martina is 63 years old and has a grown-up son.  She has been widow for more than 10 years. Her son has graduated from the university and has his own family. 
In spite of her advanced age, Martina wants to be an active businesswoman.  Six months ago, she got from our organization a loan to purchase goods in order to supply her business activity.  The entrepreneur sells clothes and fabrics, curtains, sheets, beds and tablecloths. 
Martina wants to have a local shop where to sell the goods.  Now, every day she has to go to the public place to operate the business.  She has applied for a second loan, which she will use to rent a small local store and a showcase for some of the products.
The entrepreneur thinks that obtaining the funds will be a huge opportunity for her change the way she’s doing business, and that she will get more clients.

loans.use: Part of the funds will be spent to rent a small local store where the entrepreneur can sell the clothes.  Also to buy a showcase to put the goods.

loans.name: Adriana Caro

texts.en:
Adriana is a very successful businesswoman of San Cristobal.  She dedicates herself to the preparation and sales of pizzas, pies and cakes.  
Early in the morning she prepares the food and sells them to the cafeterias of the colleges in the community.  She also sells pieces of cake and pizza in a public school.
The entrepreneur explains that she could sell more if she had the appropriate materials to prepare the food.
With the loan requested, she will purchase a secondhand oven to prepare the pizzas.  In doing so, she will easily increase the volume of pizzas made every day.
Adriana has long-term dream for the business.  She plans in the future to have a local store where she can run the business, and she plans to introduce tasty sandwiches to the business.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand oven to prepare pizzas in order to keep on producing satisfying her large clientele's needs.

loans.name: Aan

texts.en: Aan is 44 years old and is married. Her business is selling household goods such as cooking oil, rice, snacks, eggs, etc. Aan usually earns $20 per day in profit. Her husband is a driver. He usually earns $1 per day, therefore she has to work hard to cover their daily needs.  She is a member of MBK and needs IDR 1,000,000 loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Marianingsih

texts.en:
Marianingsih is 43 years old, mother of a child aged 17. She sells snacks, food and drinks, among other things. She usually earns $15 per day, and would like a IDR 1,000,000 loan to complete her shop and buy some goods. Her husband helps her to run her shop every day, because he has no fixed job.

Marianingsih hopes that she will be able to increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop and buy some goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his fruit business.

loans.name: Assita

texts.en: D. Assita is a 46 year old widow whose husband  died in 2001. She has 7 children of whom 4 attend school: 3 are in grammar school and one is in primary school. Assita lives with her family in Attecoube, a township in North-West Abidjan. For many years now, Assita has been selling various crops, especially cassava and potatoes tubers in the Attecoubé market. Assita has shown a sense of courage and determination to take care to her family. She has worked very hard to continue paying for her family's household expenses and her children' education expenses. She joined the AE&I microcredit program in early 2004 and has benefited from several loans that she has used to diversify her product range. She is a good performer and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: Assita Deme will use the loan to purchase batches of potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Soulaimane

texts.en: Soulaimane A. is a dynamic and strong 26 year old man. He lives with his partner and their children in Attecoube, where he has a butcher shop in the local market. A. inherited the business from his retired father. His first daughter entered her last year of primary school last October. Soulaimane's partner is a crop seller and  helps to pay for family's household expenses. Soulaimane benefitted from his first loan from AE&I in September 2006 and has been able to reimburse all his loans in good time. He has a sense of initiative and is self motivated. He loves his job and performs very well

loans.use: Soulaimane Alabi will use the loan to purchase some cows

loans.name: Minata

texts.en: C. Minata is 62 years old and married with 7 children. She and her children live with her husband in Attecoube, a township in North-West Abidjan. Minata's husband has retired from a clerical position in the Attecoube mayor's office.  His retirement pension is not enough to cover their household expenses and Minata is now a key contributor to the family's revenues. She received her first loan from AE&I in December 2004 and has been a good performer since then. Minata is a courageous and dynamic woman who is full of energy and vitality.

loans.use: Coulibaly Minata will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Naminin

texts.en: Naminin S. is 38 years old and married with has 2 children. Her children attend school abroad, in neighboring Burkina Faso. Her husband is a second-hand and used auto parts salesman. Naminin sells salad and local foods in front of her house. Her customers are the tradesmen and tradeswomen who work in the market near her house. She lives with her family in Attecoube, a township in North-West Abidjan. She is dynamic and contributes significantly to covering her family's household expenses. She now wishes to diversify the range of food she sells, especially for the approaching celebrations and festivities next month (Aid El Kebir, Christmas Day, New Year, etc.).

loans.use: Naminin Sako will use the loan to purchase goods.

loans.name: Moussa Sadon

texts.en:
M. Moussa Sadon is a dynamic and ambitious tradesman. M. is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their 2 children in Attécoubé, a populated township in North-West Abidjan. M.’s oldest daughter goes to primary school.

M. owns a small general food store in the Attecoube open market. He sells various tinned products, aromatic products and vegetable oil. He has expanded his activities during the last couple of years with the different loans he received from AE&I. He has improved his family's standard of living and made good progress in his business. He now wishes to purchase goods in bulk so as to meet his customers' higher demands in the coming weeks approaching the end-of-year celebrations.

loans.use: Maiga Moussa Sadon will use the loan to replenish his general food store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Guigani Mariam is a dynamic woman. She is 36 years old and lives with her partner, Mory and their 4 children. Mory works as a butcher. The family lives in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West Abidjan. Mariam has been selling spices and various aroma products in the Attecoube market for more than ten years.

Mariam has successfully expanded her microbusiness during the last two years with different loans from AE&I. She is a hard worker and helps to pay for the family's household expenses, and has been able to send her 3 elder children to school. Mariam wants to purchase goods in bulk at lower prices and thus improve her retail margin. Mariam is a good performer and will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Guigani Mariam will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify her fish business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her business.

loans.name: Ma De Los Angeles Ju

texts.es:
"I have a business selling used clothing and shoes. Right now the winter season is beginning and I would like to invest in seasonal merchandise to grow my sales. My stock has gone down now because the majority of the clothing and shoes that I have are for the summer season. I am requesting $1000 to invest in my business."

“Tengo un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos usados, ahora que empieza la temporada de frío me gustaría invertir en mercancía de temporada para que aumenten mis ventas, ya que han bajado un poco debido a que la mayoría de la ropa y zapatos que tengo son de tiempo de calor”. Solicito $ 1.000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN USED CLOTHING FOR THE SEASON AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER SMALL BUSINESS.

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es:
“I have had a paper and notions store for one year and I would like invest in decorations, balloons and gifts for the Christmas season, as that is when my sales increase the most. I am requesting $1,000 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una mercería y papelería desde hace 1 año me gustaría invertir en la compra de adornos, globos y regalos para la época de navidad ya que es cuando más aumentan mis ventas. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio."

loans.use: Buy Christmas decorations and gifts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his aluminium stock.

loans.name: Rubicelia

texts.es:
“I am worried because the weather will be cold soon and I have a window without glass in one room. I’d like to replace the window and also plaster the walls so my family is more protected, as I have young children. I am requesting $400 to put the glass in the window and plaster the walls in one room.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“Me preocupa que se acerca el tiempo de frío y tengo una ventana sin vidrio en un cuarto, me gustaría ponérselo y también enjarrar las paredes para que mi familia este más protegida ya que tengo hijos pequeños”. Solicito $ 400.00 dlls para poner el vidrio de una ventana y enjarrar las paredes de un cuarto.”

loans.use: Replace the glass in one window and plaster the walls in one room

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
“A few months ago I bought a piece of land to build a house on for my family. Right now we live with a relative and construction has already begun on the land, but I need money to put up the walls, put in windows and the door so we will be able to move into our house as soon as possible. I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to finish construction on my house.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“DesD. hace algunos meses compre un terreno para construir una casita para mi familia ya que ahora vivimos con un familiar, ya empecé mi construcción en ese terreno pero me falto dinero para levantar las paredes, poner las ventanas y L. puerta para poder habitar lo más pronto posible nuestra casa”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar L. construcción D. mi vivienda.”

loans.use: Put up walls, put in windows and a door

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María del Rosario is a woman who constantly struggles for her two children. She really wishes and desires that they succeed in life through academics. Since the father of her two children abandoned them, she now has to pull through and support for her family. Therefore, she started to look for another way to improve their income. In her free afternoons, she started to sell beauty products and home goods like duvets through a catalog business. Little by little, she started to build up her clientele until she had a steady customer base and was able to offer a variety of products.

Without a doubt, María thinks that it is necessary to move ahead and find a better future for her children. Thus, she is seeking a loan of $475 which will be repaid in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise for product demos; this will enable her to attract more customers to buy her products. With your help, María will be able to grow her business as well as increase possibilities for self-improvement for her two sons.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

María del Rosario es una mujer que lucha constantemente por sus dos hijos que tanto quiere, y desea que salgan adelante en la vida a base de estudios. Debido a que el papá de sus hijos los abandonó y ahora ella es la que tiene que salir adelante, para poder mantener a su familia. Por lo tanto comenzó a buscar un ingreso extra para poder obtener mayores recursos. En las tardes libres comenzó a ofrecer productos de belleza y productos del hogar por catálogo como son los edredones, poco a poco comenzó a hacer clientela, hasta que formó un grupo, hasta que se pudo hacer de un repertorio de productos y clientas que la siguen.

Sin embargo María considera que es necesario seguir adelante y buscar un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Por lo tanto, está solicitando un crédito de US $475 y está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero comprará más mercancía para poder programar demostraciones y así poder tener más clientas que le compren los productos. Con tu ayuda María podrá crecer su negocio y así crecer las posibilidades de que se superen los hijos de María.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to offer her customers

loans.name: María Manuela

texts.es:
María Manuel and her husband had three children, all of whom are married. Despite this, she, at 60 years of age, has to care for one of her grandchildren which has kept her busy trying to make money to offer a better future to her grandson. “We are at a mature age and we must take advantage of our strengths in order to do something useful.”

For this reason María began a paper store that in the beginning sold notebooks, and little by little began to introduce new products that her customers were requesting.

Nevertheless, her products are not well-organized enough to separate one product from others, and because of this she is requesting a loan of $750, which she will repay over a period of 6 months. With this money María wants to buy some glass cases to display her Christmas products, which she’d also like to buy to be able to offer around Christmastime. With your help María and her husband will be able to help their little grandson that needs them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María Manuela y su esposo tuvieron 3 hijos de los cuales todos están casados, a pesar de esto ella a sus 60 años tiene que hacerse cargo de uno de sus nietos, lo que los a mantenidos ocupados para sacar dinero para poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su nieto. “Ya que estamos en la edad de la madurez y hay que aprovechar las fuerzas para hacer algo de utilidad”.

Es por esto que María comenzó a hacer una papelería, que en un inicio fue venta de libretas y poco a poco ha ido introduciendo nuevos productos que la gente va pidiendo.

Sin embargo, no tiene un orden adecuado para separar unos productos de otros, y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero María desea comprar unas vitrinas para poner los artículos navideños que también desea comprar para ofrecerlos en esta temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda María y su esposo podrán ayudar a su pequeño nieto que los necesita.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a little display case

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
António S. was born in Cuamba in the Province of Niassa in the 12th of July, 1960. He moved to Maputo when he was 18 where he was raised by his sister. He studied until in 1979 when he joined the Mozambique Freedom Army. During this period he studied in Russia and started working for the Mozambique defense department.

António S. has 4 children and lives in the neighborhood of Machava. He joined Hluvuku in 2005 and has been using the loan to build a home. With the loan of 60.000,00 MT he plans on finishing his home and moving from his rented house. The lot was bought in 2002 for 80.000,00MT and the used construction material were bought in Maputo. In the future, he plans on finishing the project having his family move in. His project has a positive impact because his project will create housing and improve the quality of life of his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Marracuene-Maputo Cliente: António S. Actividade: Habitacão Valor de empréstimo: 60.000,00 Mt ( 2.400USD) Aplicação: compra de material de contruçao Início: 07-11-07 Fim: 30-04-09 António S., nasceu em Cuamba na Provincia de Niassa aos 12 de Junho de 1960, veio a Maputo quando tinha 18 anos onde viveu na companhia da irmã. Foi a irmã que foi responsável do seu sustento bem como dos seus estudos até ao ano de 1979 que por vontade própria incorpora –se nas Forças Armadas de Libertação de Moçambique. Durante este periodo fez o curso básico de Administração militar tem continuado o nivel médio na Russia actual união Soviética, desde então faz parte do quadro do Ministério da defesa de Moçambique. António S. tem 4 filhos e actualmente vive numa casa arrendanda no Bairro da Machava. Sendo cliente da Hluvuku desde o ano de 2005, tem 2 (dois) pedidos concluido com sucesso os quais estavam direccionados a projecto de habitação.

Com o crédito de 60.000,00 mts( setenta mil meticais) , pretende concluir dependência de forma a deixar de viver na casa arrendada. De referir que porjecto localiza a cerca de 30 km da cidade de Maputo em direcção Norte ao longo de Avenida de Moçambique. O espaço onde está localizado o projecto adquiriu em 2002, pelo pagamento de 80.000,00 mts( oitenta mil meticais) e os materiais usados para a construção foram adquirido nas principais ferragens cidade de Maputo e foram transportados por viaturas alugadas. No futuro já com a fámilia fixada pretende concluir com a residência principal e de seguida reativar o projecto da salinas que já tinha abondonado,pelo que, conta com mais pedidos de financiamento. O seu projecto tem impacto social positivo pois consiste no melhoramento das condições habitacionais a perioridade para o bem estar e conforto familiar.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula is 60 and a widow who pulls together to keep her family of two sons going. However, they decided to forgo their studies and work to support the three of themselves together. Paula runs a hamburger stand in the evenings and sells tacos in the mornings. Her older son has a fruit stand. This is how they make money to live.

However, the business is not suited to sell fruits. They also need to make food. For these reasons, Paula is seeking a loan of $300 that will be repaid with her sons' help over the course of 4 months. The loan will be used to buy display cases or stands to place the fruit they sell as well as benches for their customers for a moment's rest. With your help, Paula and her sons will be able to move ahead and recover from their terrible loss of their father and husband who always watches over them.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Paula a sus 60 años quedó viuda con la responsabilidad de sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, sin embargo ellos decidieron dejar de estudiar y ponerse a trabajar para poder salir adelante los tres juntos. La señora tiene un puesto de hamburguesas por las noches y en las mañanas vende tacos de harina y su hijo el mayor tiene un puesto de frutas. Y así es como sacan dinero para poder mantener los gastos del hogar.

Sin embargo, el negocio no está adecuado para tener las frutas y lo necesario para hacer las comidas, es por eso que Paula está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlo con la ayuda de sus hijos en un plazo de 4 meses y con ese dinero Paula y sus hijos podrán comprar vitrinas para poder poner la fruta que venden y bancos para que la gente que va a comprar tenga un lugar dónde sentarse. Con tu ayuda Paula y sus hijos podrán salir adelante y recuperarse de la terrible pérdida del Padre y Esposo que siempre veló por ellos.

loans.use: to buy display stands and benches

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a woman that has tried her best to move forward in her life, given that her husband left her alone with four children. Besides her regular job she is studying so that she will be able to have a job that will allow her to pay for the studies of her children. She took a course to learn how to make crowns for tombs of the dead and she makes little decorations in her free time. Three years ago she finished her class and now she works making and selling the crowns and decorations outside of a cemetery where many people pass by.

However, the high season for people visiting the cemetery is about to begin, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of three hundred dollars to be repaid in three months. With this loan she will be able to buy the materials necessary to be able to make her products. Also, she would like to be able to buy stuffed animals and other gifts to be able to have more variety in her business. With your help Catalina will be able to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Catalina es una mujer que a luchado por salir adelante, puesto que su esposo, la abandonó con cuatro hijo, y aparte de su trabajo trató de conseguir otra ocupación para poder darle estudio a sus hijos. Y fue así como entró a un cuero de manualidades para poder aprender a hacer coronas para muertos y decoraciones para venderlos en sus tiempos libres. Hace tres año terminó su curo y ahora se dedica a fabricarlos y venderlos a las afueras de un panteón por donde pasa mucha gente.

Sin embargo la temporada alta del tránsito de gente está por empezar y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 mese y con este dinero catalina podrá comprar material para realizar sus manualidades. Y además de comprar peluches y regalos para poder tener más surtido en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Catalina podrá vender sus productos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to make her arrangements

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
It's been already five years that Rosa María has been selling used articles of clothing that she gathers from her family, since her sons consume and spend more. With revenue from these sales, she also started to buy some new cheap products to resell. This is how she started this business until she was able to get a passport to the US where she has been able to buy more merchandise like original perfumes and other novelties.

However, she still needs some merchandise for this Christmas season. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $925 that will be repaid in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy products like shoes, clothing, home furnishings. These are things that are certain to sell well and secure greater revenues, which can be used to bring gifts for her two sons.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ya cinco años Rosa María tuvo la necesidad de empezar a vender algo de ropa usada que tenían de su familia, ya que los hijos empezaron a tener cada vez más y más gastos, y con las utilidades de lo que había vendido fue comprando algo de novedades baratas para poder revenderlas y así fue como empezó en este negocio hasta llegar a arreglar su pasaporte y poder pasar a los estados unidos a donde va a comprar un poco de mercancía como son perfumes originales y algunas novedades.

Sin embargo para esta época navideña le hacen falta productos para poder ofrecer algo en Navidad. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y así con este dinero podrá comprar mercancía como zapatos, ropa, adornos para la casa. Cosas que está segura le servirán para venderlos y obtener mayores utilidades, para ayudar a que en la cena familiar pueda tenerle un regalito a sus dos hijos por quienes tanto lucha.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to offer variety to her customers

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel Chale was born on March 4th, 1969 in Catembe a province of Maputo. She is 38 years old, married and mother of 5 children. She was raised by her uncles in Maputo where she studied until the 6th grade. After school she sold Badjías (a snack made of fried beans) to help her family. After she was done with school she continued to work with baking and selling bread. When she was 19 years old her husband started to sell fish. The business did not do well so he got a job with a company and worked in the Popular Market in Maputo for 6 years. When the company closed he started selling vegetables and other basic products in a stand.

She was introduced to Hluvuku by friends and requested her first loan with which she started building her business. She is building a mini market. Today she has 2 employees and supports 8 people. She buys her inventory from Maputo, rents a car then brings it back to her market. In the end of the month and summers she makes the most money averaging 10.000mt selling cereals, vegetables, oil and sugar. Her business is doing well and her income base is of 15.000mt a month. With this income she is improving her home and saving. With the loan of 60,000mt, Isabel improved the building of the store she is renting, in the future she wants to diversify her products and buy a bigger car to transport products. These loans have changed Isabel’s life and she is very enthusiastic about the future.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização:Bairro Chalí, Catembe-Maputo Cliente: Isabel Chale Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo:60,000.00Mt ( 2.400usd) Aplicação: Compra de Produtos para revenda Início:21/08/2007 Fim:11/02/2009 Isabel Chale, nasceu aos 04 de Março de 1969 em Catembe na província de Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade , casada maritalmente tem 5 filhos estudou apenas até 6ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira dos seus progenitores. Passou uma parte da sua Infância com seus tios na capital ,Maputo durante 7 anos onde, depois da Escola dedicava se na venda de Badjías( produto feito com feijão que de seguida é frito e come -se com o pão) para ajudar nas despesas de casa . Algum tempo depois volta á catembe junto dos pais onde não continuando com os estudos , passou a dedicar se na venda de Pão. Aos 19 anos junta se com seu marido e muda de negócio passando a vender Peixe e porque o negócio não estava a correr bem , decide procurar emprego tendo conseguido na Feira Popular de Maputo onde trabalhou durante 6 anos. Momentos depois a Empresa veio a fechar e como solução imediata para garantir o sustento da família voltou ao mundo de negócio tendo arranjado uma banca e passou a vender hortículas e outros produtos da primeira necessidade. Conheceu a Hluvuku por meio de amigas e solicitou o primeiro empréstimo com o qual começou a erguer a sua infraestrutura comercial. Nao possui nenhuma formação do seu negócio, tendo ganho experiênça ao longo dos anos de trabalho , com os empréstimos seguintes transformou a sua barraca( infraestrutura comercial precario)em Mini mercearia e comprou uma viatura caixa aberta o qual lhe ajuda no transporte de mercadoria. Actualmente conta com uma Merceária que é propriedade sua e uma outra arendada. Vive actualmente com 8 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e no seu negócio emprega duas pessoas uma das quais tem 2 filhos.

A sua actividade inicia as 8 horas e não precisa de transporte porque a mini mercearia localiza-se junto de casa e só para ir a outra é que tem se deslocado do carro próprio. A sua mercadoria adquiri do outro lado da baía, na cidade de Maputo onde tem alugado um carro para levar a mercadoria até na atravessia isso porque o seu carro é pequeno e não poderia transportar todos produtos duma só vez. Depois de atravessar a mercadoria, tem usado o seu transporte para a distribuicão pelas Mercearias. O melhor período no seu negócio é no fim do mês e no verão onde a receita diária chega a atingir 10.000,00mt e os produtos que mais vende são os cereiais , leguminosas , óleo ,vegetais ,e açúcar . Tem feito registos no seu negócio e a única dificuldade no seu negócio é no transporte de mercadoria uma vez a sua viatura é menor o que lhe obriga a ter que alugar outra . O seu negócio está tomando um rumo satisfatório e a sua margem de lucro mensal tem sido na ordem de 15,000.00mt e com este rendimento uma parte aplica na ampliação e melhoramento da sua casa , nas despesas domésticas e uma parte vai para a poupança. Com o presente crédito de 60,000.00mt aplicou no apetrechamento do estabelecimento que alugou junto á baía. E ,futuramente pretende diversificar o seu negócio abrindo uma ferragem e comprar uma viatura maior pelo que ainda recorrerá ao empréstimo. Este empréstimo e outros anteriores modificaram positivamente o seu negócio e a sua vida e está muito entusiasmada .

loans.use: To buy onother produts for retail

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena likes to make progress based on her own effort. As evidence of this, she has been selling shoes by catalog for two years. Little by little and thanks to her good interpersonal skills, she has won the preference of her clients. In addition, the income she receives alleviate the financial burden on her husband, as María helps with the household expenses.

Nontheless, María wants to keep growing and, for that reason, she is requesting a $200 loan, that she is committed to repay in three months. With this amount, María will be able to buy more winter season shoes and offer them to her clients, who are often on the outlook for presents for their relatives. The picture portrays María next to boxes of the shoes she sells and a catalog of the shoes she offers. With your help María’s business will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo, y muestra de ello es el trabajo que está realizando actualmente, venta de zapatos por catálogo, que empezó hace 2 años. Poco a poco y con la habilidad que tiene para tratar a las personas, los clientes la prefieren a ella. Y aunado a esto, las ganancias que recibe han hecho que los gastos que tiene su esposo constantemente se sientan menos, puesto que María ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Sin embargo María desea seguir creciendo y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 3 meses. Con este dinero María podrá comprar más zapatos de temporada de invierno, para poder tener qué ofrecerles a sus clientas, que en muchas ocasiones andan buscando qué regalarle a sus familiares. En la foto de la historia sale María al lado de unas cajas de zapatos, que son los que vende, y un catálogo mostrando una foto de zapatos que ofrece. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir adelante con este negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Sayaad Mohammad

texts.en: Sayaad Mohammad lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. He has a retail shop and he has run this business since 2002. Now he wants to increase his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos and other necessities for his shop to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos

loans.name: Mohammad Shafi

texts.en:
Mohammad Shafi lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. He lives with his own family.

For about 9 years he was in Iran and he worked in a furniture making company. When he came back last year he started this business in Kabul and opened a furniture making shop. His business is going well and now he wants to expand so he requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to support his family better.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Najmo Din

texts.en: Najmo Din lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children and he lives with his own family. He has a catering shop, which is the only sources of income for his family.  Only two years ago he started this business. He has attracted a lot of clients during this last two years and now he wants to expand his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy plates, glasses, and some extra materials to make a good income for his family. He is happy about this loan and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy plates.glass and some extra materials

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise G. is 33 years old and married with 5 children. His husband is a docker at the Abidjan port and her 15 year old son is an apprentice carpenter. The younger children go to primary and secondary school. Elise lives with her family in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West Abidjan.

Elise sells various fruits and legumes in the Attecoube market. She wants to expand this business in order to be able to contribute significantly to covering her family's household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase oranges, mangoes and tangerines in bulk.

loans.use: Elise Gueu will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Karidja

texts.en:
O. Karidja is a dynamic and courageous 33 year old woman. She is a widow who lost her husband last year (2006) in dramatic circumstances. She has 2 children, one in secondary school and the other in primary school. Karidja has been able to overcome the difficulties and hardships she faces and has retaken control of her life.

She takes care of her children and has continued developing her microbusiness. She has a clothing sales store in Adjamé-Forum market in the north of the Abidjan district. She is ambitious and manages her activities well. She requested the loan to purchase women's fashion clothes in time for the end-of-year celebrations and festivities.

loans.use: Ouattara Karidja will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Laurentine

texts.en: Laurentine Irié L. is a dynamic 32 year old woman. She has 3 children and lives in Attecoube, a populated suburb in North-West Abidjan. Laurentine sells grilled pork and beef in the Attecoube market. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. She covers a significant amount of her family's household expenses and the cost of her childens' education. She is a courageous and ambitious young woman. Laurentine joined the AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has benefitted from different loans that have helped her to expand her business. She is a good performer and can repay the loan.

loans.use: Laurentine Irié Lou will use the loan to purchase cartons of pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase and diversify her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Aboh Richmond

texts.en: Aboh Richmond K. is 34 years old.  He lives with his cohabitant and their child, who is in primary school. Aboh is a dynamic dressmaker who has been in the tailoring business for more than 15 years. He lives with his family in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West Abidjan. Aboh wants to buy new sewing equipment for his shop in order to attract new customers. He is an excellent performer who has benefitted from several loans from AE&I and has repaid them without any problem. The new equipment will improve Aboh's performance and expand his business.

loans.use: Aboh Richmond Koffi will use the loan to purchase a new electric sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her grocery business

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Koffi K. is 32 years old. He lives with his cohabitant in Attecoube, a populated township in North-West  Abidjan. Koffi sells frozen and fresh fish in the Attecoubé open market. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. Koffi stopped going to school in secondary school, but has since found his way forward with this business, in which he performs very well. Koffi joined the AE&I microcredit program in January 2005 and has been a good performer since then. With the increase in his revenue, he has moved to a better house. K. is a dynamic and hard worker and will use the loan to purchase cartons of frozen fish.

loans.use: Koffi Kouakou will use the loan to purchase cartons of frozen fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en: Moustapha H. is 40 years old. He has 1 child and lives with his cohabitants in Adjame, a suburb in the north of Abidjan. H. owns a toy store in the Adjamé market. He has worked hard to reach his current position and is dynamic and ambitious. He manages his store very well and has diversified his range of products for sale. He has also developed a second hand toys market for his poorer clients. He joined the AE&I microcredit program in 2005 and has been an excellent performer since then. H. will use the loan to replenish his store for the upcoming Christmas celebration.

loans.use: Moustapha Hadji will use the loan to purchase goods (toys)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine and more stock.

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Chu Thị Trọng is 48 years old. She's a bird breeder for the last 10 years. 6 months a year, she sells birds at the market, the rest of time she raises poultry and sells breakfast. She joined TYM fund in 2003. She was qualified for a loan to buy birds. She also invested in her breakfast service, stocking up more products. Her children are all grown up., one is married and the other 2 are attending school away from home. She's requesting a loan of 375 USD to buy more breeding birds.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chu Thị Trọng, 48 tuổi, làm nghề buôn chim cách đây đã được 10 năm. Mỗi năm 6 tháng chị đưa chim đi chợ bán, thời gian còn lại chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và bán đồ ăn sáng. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vào năm 2003, chị có điều kiện vay thêm vốn cho việc đi mua chim. Có thêm tiền để đầu tư mua thức ăn giúp chị có thể giữ hàng đợi đến khi được giá. Các con chị hiện đều đã lớn, một cháu đã đi làm, 2 cháu học cao đẳng và trung cấp trên thành phố. Vòng vốn này chi đề nghị vay 375 USD để mua thêm chim cảnh.

loans.use: Buy birds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đoàn Thị Hồng is 48 years old. Her husband passed away a few years ago. She had to raise 3 children by herself. Today 2 of her children are working, the youngest one is still in school. She has gone through difficult times . Now things are better ever since she joined TYM fund. The loans that she received have been invested in fruitful business: rice husking. This time she's requesting a loan of 375 USD to stock up on rice for her rice husking business. This assures her a stable revenue. She is a hard working person, autonomous and motivated.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chồng mất cách đây vài năm, một mình chị Đoàn Thị Hồng, 48 tuổi, nuôi 3 nguời con ăn học, đến nay chỉ còn một cháu đang đi học 2 cháu đã đi làm. Hiện tại gia đình đã đỡ vất vả hơn trước nhờ được vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương. Các vòng vốn trước chị sử dụng rất hiệu quả. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay mức 375 USD về mua lúa dự trữ và xay xát bán dần. Thu nhập của chị cũng ổn định. Chị là một người nhanh nhẹn tháo vát, chịu khó trong công việc

loans.use: Buy rice to husk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Hoàng Thị Châu, 47 years of age, is a hard working & diligent person. Ever since she joined TYM fund, her family financial situation had changed for the better. This time she requests a loan of 375 USD to buy more pet birds to raise. More and more people are keeping pet bird as a hobby, this is good for her business. The investment will be fruitful. Her husband, Lê Bá Bông, is very supportive of her.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Châu, 47 tuổi, là con người chịu khó, siêng năng trong công việc. Từ ngày tham gia vay vốn trả dần gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 USD về để mua thêm chim cảnh. Nhu cầu chơi chim cảnh của các hộ gia đình đang ngày càng phát triển gia đình chị Châu đầu tư vốn vào loại hình kinh doanh này càng có hiệu quả cao. Chồng chị, anh Lê Bá Bông cũng tích cực hỗ trợ vợ thực hiện dự án

loans.use: Buy birds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of New Motorcycle, type BAJAJ-BOXER- CC100 Indian make.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Although 50 years old, Ms. Nguyen Thi Q. is still very strong. Everyday she rides her bike for 10 kilometers to go to the market to sell her chicken and fruit. Because of her efforts, she gets good harvest every season. Her husband also helps her a lot. The profit from this small stall at the market helps her pay her weekly repayment rather easily. She’d like to borrow 375USD to buy nurseling and chicken.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Năm nay đã ngoài 50 tuổi nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị Quán vẫn còn khoẻ mạnh. Hàng ngày chị đạp xe hơn 10 cây số đi chợ bán hàng. Hoa quả và gia cầm là thứ mà gia đình chị thường có sẵn. Mùa nào cây ấy trong vườn nhà chị lúc nào cũng đầy cây trái. Nhờ có nghề phụ kiếm tiền được hàng tuần nên việc hoàn trả đối với chị rất dễ dàng. Ngoài ra chị còn có được sự hỗ trợ tích cực của chồng. Chị đề nghị vay mức vốn 375 USD để tiếp tục đầu tư mua thêm cây, con giống.

loans.use: Buy nurseling, chicken

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Pham Thi H., 48 years old, is a hard-working woman. She takes care of everything in the family. Since her divorce, she became the sole bread-winner of her family. She has three children, two of whom still go to school. Although her life is still very difficult, she feels more refreshed and happy after her divorce. She even looks younger than she was before. Everyday she goes buy fruit and resell them. She earns about 3USD per day. This time she’d like to borrow 375USD to buy fruit, and mash for her pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị H., 48 tuổi, là người phụ nữ đảm đang, mọi công việc trong gia đình một mình chị lo liệu. Từ ngày vợ chồng chia tay nhau, chị một mình nuôi 3 con, hiện hai cháu vẫn còn đang học. Tuy có vất vả về kinh tế nhưng luôn giữ được tinh thần thoải mái nên trông chị như khoẻ hơn và trẻ lại. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là đi chợ mua H. quả về bán. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 USD về đầu tư nuôi thêm lợn và có vốn mua thêm H. quả đi chợ. Mỗi ngày đi chợ trung bình chị cũng thu được 3 USD.

loans.use: Buy fruit, mash for her pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 50 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Quang Khe, a poor commune of Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. Lives of people in Quang Khe are still really difficult. Since the day TYM Fund comes to Quang Khe, the villagers’ quality of life have improved significantly. Mrs. L.’s family income has increased, too. This time she wants to borrow 375USD to buy sedge to make mats. Her mats are beautiful and well known so many wholesalers have contracts to buy them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lương, 50 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại xã Quảng Khê, một miền quê nghèo của huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Đời sống của bà con nơi đây còn gặp nhiều khó khăn thiếu thốn. Từ ngày có Quỹ Tình thương cho vay lớn trả nhỏ lẻ nhân dân nơi đây rất phấn khởi. Gia đình chị Lương cũng vậy, kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên rõ rệt qua mỗi vòng vốn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 USD về mua cói dự trữ, dệt chiếu lấy tiền trả hàng tuần. Chiếu của gia đình chị làm ra đẹp có tiếng trong vùng nên rất nhiều thương lái đến đặt hàng ở đây.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a taxicab

loans.name: Lai Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lại Thị Tình is 55 years old. She is retired from the work force due to her health condition. In 2003, after learning a bit about TYM fund, she decided to become a member because she found that it would suit her situation. She applied for a loan to open up a stationary/souvenir store. In the beginning she did not have enough inventory so sales were low. After a while, she started getting more and more customers as she used her loan to add more products. She has a lot of students as customers. The office stationary items are good seller but the best ones are souvenir and gift items. Her business is going well, there are always customers in her store. The revenue from the store is quite stable. Ms Tình always participates in group activities organized by TYM despite the fact that she is very busy with her store. Her 2 children are attending university. This time she requests a loan of 325 USD to invest into her store, thus to raise her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Lại Thị Tình, 55 tuổi, là một công nhân về nghỉ mất sức. Năm 2003 sau khi tìm hiểu về Quỹ thấy cơ chế rất phù hợp với điều kiện kinh doanh cô đã mạnh dạn tham gia vay vốn đầu tư cửa hàng dịch vụ. Lúc đầu cô chỉ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhỏ lẻ nên thu nhập chưa cao. Sau một thời gian, thấy việc vay vốn thuận lợi, mặt khác là nhu cầu tiêu dùng của khách hành rất đa dạng (đặc biệt là rất đông khách hàng là sinh viên ) nên mặt hàng của cô cũng được đầu tư rất phong phú, nhất là mặt hàng văn phòng phẩm, nhưng bán chạy nhất là các mặt hàng lưu niệm và các đồ sinh nhật. Công việc của cô đang rất thuận lợi, cửa hàng của cô lúc nào cũng đông khách nên thu nhập của cô rất ổn định. Công việc bận rộn như vậy nhưng cô Tình vẫn rất nhiệt tình tham gia các hoạt động chung của cụm, ngoài ra cô còn nuôi 2 con học đại học. Vòng vốn tiếp theo cô dự kiến vay 325 USD để tiếp tục đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh tăng thu nhập cho gia đình

loans.use: Buy office stationary, present, souvenir

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Before 2002, Mrs. Tran Thi H.’s life was extremely difficult. She has many children, but she earned her living solely from a couple acres of rice-field. In August 2002, Mr.s H. joined TYM Fund. With her initial loan of 60USD, she buy and raise pigs. Years after years, she has becomes more confident with her ability to manage the loan. With her experience and self confidence, Mrs. H. is applying for a loan of 750USD. She wants to use this money to buy pigs, soybean to make tofu and mash to make wine. She just bought a machine to make tofu, so her production has increased significantly (On average, she sells 30 to 50 kilogram tofu per day). Mrs. H. uses by-products from making wine to feed her pigs. Every year she sells 4 litters of pigs (which weigh about 2 to 3 tons). Her husband is a farmer. He often helps her with her job, so she can have time to participate in her cluster activities as well as other hamlet and commune activities in general. Everybody in her commune trusts and respects her. Mrs. H. was appointed one of TYM’s best entrepreneurs in 2006. She hopes to continue to be member of TYM Fund, so that she can have bigger loan to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Trước năm 2002, điều kiện gia đình chị Trần Thị Hậu gặp nhiều khó khăn, nhà đông con, ngoài làm mấy sào ruộng ra gia đình chị cũng không biết làm gì thêm nên cuộc sống đã khó khăn lại càng khó khăn hơn. Tháng 8 năm 2002 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương. Với vốn vay ban đầu là 1 triệu đồng chị chỉ dùng đầu tư chăn nuôi nhỏ. Qua nhiều năm tham gia chị đã tự tin vào khả năng sử dụng vốn, cộng với kinh nghiệm của bản thân đến nay chị đã mạnh dạn xin vay mức vốn 750 USD. Vốn vay được chị và gia đình đầu tư vào làm đậu phụ, nấu rượu và chăn nuôi. Từ việc phải làm thủ công, gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua máy làm đậu nên sản phẩm của chị làm ra cũng tăng lên (mỗi ngày bình quân chị bán được 30 đến 50 cân đậu phụ). Việc nấu rượu giúp chị tận dụng nguồn thức ăn dư thừa để chăn nuôi lợn. Mỗi năm chị cho xuất chuồng 4 lứa lợn (khoảng 2 đến 3 tấn). Chồng chị tuy là một nông dân nhưng rất am hiểu và tạo điều kiện giúp đỡ vợ nên ngoài công việc gia đình, chị luôn luôn tích cực tham gia sinh hoạt của cụm và hoạt động chung của thôn, xã được các thành viên tin tưởng. Tổng kết năm 2006 chị được bình chọn là một trong những thành viên làm kinh tế giỏi. Nguyện vọng của chị là tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn lớn hơn phát triển kinh tế.

loans.use: Buy pigs, mash and soybeans

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tâm became a member of TYM fund in 1999. Her first loan was only 50 USD which was invested in livestock. She had a small piece of land. Her family's living condition was quite difficult. Then an opportunity was presented to her. The "People Committee" of her village (UBND xã ) had implemented a program to encourage farming. They would exchange farm land for unexploited one. Ms Tâm and her husband decided to make an exchange for an acre of land for fish farming. She was one of the first to exploit farming. She had some successes and some failures but she did not get discouraged. She was determined to reach her goal. With dedication and determination, she had been able to turn her farming business into a profitable one. Today she owns 1 acre for fish farming, a paddle of 200 egg laying ducks, 150 chicks. She had also invested in pig raising, she has 3 sows and 3 herds of piglets. The production from her family's farm is quite impressive (2 tons of pork, 1 ton of fish, 200 egg laying ducks). On average, her family makes about 450 USD/ month. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to invest more in her farming (buy chicken feed, mash and fishes).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999, ban đầu chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm chỉ vay 50 USD đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ, cuộc sống gia đình cũng quẩn quanh vài sào ruộng nên còn gặp nhiều khó khăn. Cuộc sống gia đình chị chuyển sang bước ngoặt mới khi UBND xã có chủ trương dồn điền đổi thửa, chị quyết định bàn với chồng đổi hơn một mẫu ruộng đào ao thả cá. Lúc bấy giờ chị là một trong những người tiên phong trong việc mở trang trại. Qua nhiều lần thành công và thất bại, chị vẫn không nản và cùng gia đình kiên trì theo đuổi mục đích của mình. Quả thật trời không phụ công chị, sau nhiều lần thất bại thì công việc làm ăn cũng dần trở nên thuận lợi. Hiện nay chị có hơn 1 mẫu ao thả cá, vịt đẻ hơn 200 con, vịt con 150 con , và đặc biệt chị đầu tư xây dựng công trình phụ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn với 3 lợn nái và 3 đàn lợn con . Thu nhập của gia đình vừa qua quả thật rất đáng kể (lợn hơn 2 tấn , cá hơn 1 tấn, và đàn vịt hơn 200 con vẫn cho thu nhập từ trứng hàng ngày). Tính bình quân thu nhập gia đình chị là 450 USD/tháng. Chị đang xin vay 950 USD để đầu tư thêm cho trang trại của mình.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed, mash for pigs, fishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory of children's clothing

loans.name: David

texts.en:
S. David is the father of two girls, aged 1 and 4 years. He has been selling new blankets, sheets, and suitcases for 4 years now. David’s business is located in one of the city suburbs of Kampala (Kalerwe), a few kilometers from the capital city. This trading center serves a large population, with hundreds of people going to shop there daily.

Unfortunately, David no longer has sufficient stock to meet the demand. Wholesale prices have risen, and he can buy less inventory than he could a few years ago with the same amount of capital. He has realized that he needs to increase his stock if he is to make enough profit to provide bread and basics for the family. He is requesting a loan of $600 to increase his inventory and make it more appealing. The loan will be paid back in a period of six months.

loans.use: To increase inventory of blankets, bedsheets, and suitcases

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a shed for unfired bricks and to buy wood used in firing the bricks

loans.name: Vun

texts.en: Mrs. R. Vun was married in 1989 and has six children, one son and five daughters. Her mother taught her how to weave in 2002 and she started her own weaving business that same year. R. Vun's husband works as a cook and is hired by people in their community to prepare the food for wedding ceremonies. This is the fourth time R. Vun has taken out a loan with MAXIMA, and she has seen the family's living conditions get better and better. She is now planning to send one of their daughters to a computer training course in Phnom Penh. She has applied for this $400 to purchase additional silk materials and sewing thread so that she can expand her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and thread

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Mrs. R. Sopheak was married in 2006 and has one daughter. A relative taught her how to weave in 2001 and she started silk production in the same year. She and her husband live with her parents.Her husband is a bricklayer, a skilled painter and an artist. He also owns a horse and cart which he uses to transport local people around the area. Neither husband nor wife finished primary school This is the first time R. Sopheak has requested a loan from MAXIMA, for the amount of $200. She intends to use this loan to purchase additional silk materials and sewing thread in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase silk material and sewing thread for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chanthou was married in 2001 and has two daughters. A relative taught her how to weave in 1997 and she has been weaving ever since. Her husband works as a carpenter. Neither husband nor wife finished primary education.

This is the first time S. Chanthou has requested a loan from MAXIMA. She has asked for $400 which she intends to use to purchase silk materials and sewing thread in order to expand her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Solat

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Solat was married in 1979 and has six children, three sons and three daughters. Soon after she was married she and her husband started their business, planting and selling flowers. Her husband also plants bananas and other food crops which they sell in the market. Four of their six children still live in the family home, of which three help selling flowers and bananas at the market, whilst the youngest is still studying at the local school. 

S. Solat has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times previously. She is now asking for a loan of $400, which she will use to purchase additional flowers and bananas in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional flowers and bananas to sell to expand her business

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en: Mrs. R. Sa Em was married in 1995 and has two children, one daughter and one son. Her neighbour taught her to weave in 1988 and she started her own silk weaving business that same year. Neither husband nor wife had enough money to even finish primary school. However, with their current business they have been able to send their children to study at school in the village. She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times previously. She has requested this loan of $100 in order to purchase silk material and sewing thread.

loans.use: to purchase silk material and sewing thread

loans.name: Soknao

texts.en: Miss. Soknao S. is currently living with her elderly parents in Koh Dach village. Soknao S. has been weaving silk since 2000 when her mother taught her to weave. Her father works spinning silk thread for villagers, as well as earning some extra money through farming. Soknao S. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before. She has requested this loan of $350 in order to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and an additional loom so that she and her mother can weave simultaneously and therefore increase production.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and an additional loom

loans.name: Agha Gul

texts.en: Agha Gul lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has one son. He has a shop where he sells clothes. Agha Gul has been selling clothes for five years. He has a lot of experience in his job. Now he would like to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new designs of clothes specially for women. He wants to attract more clients and make a good income to make a better future for his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy new designs of clothes

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla K. was married in 2001 and now has two sons. He husband earns some money raising pigs. The family all help with their other farming businesses, raising cows and planting vegetables.  Phalla K.'s mother, who lives with the family weaves silk for sale. 

In 2003 Mrs. Phalla K. started her own grocery business to bring in extra income for the family. She is applying for this $600 loan in order to purchase more items for her stock and expand her business. She has borrowed money from MAXIMA successfully six times before.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en: Mrs. Soksan P. was married in 2004 and now has one son. In 2001 Soksan P.'s mother taught her how to weave silk, and she started her own business that same year. Her husband works as a farmer in the village, growing vegetables and raising cows. She has borrowed the money from MAXIMA twice before, and she is now asking for a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase additional silk materials and thread in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Mrs. Cham-nan C. was married in 1984 and has four children, one daughter and three sons. She learned to weave silk from her elder sister in 1981 and she started her own silk weaving business in the same year. Her husband works growing rice, planting vegetables, and raising cows. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times previously. Now she is asking a loan for the amount of $400, which she intends to use to purchase silk materials and sewing thread so that she can expand her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Elsever

texts.en:
A. Elsever is 27 years old and the father of one child. He is from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Lachin region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives in Sumgayit city with his family. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He began his business 6 years ago.

Elsever is busy selling equipment necessary for mobile phones and different types of phones. He used his first loan of $500 from Normicro to rent a shop. Later, he borrowed $1000 and expanded his business. The loans were paid back on time.

Now, he needs to take out another loan. He would like to receive a $1500 loan in order to expand his business. He wants to buy different types of phones to sell. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy different types of phones to sell

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sophorn L. was married in 1979 and has four children, two daughters and two sons. His cousin taught him how to construct and repair wooden houses in 2004, and shortly afterwards he started his own business. His wife works spinning silk which she sells to people in her community. The family earns additional income raising cows and growing vegetables. 

Sophorn L. has received a loan from MAXIMA twice previously. He has applied for this $400 loan because his daughter would like to attend University in Phnom Penh and he needs extra money to pay for her fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees for his daughter

loans.name: Chinkiri

texts.en:
Mr. M. Chinkiri was married in 1990 and has 5 children, one daughter and four sons. He is in the business of driving a remork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) since 1990. He carries workers from the village to the garment factory site in Kandal Steung district and transports goods to the market. His wife is in the business of hair dressing at home.

He is requesting a loan of $200 from MAXIMA for the first time. He will use this loan to change his remork carriage.

loans.use: Changing a remork carriage

loans.name: Khac Cuong

texts.vi:
Mr Nguyễn Khắc Cương has 4 children who attend school. He is a farmer (rice & vegetables). Each year, he has 2 crops of rice and 4 crops of vegetables. He reserves part of the crops for his family consumption and sells the rest to have money to cover his family's expenses. He wishes to obtain a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice and vegetables. He will pay back the loan with money that he would make within 6 months accordingly to the loan terms.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Anh Nguyễn Khắc Cương có 4 con đang đi học. Công việc chính của anh là trồng lúa và rau. Mỗi năm anh có 2 vụ lúa và 4 vụ rau cho thu hoạch. Anh dành một phần vừa đủ các nông sản cho gia đình, còn lại thì bán lấy tiền trang trải cho sinh hoạt gia đình. Hiện tại anh đang mong muốn có khoản tiền để mua phân bón cho lúa và rau. Anh sẽ hoàn trả vốn vay từ việc bán các sản phẩm nông nghiệp của mình và trả dần trong 6 tháng như đã cam kết.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tahir

texts.ru:
Tahir H. was born in 1955 and has 4 children. He is a displaced person from the Nagorno Karabakh region. Currently he is living in Agsu. A difficult life forced him to think about starting a business to bring some profits to his family. Tahir decided to sell clothing. He turned to Normicro for a loan to start his business. He is hoping for a positive future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнов Тахир 1955 года рождения. Имеет четверых детей. Вынужденный переселенец из Нагорного Карабаха Азербайджанской Республики. Сейчас проживает в городе Ахсу. Трудная жизнь заставил его думать о бизнесе, чтобы принести немножко прибыл в семью. Тахир решил торговать одеждой. Для этого ему нужны были деньги и он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Этот человек надеятся на хорощий исход своей жизни.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Sokhom is a widow with two children, one daughter and one son. Since 2003, she has been in the business of buying and reselling vegetables at her house. Her children are construction workers in local communities and sometimes go to work in Phnom Penh. Due to the living conditions of the family, she could not send her children to school in higher education. Her two children did not finish primary school.

She is requesting a loan of $200 from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use this loan to expand her business by purchasing and reselling vegetables at home.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling vegetables at home

loans.name: Teasse

texts.pt:
Teasse is married and has 1 son. She lives with her husband and their child in Patrce Lumumba, a suburb of the city of Xai-Xai. She is a high school teacher and she also owns a convenience store that sells basic products. She will invest the loan amount to purchase chopped wood which has a high demand in the neighborhood where she lives, making it a business with profit potential. She joined the program this year and this will be her first loan and cycle. Her son is too young to attend school at this time. She plans to invest the profits from the chopped wood sale in her convenience store and to cover living expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Teasse e casada e mae de 1 filho. Ela vive com seu marido e seu filho em Patrice Lumumba, um bairro periferico da cidade de Xai-Xai. Ela e professora numa Escola do Ensino Primario do primeiro grau. Ela tem uma tenda onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Mas o emprestimo que ela vai tomar quer aplica-lo na compra de lenha para a venda, pois que no bairro onde ela vive ha muita procura de lenha. Sendo assim um negocio rentavel.Ela entrou para o programa de credito ainda este ano. Este emprestimo e o primeiro que ela vai tomar.Portanto esta no primeiro ciclo. O filho de Teasse ainda e pequeno. Por isso ainda nao vai a escola.Com os rendimentos da venda de lenha ela pretende aplica-los na sua tenda onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade e nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Teasse wishes to use the loan to purchase chopped wood for her retail business.

loans.name: Thi Phuong

texts.vi:
Ms Phượng is 47 years old. She lives in Phú Mẫn hamlet, in the town of Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married with 2 school aged children. Before she worked as a laborer for hire: vegetables picking, construction worker, sand bag carrier. She made an effort to save money to start a chicken raising business. Today she has a peep of egg laying chickens. Everyday she carries the eggs to the market to sell. She plans to repair the chicken coop and to expand her business. She really wishes to obtain a loan to realize her plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phượng 47 tuổi sống ở thôn Phú Mẫn, thị trấn Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Chị có chồng và có 2 con đang đi học. Trước đây, chị chủ yếu đi làm thuê như gánh cát, đánh vữa xây dựng, gặt hái thuê... Sau này, chị đã cố gắng tiết kiệm và nuôi được đàn gà đẻ. Chị dùng số lượng trứng thu được mỗi ngày mang ra chợ bán. Hiện tại chị đang muốn cải tạo lại chuồng gà cho phù hợp và rộng rãi hơn. Chị rất mong muốn có được khoản vay như đã đăng ký để thực hiện kế hoạch của mình.

loans.use: To repair the chicken coop.

loans.name: Vesile

texts.ru:
Vesile H. was born in 1978 in Agdam. She is a refugee and is not married. Currently she lives in Agsu. She sews leather jackets for women and men. This small business provides her with a small profit. Vesile will use her loan to replace her old sewing machine with a new one.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнова Васила родилась 1978 году в городе Агдам. Беженка,не замужем. Данный момент проживает в городе Ахсу. Она щьет кожанные куртки для женщин и мужчин. Этот маленький бизнес дает ей небольшой доход. Швейная машина старая и она хочеть купит новую. Васила собирается взять кредит и написала заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Thi Luyen

texts.vi:
Ms Luyến is 36 years old. She owns a general store selling basic goods like salt, cooking oil, salted fish ...etc. Her store is well located in a market so she has a lot of customers. She's requesting a loan because she would like to add more products to her store. She would put aside savings to pay back the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Luyến 36 tuổi kinh doanh hàng hoá tổng hợp phục vụ cho sinh hoạt gia đình như mắm, muối, dầu ăn, bột giặt...Chị có cửa hàng ngay giữa chợ nên việc kinh doanh của chị khá thuận lợi. Chị mong muốn có thêm khoản tiền để mở rộng số lượng hàng bán. Thu nhập có được từ cửa hàng chị sẽ tiết kiệm để thanh toán hoàn vốn.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Oeun was married in 1995 and has three children, one son and two daughters. She started her business in 2003. Her husband is a construction worker. He sometimes goes to work far from home and does not come home very often. Her two daughters are studying at the primary school in the village. The youngest son is at home.

She is requesting a loan of $100 from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use this loan to purchase additional vegetables and resell them in her village.

loans.use: Purchasing and reselling vegetables in village

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sochea was married in 1997 and has two children, one son and one daughter. In 2004, she started her business of buying and reselling grass to villagers for feeding their cows. Her husband is a construction worker. He goes to work far from home and does not come home very often. Her two children are studying at the primary school in the village.

She is requesting a loan of $100 from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use this loan to purchase electric wire and lamps for connecting with the public electric provider in Kandal Steung district.

loans.use:
Purchasing electric wire and lamps for connecting with the 
public electric provider

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sophoin was married in 1999 and has three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1980 and she started her silk production in the same year. She has trained her two daughters to weave silk as well. They are now assisting her in weaving silk at home. The youngest one is studying in year four in the local primary school. Her husband is a government official. He is currently working at the Department of Inspection.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and setting up two more looms for her daughters.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, as fees for
selecting and preparing silk on the loom and setting up two 
more looms for her daughters

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Navy was married in 1988 and has four children, one son and three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor after she got married in 1980. She started her silk production in the same year. She has trained her eldest daughter to weave silk and embroider as well. Her daughter is currently assisting her to embroider silk products at home. Her husband is a farmer and a wood construction worker, which he learned from his father in 1990. His oldest son helps him in farming and the construction business. Their other two daughters are still studying at the primary school in the village. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke A., is 51 years old, married with six children, and lives in Lagos. She sells drinks and is also  a hairdresser. She has been in business since 1989. She is currently a LAPO member and LAPO has helped ease her  financial stress. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more drinks, hair cream, weaves, and other products to help increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, hair cream and weaves for sale.

loans.name: Thi Chung

texts.vi:
Ms Chung is 23 years old. She is married and just had her first baby. She and her husband have a metal shop where they fabricate doors, windows, cupboards ...etc. They also do customized work based on their client's taste. Business is good as their customers like their products. Ms Chung is requesting a loan to buy material.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chung 23 tuổi đã có chồng và mới sinh con. Gia đình chị kinh doanh các mặt hàng nhôm, kính. Chị thiết kế sẵn các sản phẩm từ nhôm, kính như cửa ra vào, cửa sổ, tủ, chạn bát...để bán và cũng có những khách hàng đặt chị làm theo thiết kế của họ. Việc kinh doanh này khá thuận lợi vì khách hàng ưa dùng. Chị đang cần có thêm khoản tiền để mua thêm vật liệu về sản xuất.

loans.use: Mua thêm vật liệu nhôm, kính

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo O. lives in Lagos,is 50 years old, and a mother of five. She sells food and other items such as plantains and yam flour. LAPO has lifted her above poverty level by strengthening Fumilayo financially. She has been in business since 1987 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more food and elubo to help increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more Foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Sarum was married in 1995 and has three sons. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1992 and she started her silk production in the same year. She also continued training her husband to weave silk after she got married in mid 1995. He is now assisting to weave silk at home with his wife. In addition, he is currently also in the business of repairing bicycles since 2005, after learning form his father. With the existing businesses they have, all of their children can be sent to local school. They expect to support their children to continue studying in higher education as their living condition is getting better from day to day. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time of $150. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Nga was married in 1986 and has 3 children, two sons and one daughter. She is in the business of planting and selling tomatoes and cucumbers since 1994. She continues the farming business of her parents. Her husband is also in business with her. Their three children are living under their custody. However, only their oldest son continues his study in the faculty in Phnom Penh. Their other two sons are assisting the family to plant tomatoes and cucumbers.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times before. Now she is asking a loan of $200. She will use this loan to expand her farming business in planting and selling tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: Expanding in planting and selling tomatoes and cucumbers

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Borey was married in 1980 and has 3 children, one son and two daughters. She has been in the business of planting and selling flowers and vegetables since 1990. Her husband is also in the business of planting flowers and vegetables with her.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,100. She will use this loan to purchase one motorbike and buy fertilizer and pesticide for planting flowers and vegetables.

loans.use:
Purchasing one motorbike and buying fertilizer and 
pesticide for planting flowers and vegetables

loans.name: Felisha

texts.en: Felisha M., is 50 years old and lives in Lagos state. She is a divorced mother with five children. She sells food in a food market. She has been in the food business since 1987. Felisha is a LAPO member. She needs a loan of $400 to buy more food to increase the sales in her store.

loans.use: To buy more food for sale

loans.name: Monisola

texts.en: Monisola A. is 35 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Ajakaye in Lagos. Monisola sells electronics and also repairs them. She has been in this business since 1987 and needs a loan of $625 to buy more electrical material. LAPO has been a financial backbone to her business and needs the help to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more electrical material

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome makes all types of clothes and sells them to a local market . She is married and has three children aged 12,14 and 18 years. Her husband works with Salome in their business. Their income is too low to support the family. Salome is very hard working. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to buy materials and expand their business. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you.

loans.use: BUY MATERIALS AND EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia C. is 32 years old, married with 4 children. She lives in Alaba, Lagos State. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. This is a business she said she learned from her mother. She has been in this business since 1997. She needs the sum of $800 to enable her buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is a 38 year old married woman with 4 children. She hails from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.She sells baby products and has been a LAPO member for 4 years. Kehinde hope to receive a loan US$625 so that she can buy more baby things for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: I am happy to be a LAPO client says Mrs. Taiwo O., a married man with has 5 children, who lives in Lagos State She sells provision, drinks and recharge card of all networks and she has been in this business since 1994 .She is a member of LAPO union. She needs the loan of US$625 to buy more provision and recharge card for sale.
