loans.use: To buy more provision and drink

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is 36 years old, married with 4 children. She hails from the rural area in Ajangbadi, Lagos State Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and yam flour to her nearby communities. She has been in business for  the past 7 years and she is trustworthy because she has 100% repayment with LAPO loans during this time. She needs the loan of US$ 800 to expand her business and buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana makes all types of clothes and sells them in the local market. She is married and has one child age 3 years. Her husband works with a small group of fishermen. Juliana is very hard working. She is asking for a loan of USD 550 to buy new machines for her business. She proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buying new machines

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret O. is an experience businesswoman. She is 54 years old, married and a mother of 8 children. She sells birds and fish in the market. She is a member in one of the LAPO unions She has been in this business since 2003. Margaret needs the loan of US$1175 to buy more birds and fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more birds and fishes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is an artisan that works with Alpaca wool. She lives in the Andes zone of El Alto with her two children, the older of which has a job transporting cargo. The family covers expenses with the earnings from these two jobs.

Rosa requires the loan for the conversion of her small car which her son uses from gasoline to natural gas. Seeing that natural gas is cheaper than gasoline, this conversion will help her to reduce fuel expenses by 50%.

This will be Rosa’s third loan from Impro. The most recent loan was obtained through Kiva, so this will be the second loan that Rosa has applied for from Kiva lenders. This last loan has been paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es artesana en tejidos de lana de alpaca, vive con sus dos hijos el mayor trabaja como transportista de carga; estos son los ingresos con lo que cubren la manutención familiar; vive en la Zona Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la conversión de gasolina a Gas Natural Comprimido del carro pequeño que trabaja el hijo de doña Rosa. Esta conversión ayudará a reducir en un 50% de costo en combustible, en vista de que el Gas es más barato que la Gasolina.

Es el tercer crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario. El crédito anterior fue conseguido a través de Kiva, así que este nuevo crédito será el segundo que solicita a los financiadores de Kiva. El anterior crédito ha sido pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Conversion from gasoline to natural gas in her car.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth I. is 45 years of age, married with 5 children and comes from the rural area in Abule, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene in retail to the nearby market and to the community at large. She has been in business since 2004. She is a member of the  LAPO Union Elizabeth seeks a the loan of US$ 550 to buy more kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Yolanda C. lives with her husband and three children in their own home in Alto Llojeta on the western edge of La Paz. Yolanda earns her own wages sewing and elaborating wool blankets which she sells to the small venders of La Paz. Her husband is a driver in the public transportation lines. With previous loans they have built four new rooms on their home and painted a mural on the front wall. They are currently completing installation of basic utilities.

The requested loan will be used for the demolition of a deteriorated adobe wall and its reconstruction with bricks along with a support structure. This is the ninth time that Yolanda has requested a loan and a socioeconomic analysis continues to approve her for this loan due to the favorable classification. All of the previous loans have been fully canceled.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yolanda C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus tres hijos; la señora Yolanda trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando mantas de lana que vende a comerciantes minoristas de La Paz y su esposo es chofer en una línea de transporte público. Con los créditos anteriores realizaron la construcción de cuatro habitaciones completas y el amurallado frontal de su vivienda, a tiempo de instalar los servicios básicos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición de un muro posterior de adobe que se encuentra deteriorado por el tiempo, y la construcción de uno nuevo de ladrillo y estructura de contención Esta es la novena ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Todos los créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Construction of a brick wall.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Mr. Lucio C. lives with his wife and three children in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of La Paz. Lucio is employed by a small construction company and his wife sells clothing in a traveling shop. With previous loans the family has completed two rooms on the ground floor of their home and a concrete slab. This will be the 15th time that the family has requested a loan. A socioeconomic analysis shows them to have good credit and approves the loan. All of the previous loans have been fully repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Lucio C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Lucio es empleado en una microempresa de construcción y su esposa vende ropa en un puesto de venta ambulante en nuestra ciudad. Con créditos realizados anteriormente, realizaron la construcción de dos habitaciones en planta baja y una loza de cemento.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones en planta alta, en la losa de hormigón que tienen ya construido.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 23726

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary N. is  49 years old, married with 3 children. She comes from in Abule, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and foodstuffs and she has been in business since 2004. She needs the loan $550 to buy more crates of drinks and more foodstuffs to sell to increase the profit in her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & foodstuffs  for sale.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen I. is 39 years old, married with 4 children. She comes from the Lagos state. She travels from Lagos to Niger State to buy her river fish and sells to the neighbouring market. She has been in this business since the year 2000 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more river fish for sale

loans.name: Hasadia

texts.en:
Hasadia has a shop and sells all types of items. She is married and has five children ages 10, 14, 17, 23 and 25. Her husband is a security guard. Hasadia works very hard to improve her family's living standard. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy products for her business. She proposing to repay the loan in 12 months She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buying cooler box and plastic chairs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 35-year-old mother of two and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. She is a tailor by profession and has her shop in the Buguruni area. She specializes in ladies' and kids' clothes. She is in need of U.S. $750 to help her buy more tailoring machines and get ready for the coming Christmas season, in which she always gets many customers.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring machines to expand her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. is 40 years old and hails from Alaba, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells  used clothes.  She has been in business since 1993. Helen is asking for a loan of $800 to buy more  used clothes for sale. She believes this will help her make more profit in her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 27-year-old mother of one and a resident of the Kisiwani area in Dar es Salaam city. She has been running a salon for the past three years. She now wants to expand her quite small salon, so as to cater to more customers at a time. She wants to buy more dryers, chairs, and other hair treatment equipment. She is in need of U.S. $375 to help accomplish at least part of this.

loans.use: To buy equipment to expand her beauty salon

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola A. is 31 years old, married with 2 children. She sells provisions and  foodstuffs and she also grinds pepper for sale. She is from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Bukola has been in her business since 2002 and needs the loan of $400 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs

loans.name: John

texts.en: John M. (the first one seated on the bench in the photo) is a 44-year-old father of five and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. For the past three years, he has been running a business selling charcoal. The government is now putting strict rules on cutting down trees, which affects his business. Because of this, he wants to expand his store so as to accommodate more stock, which will help him to stock enough charcoal to keep the business alive in the "no tree cutting season." He is in need of U.S. $375 to help expand his store.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Sadikat

texts.en: Sidikat O. is 45 years old, married with 3 children. She sells vegetable oil and rice in her neighboring market. She has been in business since the year 2000 and needs the loan $250 to buy more vegetable oil and bags of rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil and bags of rice

loans.name: Kissah

texts.en: Kissah is a 31-year-old mother of one and a resident of  the Buguruni area, a suburb of Dar es Salaam. She runs a beauty salon and boutique, which she has been running for the past six years. She is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Organized entrepreneurship and business management skills training. The training helped her improve her business ideas, and she is in need of U.S. $400 to help her expand her salon to cater to more clients.

loans.use: To expand her beauty salon

loans.name: Akai

texts.en: Akai is a mother of three and a hardworking businesswoman who runs a shop selling both new and used clothes in the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. She buys her new and used clothes from wholesale traders in Kariakoo, and resells to her clients. Some pay cash and others pay later, sometimes in installments. She is in need of U.S. $375 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her clothing business

loans.name: Sherifat

texts.en: Sherifat A. is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. She hails from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sherifat sells  cooked food and pure water and minerals. She needs the loan of $400 to buy a refrigerator for her minerals and pure water. She has been in business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy fridge to cool sachet water and minerals

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam  T. is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells provisions and food items She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Mariam has been in business since the year 1999 and needs the loan $400 to buy more provision and food items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a 32-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Kisiwani area in Dar es Salaam city. She runs a small restaurant, a business she has been doing for the past three years. She now wants to expand it into a quite bigger restaurant so as to cater to more clients. She is in need of U.S. $325 in order to buy more tables and chairs to furnish the place.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 37-year-old father of two and a resident of the Kisiwani area in Dar es Salaam city. Juma sells both used and new shoes, for ladies and men. He has been in this business for the past six years and owns a shop in the Kisiwani area, where he does all his business. He is in need of U.S. $325 to help him expand his stock and his business.

loans.use: To expand his shoe business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama has a shop and sells all types of cosmetics. She is married and has 3 children ages 19, 22 and 31 years. Her husband works with her in business. Salama is very hard working. She is asking for a loan of USD 450 to buy a show case and office table for her business. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: Buy showcase and office table

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda has a small business selling women’s clothing and shoes as well as children’s shoes from her attractively-arranged kiosk at the Albion Rhinok (market) in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Nadezhda’s business, which she has had for about five years, provides most of the income for her and her husband who also works but does not receive a very large salary. In a typical month, she makes about $700 in profit. Nadezhda has two daughters who are married. She tries to help her grandchildren when she can. Not long ago, Nadezhda’s father passed away, which left her with some unanticipated expenses.

Nadezhda has requested a short-term loan of $500 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase new inventory in bulk. We are happy for this opportunity to help Nadezhda continue to operate her business profitably and earn the valuable income she and her family need.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is a 29-year-old mother of two and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. She has been running a restaurant in the area for close to three years. She is in need of U.S. $225 to help her buy more tables and chairs, so as to cater to the increasing number of customers.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mrs. Mebel E. is 47 years old, married with 6 children. She sells female clothes and has 17 years experience doing it. Mebel has been a LAPO member for 6 years. She is soliciting for the loan amount of $325 to enable her buy more female clothes for sale. She comes from Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sale

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda earns a living with a small clothing business selling inexpensive sports apparel. She has been in the clothing business for over four years. Prior to selling sports clothes, she operated a second-hand clothing business. She decided to change her type of business after recognizing the demand for sports apparel. Nadezhda has three children and has used the income from her business to help her children. She was able to help her oldest daughter with her education expenses, and her other daughter was able to go to China on a dance contract that required a financial outlay. Nadezhda’s son is currently in the Ukrainian army.

Nadezhda has requested a loan of $500 to help purchase new inventory for her business. She’d like to purchase in bulk, which can save her time, money, and effort and help maximize her profits. In the future Nadezhda hopes to be able to expand her business with more retail space. This loan will help as she works toward her goals and provides for her family.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria A. is 47 years old, married with 5 children. She has been a LAPO client for 6 years. She is from the eastern part of the country but lives in Benin City. Maria deals in clothing and shoes and has been in this business since 1992. She needs the loan amount of $1175 for the purchase of clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more  clothing and shoes

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia O. sells drinks and provisions to people living in her community. She is 42 years old, married with 4 children. She has been in business since 1997. She hails from Edo State. She needs the sum of $550 to buy more drinks and provision for sale. Patricia is a LAPO member. She says she learned  this business from her mother.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose I. is into wholesale sales of flour and oil. She is 32 years old, married with 4 children.  Rose has had her business for 6 years and started her own in 2003. She is also the secretary of her union. Rose needs the loan of $800 to buy more flour and oil for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more flour and oil for sale

loans.name: Adellah

texts.en:
Adellah own a ladies salon. She is single and has one child who is 2 years old. She is very hard working in business. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy new machines for the salon. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa owns a shop selling all items. She is a widow and has four children aged 2, 9, 13 and 15. She works very hard to improve her family's living standard. She is asking for a loan to expand her business. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

texts.en:
Patricia owns a shop selling all items. She is single, she is a hard worker, and her wish is to be a successful business woman. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy products for her business and specifically, to buy a big showcase. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buying showcare and hangers

texts.en:
Rebecca sells all types of clothing in her shop. She is a widow and has 6 children ages 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, and 20 years old. She is a very hard worker for her family and business. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to improve her business standard. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha owns a small restaurant. She is married and has four children ages 12, 15, 18, and 20 years. Her husband is jobless. Asha works very hard for her family. She has a dream to be a great business woman. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy plastic chairs and catering materials. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buying plastic chairs and catering materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Packaging material can get pretty creative in Ghana. Comfort K. is the first in her area of the market to start selling packaging materials. She sells the typical black plastic bags that are used in commerce in Ghana, old unread newspapers from abroad for wrapping bread, plastic bags used for drinking water, and various other products used by businesses inside the market.

She started her business six years ago with just $700. Over the past few years she has been able to keep her business running by buying most of her products on credit. However, lately her suppliers have been demanding money upfront, rather than allowing her to pay after she has sold the packaging materials. For the most part, she has been able to meet her suppliers’ demands, but she will need a loan to purchase 17 bundles of water bags. She has no doubt that these bags will sell. Many water sellers in the market come to her for the bags.

Currently, Comfort is using her extra income to support her 3 children through college. They are studying agriculture and nursing. They are all graduating within the next few years. Once they do, Comfort expects to invest her extra income into her business.

loans.use: To purchase 17 bundles of water bags

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana takes a tro-tro (Ghanaian mini-bus) from 10:00pm to 4:00am every 2-4 weeks just so she can purchase the best cloth for her business. She buys and distributes polyester and lace cloth to businesses in and around the Kumasi central market. When she has extra time, Diana walks around busy areas in Kumasi selling the cloth that she is able to balance on the top of her head.

This is Diana's second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust. She used the first loan to jump-start her business by purchasing $650 of polyester and lace cloth. Diana wants to expand her business with your loan in order to purchase undershirts and boxer shorts.

With the money she earns, Diana hopes to one day own her own store. It can be very tiring to her health distributing products after spending all night on a tro-tro. She has also expressed that she has some pain in her neck and head from carrying products to sell on the streets.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing undershirts and boxer shorts.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Mr. M. is a 39 year-old married man with three children. He is a farmer and lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Rafael purchases calves, breeds them and sells them to the butcher, who works in the local big market. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of Rafael's family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Rafael has to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. This summer he applied for $500 to buy four calves. He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: Rafael would like to buy calves to breed and sell.

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.es:
I have already one year experience selling new and used clothing. It is the source of income for my family. I would like to invest in my business and start selling other items like shoes, toys, and winter clothing. I request a loan of $1000 to buy more merchandise for this business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada tengo ya mas de un año con el negocio. Es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Me gustaría mucho invertir en el negocio y empezar a vender mas cosas como zapatos y juguetes y ropa de frió. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía para el negocio.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Alicia Vargas

texts.en:
Alicia is a 34-year-old mother of three who sells homemade pastries, specializing in birthday and wedding cakes. Her husband owns and operates a small general store within walking distance of their home. Alicia’s youngest child, a two-year-old girl, is still at home with Mom, while her two elder children, a girl and boy ten and five years old, respectively, attend school.

Currently, Alicia sells her cakes from inside the family’s home but is planning on building a small luncheon counter next to her husband’s store, where she can display her pastries but also serve an assortment of food. She explains that her pastry sales are quite profitable but the quantity of cakes Alicia sells in a given month varies with the number of special events celebrated in her community.

With her loan Alicia hopes to invest in more of the ingredients she uses in her cakes, but also to begin purchasing the construction materials for her business’s storefront.

loans.use: Purchase of Pastry Ingredients and Construction Materials for new store

loans.name: Elida Bautista

texts.en:
Elida sells children’s clothing from her home, specializing in clothing for young children and babies.

Elida is forty-one years old and a single mother of four, three girls and a boy, all of whom attend school except for her two-year old, who is still at home with Mom. Elida sells her clothing from home, sometimes visiting neighbors in her community door-to-door. Her home is on a steep hill and, in the future, Elida hopes she can open her own clothing shop in her community where customers will no longer be greeted by a sudden slope.

Elida would like to add new merchandise to her current clothing line, particularly outfits for older children. In addition, Elida plans to use her loan to buy clothing in bulk, adding more items to her stock and improving her profit margin, as well.

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing in bulk quantities

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
I have more than 4 years of experience of selling sportswear for all ages.  I also sell sport accessories.  This business is the source of income for my family.  My wife and I want to invest in more sports merchandise for the  coming winter season.  I seek a loan of $1200 to buy more merchandise for our business. 

 Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer. 


Tengo ya más de 4 años con el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva para todo tipo de edades, también vendo accesorios deportivos. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo queremos invertir le mas el negocio de mercancía de deportiva de temporada de invierno. Solicito un préstamo de $1.200.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Hortensia A. owns a paper and school supply store. “I have owned the store for more than two years and it is the main source of income for my family. I sell all types of school supplies, but I am lacking a copy machine and certain merchandise. I request a loan for $1,000.00 to purchase a copier and more merchandise.”

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hortencia A. tiene una tienda de papelería. Tengo ya mas de 2 años con mi papelería este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Vendo todo tipo de artículos para la escuela. Pero me esta haciendo falta una copiadora y mas mercancías. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de la copiadora y mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of a copier and merchandise.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. Jose Gonzalez sells new and used clothing in the city, Nuevo Laredo. “I have been in this business for more than ten years. This business is very important to me since it is the source of income for my family. Both my wife and I work selling clothing. I would like to sell tennis equipment without reducing my capital. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to purchase tennis merchandise, shoes, and other types of footwear.”

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. José G. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.Tengo ya más de 10 años en este negocio. Es muy importante para mi el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Me gustaría vender tenis deportivos sin descapitalizarme. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía tenis, zapatos y todo tipo de calzado.

loans.use: Purchase of new tennis equipment.

loans.name: Ma. De La Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de la Luz has worked in the business of food sales for more than 3 years. This business has been the main source of income for her family. “My children and I all work in the business. I would like to fix the place up and purchase more furniture so that my clients are more comfortable while they eat the food I sell. I am requesting a loan for $1,000.00 for the purchase of furniture for my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria De La Luz tiene ya más de 3 años en el negocio de venta de comida. Este negocio ha sido la fuente de ingresos de su familial. En el negocio trabajamos uno de mis hijos y yo, quiero acondicionar mejor el local y comprar mobiliario para que mis clientes estén más cómodos al estar consumiendo la comida que yo vendo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de mobiliario para el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Yaver

texts.en: Yaver A. owns a small market in the middle of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, married and has two children. Yaver has been engaged in this business sector since 1992. His wife helps him in his job. He thinks that everybody who wants to establish his or her job must borrow a credit. Yaver wants a $1200 loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Yaver would like to expand his market.

loans.name: Baylar

texts.en: Baylar I. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He owns a chemist’s shop. Baylar established his pharmacy seven years ago. He needs $900 to buy more kinds of medicine and expand his business.

loans.use: Baylar would like to expand his chemist's business (pharmacy).

loans.name: Yaver

texts.en: Yaver G. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city of Nagorno-Karabakh, western Azerbaijan. He settled with his wife and two children in Beylagan city in 1992. Yaver is a taxi driver. He needs a $700 loan to repair his car.

loans.use: Yaver would like to repair his car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Zibeyda

texts.en: Zibeyda M. lives with her husband and two children in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. Zibeyda’s husband (her husband is pictured) makes doors and fances in his yard from iron. He has ten years experience in this business. They need a $1200 loan to buy more materials for their job.

loans.use: Zibeyda would like to expand her husband's door- and fence-making business.

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old, married and has one son. He owns a chemist’s (pharmacy) in front of central policlinic of Beylagan. He established his business four years ago. Rauf needs a $500 loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Rauf would like to expand his chemist's business (pharmacy).

loans.name: Menena

texts.en:
Menena, 26, originally from Haiti, lives in Batey Palavé in San Cristobal. A 'batey' is a company town consisting of barracks and a few houses. They are located close to cane fields so that groups of workers can live near the site of their labor (usually called ‘ingenio’). In the past, many immigrants from Haiti came to work the sugar fields in Dominican Republic in order to make a living. Currently the ‘ingenio’ is out of service, but the ‘batey’ houses Haitians and Dominicans.

Menena is living with two of her children. The eldest is living in Haiti with her father. Menena was separated from her husband two years ago. Since then, she has been working as a housekeeper. As money earned from that job couldn’t cover all the expenses of the family, she has been obliged to invest a part of her salary in the purchase of jeans and shoes, which she resells door-to-door in her community. Currently, she works more than she sells. She wants to invert that situation and convert the sale of clothes to her principal source of income.

She is requesting funds to purchase enough clothes and shoes to augment her sales volume and have enough money to keep on taking care of her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to supply her small business and make it progress.

loans.name: Mercedes Abreu

texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years old and she has seven grown-up children. They all are working and have their own families. She lives with her husband, a retired officer.

Mercedes dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of natural juices, ‘arepa’ (fried or baked corn), sandwiches, coconut, and pastry-making. She has been running this activity for two years with the purpose of staying active at home and not depending only on other people. She operates the business close to her house, since she doesn’t want to get tired by walking a lot.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to continue with this small business, which has made a big change in the couple's living conditions.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will use the funds to buy raw materials to keep on preparing and selling food and natural juices.

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is 43 years old and is the mother of two boys. Her husband works with dustcarts picking up rubbish.

Altagracia dedicates herself to the sale of women’s underwear. She has been doing this kind of business for more than ten years. She has a well-established clientele; many of them live in other provinces. She gets the goods from Elías Piña, a city on the border of Haiti. Sometimes she buys the products in Haiti.

This entrepreneur wants to enlarge her business. She has applied for a loan to acquire large amounts of underwear so she can noticeably augment her sales volume and increase profits. Extra money will help Altagracia better provide education and food for her two sons.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy large quantities of underwear so that  the entrepreneur can increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Yennifer

texts.en:
Yennifer, 42, is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with seven children (two boys and five girls). The children attend the public school of the town. With profits from her sales activity, she has been able to buy a small piece of land and build a house made of stone.

This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of pants, shirts and shoes. She has been doing this business fore more than sixteen years. She says that with incomes from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Yennifer is looking for funds to purchase wholesale clothes to sell during the Christmas period. She believes that it’s a great opportunity for her to increase her income and go on taking care of her very large family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to sell during the Christmas period in order to increase her income

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina sells snacks in the downtown area of her native land. Due to her continue pursue of progress and success, she has been able to make a living by doing this with the help and support from her husband. Due to her great customer service, she has decided that it's time to increase her merchandise which means she needs to purchase another mobile cart to be able to haul all her merchandise with ease.

Let's help this great lady so that she can realize her dream!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El continuo espíritu de progreso de Faustina, la han llevado a desempeñarse como vendedora ambulante de golosinas en la avenida principal de su tierra natal. Su preocupación por incrementar su nivel de vida familiar la llevo a desempeñarse en esta actividad con el firme apoyo y compromiso de su querido esposo. Por la buena atención que brinda a las personas de su ciudad ha decidido incrementar sus ventas con la compra de un triciclo más; con el podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de productos y podrá movilizarlos con mayor libertad y comodidad. Hagamos posible la petición de esta noble dama para que pueda concretar sus planes en mente.

loans.use: To purchase a second mobile cart

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is 36 years old. She is a caring and dedicated mother. She has 3 children. She lost her husband about 8 years ago. She suffered a great deal, but since then she has been there for her children not only as a mother but also as a friend. She works very hard in her small grocery (convenience) store. Thanks to the great location and her good customer service, her small grocery store has proven to be profitable. She has been able to support her family. The wish of this hard-working single mom is to increase her inventory and to therefore increase sales and to make a profit. Marcelina awaits your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina de 36 años de edad, es madre cariñosa, emprendedora y muy dedicada al cuidado de sus 3 hijos, desafortunadamente perdió a su esposo hace 8 años; este hecho le causó mucho sufrimiento y desde entonces se convirtió en amiga y madre de sus hijos; trabajando arduamente en su bodeguita de ventas de abarrotes y coca.Este pequeño negocio que gracias a la ubicación estratégica y al buen trato que brinda a sus asiduos clientes está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos, que la llenan de satisfacción porque le permite cubrir plenamente los gastos de su hogar.El deseo de esta madre emprendedora es aumentar y ampliar el stock de su mercadería con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas diarias para así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familiaMarcelina espera tu respuesta y apoyo desinteresado.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Delia Teresa

texts.es:
Señora Delia is 37 years old. She is a single mom. She has been a seamstress for the past 3 years. She sells women apparel out in the streets. Thanks to her motivation, strength and dedication she has been able to support her family. She additionally pays for the schooling of her 2 teen-age sons. The dream of this hard-working single mother is to increase her merchandise and to offer a wide variety of products to her clients since at this time her products are in high demand. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan to purchase basic material to sew camisoles, underskirts, etc. made out of flannel. She commits to repay this loan within 6 months. With your help, Delia can accomplish her objective in a short period of time!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delia de 37 años de edad, es madre separada y desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la confección y venta de enaguas en forma ambulatoria; gracias a su esfuerzo, entereza y dedicación está cubriendo satisfactoriamente los gastos que genera su familia y además le permite ofrecerle a sus dos queridos hijos, adolescentes, la cobertura de sus estudios superiores.El deseo de esta madre emprendedora es aumentar la producción y variedad de su mercadería que por estas épocas está teniendo mucha demanda. Para cumplir con sus objetivos requiere un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de materia prima para la confección de sus enaguas, buzos, y chompas basados en tela polar, Así mismo , Delia promete rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses. Con vuestra colaboración Delia podría cumplir en muy corto tiempo sus objetivos.

loans.use: To purchase basic material to increase inventory and to make a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Eudocia Georgina

texts.es:
Since childhood, Doña Georgina has worked in the farm. Her discipline and dedication have made her a a strong-will woman with high morals, a good heart and good energy. Doña Georgina is full of energy each day, even though she lives by herself, she gets strength and energy from her grandchildren who come to visit her often. She is very active in her community and would like to develop her leadership skills further. Recently, the town people selected her as their representative in the community, and since then she has been able to achieve many things benefiting the entire community. In order to support herself, she raises small animals, and she also grows potato and corn. Her inmense motivation to succeed and to survive each day, have led her to wanting to purchase a small milking cow to sell the milk for profit. Be part of Doña Georgina's dream!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Georgina desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores y quehaceres del campo y esta formación que obtuvo en su hogar con mucha dedicación y disciplina la ha llevado a ser una mujer de alto valor, por su sencillez, corazón y fortaleza.Doña Georgina está cada día más animosa, a pesar de que ahora vive sola, ya que disfruta de la visita de sus nietos y ahora trabaja aún más porque desarrolla sus capacidades de liderazgo en su comunidad.Hace poco la eligieron como gobernadora y es tan eficiente su gestión que ha logrado beneficios para su comunidad. Para su sostén diario se dedica a la crianza de animales, también se dedica al cultivo de papa y maíz y las enormes ganas de sobresalir y procurarse bienestar la llevan a desear adquirir una vaquita para extraer la leche para su comercialización e incremento de su nivel de vida..Solidarízate con Doña Georgina para que pueda alcanzar su anhelo..

loans.use: To purchase a small milking cow

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es:
Rosa Danelia is a courageous woman who's worked hard to survive and provide an education for her children. She has a store in the Ivan Montenegro Market in the city of Managua, where she started her business 5 years ago with scarce capital of $160.

As head of the family, she has fought to carry on and provide a better future for her children. Before opening her canteen, she sold clothing from her home. However, this was not enough to establish stability for her family.

Her business has grown thanks to support from CEPRODEL. Rose has been working with CEPTRODEL around 1½ year.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Danelia ha sido una esforzada mujer que ha trabajado duro para sobrevivir y darle educacion a sus hijos. Ella tiene un puesto de comercio ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua el cual empezo hace 5 años con un capital apenas de US$160.00.

Jefa de familia, le ha tocado luchar para que sus hijos tengan un mejor porvenir. Antes de abrir su cafetin ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa en su casa de habitacion, sin embargo este ingreso no fue suficiente para lograr estabilidad para su familia.

Su negocio ha crecido gracias al apoyo de CEPRODEL (su atencion y credito oportuno). Rosa lleva trabajando con CEPRODEL alrededor de 1½ año

loans.use: To buy products like gasoline, juice, purified water, confectionery, etc.

loans.name: Dayie Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dayie is an enterprising woman for whom the key to success is good, hard, strenuous work. She worked for six years and with the savings was able to open a store in the small dwelling that she shares with her mother. Now, after significant effort and time spent, she is able to see the fruits of her labor and of the high level of attention she gave to her sales. It is for this reason that she plans to continue progressing and increasing the quantity of goods she sells in her small store. She dreams of owning her own home and having the satisfaction of having succeeded in raising her only two children to be self supporting. Let us help Dayie continue on the path of progress.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Dayie es una mujer emprendedora consciente de que solo el trabajo esforzado es la llave del éxito, estuvo trabajando desde hace 6 años y con sus ahorros pudo abrir una tienda en la pequeña morada que habita con su madre. Luego de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo ahora puede observar los frutos de la calidad de atención que la caracteriza y de las ofertas que otorga. Es por ello que tiene en mente seguir progresando e incrementando aún más la cantidad de artículos de su pequeño centro de ventas porque sueña con tener su propia casita y la satisfacción de haber logrado que sus dos únicos hijos puedan sostenerse por sí mismos.Apoyemos a Dayie a seguir en el camino del progreso.

loans.use: Increase in capital for the purchase of basic goods so that she can better satisfy the needs of her dear clients.

loans.name: Jacqueline Concepció

texts.es:
Jacqueline is an entrepreneurial woman who works everyday to find a better future for her two children, despite the arduous chores she performs in her small shop. She is always looking to make her work better and endure client’s satisfaction. Her clients are her neighbors. She remembers the previous years, when she partnered with her neighbor so they could both invest and work in their small shop, with time, the shop grew, so now they each have their own independent shop. Now, she sees her future with great expectations. She wants to grow her business and through her profits, build her house and renovate it so her children will be able to enjoy everyday. This is why Jacqueline requests a loan of $1000 dollars, so she can make her dream come true. In this time she will invest her money in buying more merchandise for her small shop. Let’s give our support for Jacqueline to continue forward in her noble dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Jacqueline es una mujer emprendedora que cada día trabaja por buscar un mejor futuro para sus 2 hijos, a pesar de las arduas tareas que desempeña día a día en la atención de su casa no ha descuidado su trabajo en su pequeña bodega, siempre busca alcanzar mejoras para la atención de sus clientes que son sus propios vecinos. Recuerda los años anteriores en que se asoció a una vecina, amiga suya, para poder invertir el dinero que ambas consiguieron trabajando un buen tiempo para esta pequeña tienda; con el tiempo ambas han crecido y su vecina también abrió una tienda de manera independiente. Ahora observa su futuro con grandes expectativas de hacer crecer su centro de trabajo y a través de las ganancias que genere ésta construir su casa y mejorarla para darle una mayor comodidad a sus hijos que la motivan diariamente.Es por ello que Jacqueline solicita un préstamo de 1000 dólares para hacer realidad su anhelo e invertirá en esta ocasión en la compra de más mercadería para su bodega.Pongamos de nuestro apoyo para que Jacqueline siga adelante en el cumplimiento de sus nobles anhelos.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

loans.name: Betty Julia

texts.es:
Betty is very optimistic, despite the economic hardships that she’s had, she works incessantly to provide a better future for her 3 children. Two of her children are attending university and the youngest one wants to serve his nation. All of this requires a strong investment on Betty’s part and this is why she decided open a little store four years ago, so she could help with the household income. This business has let her welfare rise and provide for her children’s education. Currently, she is also working to help her husband who is in the process of recovery from a very serious surgery, and he has not been able to work as a musician as he used to. With the purpose of seeing her family better every day, Betty will continue to strive to move forward and not let life’s difficulties defeat her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Betty es muy optimista y a pesar de las carencias económicas por las que ha pasado trabaja incesantemente por un futuro mejor para sus 3 hijos que están con muchos deseos de superarse, dos de sus hijos ya son universitarios y el menor quiere ser un servidor de su patria. Todo esto requiere de una inversión fuerte, es por ello que Betty decidió abrir una pequeña tienda hace cuatro años para ayudar e incrementar los ingresos económicos de su hogar. Así mismo estos le han permitido incrementar el nivel de vida y educación de sus hijos, ahora también trabaja con el propósito de mejorar la salud de su querido esposo que se está recuperando de una dolorosa operación y que por un tiempo no podrá ejercer su oficio de músico.Con el propósito de ver cada vez mejor a su querida familia seguirá esforzándose . Apoyemos a Betty a seguir adelante y a no dejarse vencer por las adversidades de la vida.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para consolidar su pequeño negocio e incrementar el nivel de vida y salud de su querida familia.

loans.name: Alejandra Eduarda

texts.es:
Doña Alejandra, siempre ha sido trabajadora desde muy niña y a lo largo de su vida se ha mantenido ligada a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas en su tierra natal de Pomacancha, al norte de Jaula. Sus grandes esfuerzos y ganas de vivir la han llevado a ser una de las mejores ganaderas y agricultoras de su zona; su motivación siempre fue el amor de su familia y por ellos ha continuado incansablemente con sus labores.Doña Alejandra fue madre soltera y es por ellos que sola afrontó este rol tan abnegado: y también al cuidado de su anciana madre que hace poco murió y ahora vive sola pero con el apoyo y cariño de sus hijos. Doña Alejandra desea aprovechar este tiempo para comprar forraje para su ganado y semillas para esta época de siembra, es por ello que solicita un préstamo que será de mucha ayuda para sus actividades.Anticipadamente Doña Alejandra agradece el apoyo de tu noble corazón.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer.

Mrs. Alejandra has been a hard worker since childhood. She has always been linked to agricultural and livestock activities in her home town of Pamacancha, north of Jaula. Her enormous effort and love of life have leaded her to be one of the best farmers in her area. Her motivation has always been the love she has for her family and because of them she has continued with her work incessantly. Mrs. Alejandra is a single mother and this is why she took such a self-sacrificing job. She would also take care of her old-aged mother, who just recently passed away. Now, Mrs. Alejandra lives on her own, although her children support her and care for her. Mrs. Alejandra wishes to buy forage for her cattle and seeds, since now is planting season. She is asking for a loan to continue with her activities. Mrs. Alejandra thanks in advance the support from your good heart.

loans.use: Compra de forraje y semillas para incrementar la ganancia de sus actividades.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C., age 62, lives with her husband and six children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She runs a stand in Phnom Penh city selling rice, making around $3 each day.  Her husband owns a grinding mill and hires it to his neighbors, earning a meagre income.  Two of her children work selling rice with her; two others run a store, and the rest attend school. Mrs. Sam C. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rice to expand her inventory in order to meet the growing demands of her clients.  (Mrs. Sam C. with the black shirt is pictured with one of her daughters).

loans.use: To purchase more rice to expand her inventory

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem S., age 35, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband (who is pictured because Mrs. Hem S. is unavailable) in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together on their rice paddy, growing crops and vegetables and raising pigs. They generally earn around $2 each day.  Two of her children are currently employed at a garment factory and the rest are enrolled in school. Mrs. Hem S. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase 12 pigs, seed and fertilizer for her farm. She is confident and believes that her business will show improvement after five to six months.

loans.use: To purchase 12 pigs, seed and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a low-income vulnerable person. She is 29, married with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Nasiba and her husband (he is pictured here) operate a trading stand in the local bazaar and sell fruits and vegetables. She cannot develop her business because she has no collateral to get a loan from commercial banks. That is why she has applied for a US$ 600 collateral-free loan from Normicro's Saatli branch. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will help her to expand the volume of goods she sells. The higher income could help her to develop her business and support her family independently.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhum S., 28, is married with 2 school-aged children and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. To provide for her family, Mrs. Chhum S. works on her plot of farmland growing rice crops, while her husband works in construction, earning together around $3 per day on average. This couple is requesting a loan of $500 to replace their old, ruined grinding mill so that they won’t only grind their family crops but also can make additional profits when the mill is needed by their neighbors.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill to replace her old and ruined one.

loans.name: Temor Shah

texts.en: Temor Shah lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young and talented boy. He lives with his own family. He has a retail shop where he works. He is in university, and he works part-time in his shop. Now he wants to increase his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, twin-packs, and triple-packs to complete his stock and enlarge his business. He wants to make a good income to help his family and make a better future for himself. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory such as boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, twin-packs, and triple-packs to complete his stock.

loans.name: Mohammad Aslam

texts.en: Mohammad Aslam lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own family. He has a retail shop, and his business is the only source of income for his family. He lost two of his young sons during the war in Afghanistan, and his other two sons are small and in school. He is responsible for his family. He wants to increase his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, baskets, and some extra purchases. He wants to make a good income and help his family more.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, and baskets.

loans.name: Trinity Women's Lending Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a very friendly and hardworking businessperson. She is the chairperson of Trinity Women's Lending Group. In the photo, she is the one sitting in the front row on the right. The lending group meets once a week in one of the classrooms at the Mperewe High School, a private school. The members meet to discuss topics concerning their loans and businesses. This is also a time to do a lot of social networking. Since all are business owners, they tend to be very involved in their village and are often on other committees that support the well-being of their communities.

The village of Mperewe is located on a very busy road on the outskirts of Kampala. Although the road bisects the town, it is very good for roadside businesses. The roadsides are alive with people selling hot food from small charcoal cookers, beverages from small huts, and bananas that they carry in baskets on their heads, while boda boda (motorbikes) drivers offer rides as people exit matatoos (passenger vans). Everywhere there are people walking, visiting, trading, etc. It is a very vibrant place to be.

Sarah owns the Benoneto Shoe Wholesale, a wholesale shoe business. With the holiday season approaching, she is interested in increasing her inventory of shoes. This is one of the busiest times for her business.

loans.use: Sarah plans to use her loan to buy more shoes for her shoe business. The holidays are approaching, and this is her busiest season.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Felismina Amélia S. was born on April 25, 1968 in Maputo. She is 39 years old and studied until the 4th grade. She supports 7 people. She was raised by her parents. When she got married she had to work to help her husband support the family. She worked buying products in South Africa and reselling them in Maputo. 3 years later she started working in a lumber business with her sister.

With the loan of 12,000mt wants to buy more wood to resell. She has been able to sell as much as 3.000mt a day, mostly in the morning. The lumber which brings the most profit is the Chanfuta. She is confident she will be able to repay the loan. Her monthly profit margin is about 5,000mt. With this money she paying for a small lot and supports her family. In the future, she wants her business to grow.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro do Aeroporto “B”-Maputo Cliente: Felismina Amélia S. Actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 12.000,00mt Aplicação: Compra de Madeira para revenda Início: 08/10/2007 Fim: 30/01/2009 Felismina Amélia S. , nasceu aos 25 de Abril de 1968 em Maputo tem 39 anos de idade estudou apenas até 4ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira dos seus pais, vive com 7 pessoas na sua responsabilidade e seu marido vive com outra mulher. Passou a sua infância junto dos seus pais até aos 17 anos altura que fica grávida e passou a viver com seu marido.Teve que começar a fazer algo para ajudar o marido no sustento dos filhos iniciando o negócio transfronteiriço onde comprava frutas na R.S.A ( Republica de Africa do Sul ) e vendia nos Mercados de Maputo 3 anos depois, a Irmã lhe influência a deixar este negócio e iniciar o negócio de madeira negócio este que desenvolve até então. Não tem formação nesta actividade e até ao momento não tem nenhum empregado e ela pessoalmente em que está em frente do negocio. Com o empréstimo de 12,000.00mt investiu na compra de madeira para a revenda e abre o seu negócio as 7 horas e para chegar lá vai a pé porque fica perto de casa.Adiquiri a mercadoria nas serrações nos arredores da cidade e tem alugado uma viatura para o transporte da mesma , o melhor período para o seu negócio tem sido nas manhãs e a receita média diária tem sido de 3,000.00mt,a madeira que dá mais lucro é a Chanfuta , e faz registo das suas vendas.

Ainda não encara nenhuma dificuldade no seu negócio pelo que não terá nenhuma dificuldade no pagamento do crédito , actualmente o negócio está num bom estado e a margem de lucro mensal é de 5,000.00mt . Com os rendimentos de negócio está pagando um terreno,amplia o negócio e sustenta a família. Futuramente almeja fazer crescer o seu negócio e para tal precisará de empréstimo. Em geral o empréstimo modificou o seu negócio pelo que aumentou o volume da mercadoria e está entusiasmada.

loans.use: to increase stock of wood to sale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. He has 3 children. They are going to school. He has a small bakery shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new bakery machine. He also wants to paint the shop and renovate it by expanding the area. He plans to hire two unemployed people to work with him in order to increase his income, develop himself, and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new bakery machine

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suriati

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suriati is a tailor and she has been doing this for a long time as this is the only skill she has. Not everyone can be a tailor as this job requires specific skill sets and also patience and diligence. At the beginning Ni Ketut Suriati worked by her own. However at the moment after she got the funding from Dinari, she affords to hire 2 helpers from her village. These helpers are necessary as she gets more works from the customers. In the past Ni Ketut Suriati was only able to complete 2 tailoring jobs per day with fees of IDR 70 thousand. At the moment with the 2 helpers assisting her, she is able to complete 6 tailoring jobs per day with net income of IDR 100 thousand. Ni Ketut Suriati is very happy with increasing incoming jobs for her after she hired 2 helpers to assist her.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai seorang penjahit baju adalah usaha yang ditekuni oleh Ni Ketut Suriati sejak lama karena hanya inilah keahlian dan ketrampilan yang dimiliki.Tidak semua orang bisa melakukan usaha ini hanya orang –orang yang trampil dan juga penuh kesabaran yang bisa tetap menjalankan usaha ini. Ni Ketut Suriati awalnya hanya bekerja sendiri tanpa ada tenaga kerja yang membantunya, tetapi kini setelah ia mendapatkan tambahan modal usaha dari Dinari Ni Ketut Suriani bisa memberi gaji 2 orang tenaga kerja yang berasal dari desanya. Kerena sekarang ini semakin banyak order yang didapat sehingga dituntut tenaga kerja lebih supaya cepat dan juga dengan hasil yang bagus. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Suriani hanya bisa menyelesaikan 2 potong baju dengan ongkos jahit Rp 70.000.- , tetapi kini setelah ada tenaga kerja yang baru dalam sehari bisa menyelesaikan 6 potong pakaian dengan pendapatan bersih Rp 100.000.- Ni Ketut Suriati sangat senang karena semakin banyak order yang didapatnya setelah ada tenaga kerja yang membantunya.

loans.use: To add working capital by purchasing sewing machines

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suarni

texts.id:
After married to I Made Darma, Ni Ketut Suami opened a small shop (or warung in local term, pronounced as waroong) in front of her house. She chose to open a small shop as she saw there was none open a shop in her neighborhood. Her small shop carries variety of stuffs such as snack and basic daily necessities such as vegetables. She opens her shop from 07.00 AM to 06.00 PM. As the shop is located in front of her house, when there is no customer, she can do her house chores. In running this business she needs fund to expand her shop. In addition of having retail (individual) customers, she also supplies other smaller vendors. At the moment after having additional funding to expand her business, she can earned net profit of IDR 150 thousand/ day. In the past she can only earned IDR 50 thousand/ day. She is hoping to be able to expand her warung business in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setelah menikah dengan I Made Darma, kini Ni Ketut Suarni mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih karena di daerah tempat tinggalnya belum ada usaha warung yang menjadi saingan dalam usahanya. Barang yang dijual pun beraneka macam seperti makanan ringan dan kebutuhan pokok setiap hari bahkan sayur mayur.Setiap hari Ni Ketut Suarni membuka warung pada pukul 07.00 wita dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 wita. Karena warung ada didepan rumahnya, maka jika tidak ada pelanggan yang berbelanja Ni Ketut Suarni bisa melakukan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya. Dalam menjalankan usaha ini Ni Ketut Suarni membutuhkan dana untuk menambah usaha warungnya karena pelanggannya banyak sedangkan modal yang dimiliki sangat terbatas. Disamping melayani konsumen secara individu untuk kepentingan sendiri, Ni Ketut Suarni juga menjadi suplyer bagi para pedagang yang lain yang lebih kecil karena modal yang mereka miliki sangat kecil dan terbatas. Sekarang setelah Ni Ketut Suarni mendapat tambahan modal ia dapat melayani para konsumen lebih banyak lagi dengan keuntungan bersih perhari mencapai Rp.150.000,- yang dulunya hanya memperoleh keuntungan bersih perhari Rp 50.000. Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan kedepannya usaha warung dapat lebih meningkat dan menjadi lebih besar lagi dari sekarang.

loans.use: To add the inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben has a well-stocked retail store in the village of Kayunga, and has operated the store for five years. He is married with 6 children. He understands the need for serving his community as he has a strong customer base. Kayunga is a village removed from the larger city of Kampala and stores like Ben’s are needed to make sure that the local villagers have essential food and hygiene items. He tries to stock items that his customers desire including the staples of sugar, soap, posho, rice, and cooking oil.

Ben's future plans are to build a commercial building, both to enlarge his business and to eliminate the paying of rent. For now, he plans to buy more food staples and personal hygiene items for his store with his loan. He has been a borrower in his lending group for the past year and a half and has had no problem repaying past loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs such as sugar, soap, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and personal hygiene items for his retail store.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Rasih

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Rasih and her husband, Nengah Sudia are diligent farmers. Dinari trusts Ni Wayan Rasih and provides her with loan of IDR 6 million (approx. USD 630). Ni Wayan Rasih used this loan to purchase 15 piglets for IDR 250 thousand per piglet (total of IDR 3.75 million). Her daily routine now is taking care of her piglets such as cleaning the pig’s hut and feeding the piglets. The pig’s hut is made of simple bamboo structure while the pig feed is made of combination from several materials that have to be bought from the market. For the feeding she has to spend IDR 2.25 million. After 6 months, the pigs are ready to be sold for IDR 7.5 million. The net profit that she can earned after 6 months work is IDR 1.5 millions. She is hoping her business to grow more and more so she can earned bigger income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Wayan Rasih dan suaminya, Nengah Sudia, termasuk peternak yang tekun. Dari Dinari Ni Wayan Rasih memperoleh kepercayaan sehingga mendapat modal pinjaman yang cukup besar Rp. 6.000.000,- Ni Wayan Rasih mempergunakan modal ini dengan baik. Wayan Rasih membeli 15 ekor anak babi dengan harga per ekor Rp.250.000,-. Untuk modal bibit saja Ni Wayan Rasih menghabiskan modal Rp.3.750.000,-. Setiap hari Ni Wayan Rasih sibuk mengurusi babinya mulai dari membersihkan kandang sampai memberi makan. Kondisi kandang babinya sederhana memakai kandang bambu. Adapun makanan yang diberikan adalah dedak padi, deadk gandum dan konsentrat yang tidak bisa diproduksi sendiri harus membeli di warung –warung terdekat yang harganya pun tidak murah. Sampai panen, Ni Wayan Rasih menghabiskan biaya pakan sebesar Rp 2.250.000,- Setelah umur 6 bulan babinya siap dipanen yang nantinya akan dijual kepada penggepul dengan pendapatan kotor Rp.7.500.000,-. Jadi pendapatan bersih yang diperoleh Ni Wayan Rasih selama 6 bulan setelah dipotong biaya –biaya yang dikeluarkankan sebesar Rp1.500.000,- Ni Wayan Rasih tetap berharap usaha ini bisa berkembang lebih besar lagi supaya keuntungan yang didapat pun semakin besar.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig's feed

loans.name: Jimia

texts.en:
For the past 6 years, Jimia has operated a retail store in Kayunga. He is married with 2 children, and he also takes care of 2 orphans. In his store, he sells maize flour, sugar, tomatoes, salt, soap, etc. He hopes to use his loan to expand his business and add to his inventory.

One day, he hopes to be able to save enough money to construct a permanent home for his wife and children. It is difficult for most Ugandans to save any money. They often care for orphans of deceased brothers and sisters. Jimia is able to afford school fees and buy uniforms for his children so that they can go to school.

Jimia is a very creative, resourceful, and hardworking man, and he is confident that his business will continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, tomatoes, maize flour, soap, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Mrs. Pheng S., 40, is a widow and lives with her two kids in Prey Veng province, Cambodia.  She runs a stand in front of a garment factory, selling rice and various kinds of Khmer food to the large number of garment-workers passing by. She can typically earn around $3 per day of profit. One of her children is currently enrolled in school and the other works helping her cook. Mrs. Pheng S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike for one of her brothers, who is living with her, to operate a motor-taxi which would enable him to generate more profits for their household.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for one of her brothers to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Thi Ba

texts.vi: Ms Ba is 50 years old. She has four sons and a daughter. Now she's living together with her son and youngest girl at who attends grade eleven. She's raising nearly 1000 chickens for eggs. She has applied for a loan of  VND2,006,000 to buy more food for chickens. With a lot of experiences in this business, she really hopes to have a bigger amount in the next cycle to expand and raise more chickens. She hopes to repay this loan with her income from selling eggs within 6 months.

loans.use: Having loans for raising chickens

loans.name: Ni Luh Sumiarni

texts.id:
Ni Luh Sumiarni is a house wife and a mother of three. She started her business by using IDR 2 million (approx: USD 210) loan provided by Dinari. She bought 2 female local pigs for IDR 1.2 million and used the remaining IDR 800 thousand to feed the pigs. At the moment one of her pig has delivered 4 piglets while the other one is expecting very soon. When the piglets are 2 months old, they can be sold for IDR 250 thousand per piglet. Once every 5 month she can earn gross revenue of IDR 2.5 million from selling piglets produced by 2 female pigs. Those revenue is deducted with money spent to feed the pigs of IDR 500 thousand will give her a profit of IDR 2 million. Ni Luh Sumiarni plans to use this profit to refurbish the pig’s hut by make the hut structure more permanent as at the moment it is only made of bamboo structure.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan pinjaman modal yang di dapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.2.000.000,- Ni Luh Sumiarni memulai usahanya. Ni Luh Sumiarni membeli 2 induk babi lokal atau Babi Bali dengan harga perekor Rp.600.000,- jadi 2 ekor induk babi harganya Rp1.200.000,-. Sisanya Rp 800,000,- dipergunakan untuk modal pakannya. Saat ini salah satu induk babinya sudah beranak 4 ekor dan induk yang lain masih hamil. Setiap hari Ni Luh Sumiarni sibuk disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang mengurus 3 anaknya yang masih sekolah juga sibuk mengurus ternaknya. Setelah berumur 2 bulan nantinya anak babinya sudah bisa dijual dengan harga per ekornya Rp 250.000. Setiap 5 bulan dari hasil penjualan anak babi dengan dua ekor induk babi memperoleh pendapatan kotornya Rp 2.500.000,-. Pengeluaran pakan untuk anak dan induknya Rp.500.000,-. Jadi bersihnya Ni Luh Sumiarni memperoleh keuntungan Rp2.000.000,-. Dengan keuntungan ini Ni Luh Sumiarni ingin memperbaiki kandangnya agar lebih permanen karena saat ini masih memakai kandang bambu.

loans.use: To buy female pigs and pig's feed

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Sadait has sold chapatis from the location you see in this picture. Most likely, she has made tens of thousands of chapatis. Chapatis are a staple in the Ugandan villagers' diet and hers are delicious. She is well-known in her community and villagers visit her daily. She always has time for conversation. Sadait has raised 8 children of her own and is now raising four grandchildren.

She is 57 years old and is married. She also has a small retail shop that one of her daughters manages. There she sells staples such as sugar, posho, maize flour, baking powder, etc. From the sales of her businesses, she has been able to pay for her children's and now her grandchildren's education. She prefers to work making chapatis because it allows her to keep busy with her hands and visit with her friends in the village while she works. She has a small plot of land and she hopes one day to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs,i.e. sugar, posho, baking powder, and salt for her retail store.

loans.name: Hawima

texts.en:
Hawima has a beauty salon where she also sells cosmetics and clothes. Although her clients have little money, it is still very important to look and feel good. This is a small but very important luxury to the people of her village in Kayunga. She tries to offer her products at very reasonable prices. She has owned her business for 5 years and has a very established client base. She has also been a member of her lending group for the past five years, and has had no problem repaying any of her loans. With her loan, she plans to expand her business by increasing her inventory of clothes and cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, etc.

Hawima is 43, married, with 6 children. From the sales of her goods she has been able to pay school fees and meet her family’s basic needs. One day she hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a home for her family.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding more clothing, cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Fazira

texts.en:
Fazira has a farm in the village of Kayunga. She has one cow and some poultry which she uses for laying. With the cow, she practices zero-grazing, which means that instead of the cow grazing on grasses throughout the village, it is penned up in a small corral. Feed is then bought and fed to the cow. This method takes much less attention, is simple, and quite yielding in growth. The downside is the time it takes to sickle the grass and bring it to the cow.

With her loan, she plans to buy more chicks for laying. It takes several months for chicks to become layers, and money for feed has to be spent prior to getting a return, so this can be difficult since few people have the ability to save. But Fazira has experience in farming and she budgets her funds carefully.

Fazira is 37, married, with 6 children and she cares for 3 orphans. With the money from her farm, she has been able to pay school fees. She is a committed lady whose dream is to make sure her children are well-educated and she hopes to continue expanding her farm.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for laying and more chicken feed.

loans.name: Thi Vy

texts.vi:
Ms Vy is 41 years old. Her main occupation is grinding rice for sale. Not to waste anything, she raises pigs that she feeds with the bran/husk from the grinding. Everyday she goes to the market to buy raw rice, grinds it then sells right from her home. Her customers usually come to her house to pick up their order. She's requesting a loan to buy raw rice. Her husband works in construction. All her children are grown up and have their own family. Her income raises steadily. She would like to invest more into her business, buying more raw rice to grind. In her opinion, this business is profitable, no risk of losing money.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vy năm nay 41 tuổi, chị làm nghề buôn bán gạo, ngoài ra để tận dụng cám gạo trong làm nghề chị còn nuôi thêm lợn.Hàng ngày chị đi chợ mua thóc đem về xay sát rồi bán gạo.Khách hàng của chị thường đến tận nhà lấy hàng.Chị vay vốn về để mua thêm thóc rồi sát gạo abns dần.Chông chị đi làm thợ xây phụ giúp gia đình tăng thu nhập.Các con chị đã lớn, và chúng đã ra ở riêng, thu nhập trong gia đình chị ngày càng tăng lên.Chị lại đầu tư mua thóc nhiều hơn vì theo chị làm nghề này chỉ cólãi chứ không bao giờ lỗ.

loans.use: Having loans for buying rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase on her stock.

loans.name: Kinobi

texts.en:
Kinobi is a very pleasant lady of 37 years. She is married with 2 children and she also cares for one orphan. She operates a well-stocked retail store in Kayunga. She sells beverages, sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, cosmetics, etc.

Most retail stores sell similar items, and there are two basic reasons for the lack of variety. One reason is the villagers have very little means, so they only buy basic necessities or very inexpensive luxuries, i.e. sodas and cosmetics. And the other reason is the owners of the businesses are also without means, so they cannot afford to take risks on items which may not sell. So, the safest course is to copy what other stores sell. One diversifies by having a well-stocked store and developing a loyal clientele. Your ability to befriend people in your community goes a long way towards your success.

Kinobi’s wonderful personality adds greatly to her client base. With her loan, she plans to expand her inventory of basic foodstuffs. She hopes one day to buy a plot of land and construct a commercial building so she will not have to pay rent.

loans.use: To continue buying sugar, rice, maize flour, etc. in order to keep her store well stocked.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Gladys has been a tailor in Kayunga. Over the years, she has developed her skills so that she can do intricate work and make all sorts of fine garments. Having a skill or trade is very important to villagers; without which there are little or no possibilities for a job. Generally, there are no jobs in villages. You either have a skill or you open a business. A business takes some capital and few can afford that investment, hence a skill is essential. The investment in a sewing machine, though out of range for most people, is less than the cost of stocking a business. And, you can sew from your home or on the street, so you do not have to pay additional rent.

Gladys has an established business, and with her skills she is well-known with many repeat customers. She plans to use her loan to buy more material, pay school fees, and pay rent. She has been in her lending group for the past 6 years and has had no problem repaying her loans. One day she hopes to build her own home in order to stop paying rent.

loans.use: To buy more cloth, embroidery, and to pay school fees and rent.

loans.name: Van Luan

texts.vi:
Mr Luân and his wife are hard working persons. They are both 35 years old. They have 2 children aged 8 & 12. They're both attending school. He raises poultry and pigs at home. In his free time, he's for hire. His wife sells rice. Luân has a lot of experience in raising poultry and pigs. Right now he has 10 pigs and egg laying chickens. He would like to raise chickens for meat so he's applying for a loan to buy breeding chickens. The income from his poultry/pig raising business is steadily increasing.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Vợ chồng anh Luân là những người chịu thương chịu khó. Anh chị năm nay đều 35 tuổi, có hai con đang đi học, 1 đứa 12 tuổi, 1 đứa 8 tuổi. Anh ở nhà chăn nuôi, hôm nào rảnh rỗi lại đi làm thuê.Vợ anh là người phụ nữ hiền hậu, làm nghề buôn bán gạo, anh là người cókinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi, hiện tại trong chuồng nhà anh có 10 con lợn và gà đang đẻ trứng. Anh muốn mở rộng thêm chăn gà thịt nên vay vốn về để mua thêm gà giống.Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi giúp gia đình anh ngày càng khấm khá hơn.

loans.use: Having loans for buying breeding chickens

loans.name: Xuan Vu

texts.vi:
Mr Vũ is a simple man and honest. He likes raising poultry very much. This is why in his home there are a few hundreds ducks that lay eggs. His wife sells pork at the market. His family income is good. He's applying for a loan to buy duck feed. The revenue generated by his poultry business would permit him to repay back the loan without problem.

Translated frm Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chú Vũ là người đàn ông chất phác thật thà.Chú rất thích nghề chăn nuôi, vì vậy trong nhà chú lúc nào cũng có vài trăm vịt đẻ trứng và ngan thịt... Vợ chú thường xuyên đi chợ bán thịt lợn. Thu nhập gia đình cũng khá giả. Chú vay vốn đợt này để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi. V ới khoản thu nhập này chú có thể hoàn trả được số tiền này một cách dễ dàng.

loans.use: to buy duck feed

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi: Cô Dung trồng khá nhiều loại rau.Hàng ngày cô thường đi chợ bán rau, chồng cô đi làm thợ xây.
