Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, bò.Cô chưa từng vay  vốn ở đâu vì ngại thủ tục rườm rà.Tuy nhiên, khi có chương trình tài chính vi mô, cô đã vay để mua thêm 1 con bò. Hiện tại nhà cô có 5 con bò nái.Thu nhập hàng ngày từ rau , cô có thể hoàn trả dần, còn lại cô đầu tư vào nuôi bò và lợn.

loans.use: Having loans for poultry

loans.name: Thi Lap

texts.vi:
Ms Lập is 50 years old. She has 3 children all grown up. Before she used to sell fabric at the market but she had switched to raising poultry. Her husband has experience in raising poultry. They put their effort into raising chickens for meat and eggs. Everyday she sells chicken eggs at the market. She's requesting a loan to buy more chickens. To be able to pay back the loan in small installments suits her fine.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si,.Kiva volunteer.

Cô Lập năm nay 50 tuổi, cô có 3 người con, các con cô đã lớn.Trước kia cô thường đi chợ buôn bán vải, nhưng bây giờ co chuyển sang chăn nuôi.Chồng cô là người có kinh n ghiệm trong chăn nuôi, gia đình cô chủ yếu là nuôi gà thịt và gà đẻ.Hàng ngày cô đi bán trứng. Cô đi vay vốn đợt này để mua gà tăng gia thêm.Hình thức trả góp dần hàng tuần cô rất thích.

loans.use: Having loans for purchasing chicken

loans.name: Thi Thanh

texts.vi:
Ms Thạnh is 30 years old, she has 2 children. Her husband is a skilled worker. He used to work for others because he did not have money to start his own business. Now he has his own shop producing home furniture. He has a lot of orders from his customers so he has to hire someone to help. Ms Thạnh takes care of the household and helps him out when she has time. This time she applies for a loan to buy new tools in order to augment production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si,.Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thạnh năm nay 30 tuổi, đã có hai con.Chồng chị là thợ có tay nghề cao, trước kia anh đi làm thuê vì cưa có vốn.Hiện nay anh mở xưởng làm tại nhà, sản xuất đò nội thất.Khác đặt hàng khá đông nên anh chị phải thuê người làm thêm.Ngoài công việc chăm sóc chồng và con cái chị còn phị giúp công việc làm cho chồng.Đợt vay vốn này chị mua thêm dụng cụ trong nghề nhằm nâng cao năng xuất hơn nữa.

loans.use: Having loans for buying producing tools

loans.name: Maral

texts.en:
Maral B. is 48 years old. She is married and mother of 1 child. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory, Gubadli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan and right now lives in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic. She is the only breadwinner in her family.

Maral started her business in 1993. She began with $300, selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food expenses and other basic needs. She had difficulty covering needs for medication, clothes, etc. After some years, however, she was able to expand her business a bit.

Now, Maral needs a loan of US$ 500 in order to further develop her business, to buy other sorts of shoes etc., to improve her family’s living conditions with the additional income this would bring in. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to buy other sort of shoes and increase her turnover

loans.name: Mosan Ali

texts.en: Mosan Ali lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children, and he has a retail shop. He has been involved in this business for a number of years and is looking to increase his business. He requested an individual loan to complete his stock so he can make a good monthly income to help his family. He wants to send his two children to a better education center. He is happy now, and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Khac Cuong

texts.vi: Anh Cương năm nay 30 tuổi, anh là người hiền lành và chịu khó. Anh có 3 con, 1 trai, 2 gái, các cháu còn đang đi học. Anh làm nông nghiệp.Gia đình anh trồng rất nhiều lúa, ngoài ra trồng thêm các loại rau màu ngắn ngày khác như rau cải, cà chua, đỗ... Vì Vậy gia đình anh lúc nào cũng có thu nhập thường xuyên.Vợ anh thì đi chợ mua phế liệu. Anh vay vốn đợt này mua phân đạm để bón rau nhằm tăng năng suất lao động.

loans.use: Having loans for selling vegetable

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar A. is a 32-year-old married man who has two children. He is a farmer. He is from Lachin region and right now lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.

Eldar started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses.

In 2005 Eldar borrowed US$ 500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and he applied for a loan of US$ 800 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production. The 3rd time he borrowed US$1500 and further expanded his business. These loans were all paid back in a timely manner.

Now, Eldar would like to borrow US$ 1,800 in order to acquire one cow, 3 young bulls, and feed for them. He is applying to Kiva for US$1200 and remaining US$600 will be paid by Normicro. He will repay the loan within 16 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business still further.

loans.use: to acquire one cow, 3 young bulls and feed for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on her stock.

loans.name: Thi Loi

texts.vi:
Ms Lợi is 25 years old, she is married and has a daughter who attends 1st grade. She and her husband have a shop fabricating wooden furniture. They are in this business for 5 years. She's requesting a loan to buy wood to augment the production. This business helps to provide a steady income for her family. They have 4 employees working for them. She hopes to expand her shop in the future.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lợi năm nay 25 tuổi, chị đã có 1 bé gái học lớp 1.Hai vợ chồng chị làm đồ gỗ, chuyên làm tủ, và bàn ghế. Anh chị đã làm nghề này được 5 năm. Chị vay vốn đểmua gỗ, làm nghề này giúp gia đình chị có thu nhập ổn định và ngày mở rộng sản xuất được hơn nữa. Xưởng sản xuất của chị phải thuê thêm 4 nhân công nữa. Chị hi vọng trong tương lai sẽ mở rộng thêm sản xuất hơn nữa.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Thi Muoi

texts.vi:
Ms Mười is 31 years old. She has a kiosk at the local market selling clothes. She has 2 school aged children. Her husband works as a carpenter. She applies for a loan to buy more clothes, Everyday she's at her kiosk from the morning until night. To pay back the loan in small installments makes it easier for her. She wishes to be able to qualify for bigger loan in the next round so that she'll be able to expand and to offer more cloth selection.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Mười 31 tuổi, chị bán quần áo ở chợ gần nhà. Chị có 2 con đang học cấp 2. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc, chị vay vốn để mua thêm hàng bán. Hàng ngày chị chủ yếu ở chợ tới tối mới về nhà. Vay vốn trả góp giúp chị có điều kiện tiết kiệm tốt hơn. Chị mong đợi được vay nhiều hơn để mở cửa hàng to hơn bán nhiều loại hơn.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sales

loans.name: Yekosobiasi

texts.en:
Yekosobiasi owns a bar where she serves beer, assorted spirits, and soft drinks. She has owned the bar for 8 years and has been a member of her lending group for the past 4 years. She is a focused, hardworking, woman who is always able to repay her loans.

Yekosobiasi is 50 years old, widowed, with one child. She is very well liked by the people in her village of Kayunga and her business is very popular. With her loan, she plans to expand her business adding foodstuffs and more beverages.

loans.use: To add foodstuffs and buy more beverages.

loans.name: Thi Than

texts.vi:
Ms Thân is 54 years old. Her main occupation is retails and poultry raising in her home. She wishes to obtain a loan to buy more poultry thus raising her family income.

Translated frm Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Thân năm nay 54 tuổi, nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình cô là đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ lẻ và chăn nuôi gia cầm tại gia đình. Cô mong muốn đựợc có thêm nguồn vốn để có thể tăng thêm số lượng đàn gia cầm của gia đình mình, cũng như thu nhập của gia đình ở một mức cao hơn.

loans.use: having loans for buying foods for chickens

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Located along a busy street, which is a good location, Monica has a small bar where she sells cold beer and soft drinks. Refrigeration is rare, so cold drinks help a business to get customers. Villagers will take great pride in telling you that they have refrigeration.

Monica has operated her business for 4 years and has been a member of her lending group for two years. During that time, she has always been able to repay her loans. With this loan, she plans to restock her supply of beverages. The loan will also help her to meet basic family needs such as school fees for her children.

Monica is married, 27, and has 3 children of her own. She also cares for 3 orphans. Most of the people here care for orphans of relatives who have passed away. It is expected that you will care for your family members' children, but this creates an additional financial hardship. In time, Monica hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To restock her supply of beverages.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet has a simple, but well-run, clinic where she sells over-the-counter medicines. She also attends to other patients' needs. In small villages, health services are sometimes difficult to come by, so persons with some understanding of the villagers' conditions are needed.

Annet is a very caring, compassionate woman. She is 35, married, with one child. She also cares for 4 orphans. She has operated her clinic for 10 years and has been in her lending group for the past 6 years.

With her loan, she plans to buy more medicines, beverages, and a fridge. Monica is a very committed individual who has a good sense of business. She hopes to one day buy a plot of land and construct her own home.

loans.use: To buy more medicines, soft drinks, and a fridge.

loans.name: Dinh Toan

texts.vi:
Mr Toàn is a hard working man. He was a poor peasant, empty handed. He has learned how to breed pigs in order to raise above poverty. Today he has a job and breeds pigs at home. His wife, Quyên, buys scrap material to resell to companies. He wishes to have capital so he could expand his pig breeding into a business so he could provide his children a good education.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si,.Kiva volunteer.

Anh Toàn là một người đán ông chịu khó, hay làm. Từ một người nông dân với hai bàn tay trắng anh đã học tầp cách chăn nuôi để dần kinh tế gia đình thoát khỏi cái đói nghèo. Hiện nay anh đi làm thuê và chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Quyên vợ anh đi chợ hàng ngày mua phế liệu rồi bán cho các đại lý thu mua. Anh vẫn hi vọng có thêm nguồn vốn để có thể mở rộng chăn nuôi cũng như sản xuất, để có điều kiện cho các cháu ăn học tốt hơn.

loans.use: Having loans for breeding pigs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
For the past nineteen years, Florence has operated a retail shop from the location you see in the photo. Her store is well-organized and has an air of having been around for some time. She even seems to blend into the backdrop. She is very comfortable here and has a very pleasant, welcoming personality.

Over the years, she has added a poultry business to her livelihood. She uses the chickens as layers. With her loan, she plans to buy more chicks, chicken feed, and also more sugar, salt, and maize flour for her retail store. She has been in her lending group for the past 8 years and she has no problem making loan payments. She owns a plot of land and she hopes to construct a home.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her egg laying business, chicken feed, and more sugar, salt, and maize flour for her retail store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah owns the Mirembe Drug and Clinic Shop. Her business is the only one of its kind in the area. This is important for her over-the-counter medicines and her advice is essential to the health care of the villagers. Although her stock is limited, she takes great care in making sure that she keeps needed health care items in her inventory.

Sarah has operated her business for 7 years and she has been a member of her lending group for the same period of time. She is married with 5 children and she is 40 years old. She is a very kind and gentle person who cares deeply about her community. Her dream is to complete the building of her house and to make sure that her children get a good education. With her loan she plans to add to her health care products.

loans.use: To add to her health care products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Born in 1950, Elizabeth is married and is a mother of four children all above the age of 15 years.

As an ambitious woman, her dream of seeing all her children educated was almost shattered because she and her husband were unable to pay their school fees. This caused her to start the business of selling fruit and groundnuts so she could raise some money to support her husband.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to continue in the same line of business, which she believes will succeed given the fact that she sells near a secondary school where many students buy. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, bread and groundnuts

loans.name: Isma

texts.en:
Isma has two businesses: a butchery and a boda boda business. In the butchery, he sells beef and goat meat. Goat meat is more expensive and is used in stews and for festive occasions. Few people sell goat meat so he has little competition selling that product.

The boda boda serves two purposes. The boda boda is a motor bike, and it gets its name from boda drivers taking passengers to the border and then another boda driver takes them once they cross the border, hence boda boda. So, Isma is a driver for hire. But he also uses his boda boda to transport his goats from the village to town.

Isma is very business oriented. He plans to build a commercial building on a plot of land he owns. For now he plans to use his loan to continue buying meat and expand his business. He is married, 27 years old, with four children. He has had the butchery for 8 years and just recently got into the boda boda business.

loans.use: To buy meat and expand his business.

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
Neba F. was not privileged to get a secondary education because his parents could not afford it. This caused him to start selling some jewelry, through which he earned some money to feed his wife and his two children.

In an attempt to increase his business, he decided to ask for a loan from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), he plans to invest in the same line of business and also cultivate ginger, which is used as spice and in making ginger drinks.

The money raised will be used to pay his house rent and school fees for his children. He plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry, cosmetics and ginger

loans.name: Shungen Nchangwa

texts.en:
Born in 1968, M. is the widow of the late Emmanuel Ngwa. Her hopes of seeing her four children educated were dashed when her husband died. She now has to work hard to be able to provide for her children. This led her to start selling groundnuts and bananas, which could not give her much profit because she had little investment capital.

She then sought a loan from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to continue in the same line of business and also start cultivating ginger and cassava. She will use the profit to pay house rent and buy food for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, groundnuts and ginger

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 23832

loans.name: Pauline Nchotu

texts.en:
Pauline is married to Nchotu Aaron and is the mother of eight children, three of whom died in one year. Though their deaths were attributed to witchcraft, the root cause was poverty and lack of money to pay for their medications and carry out a proper diagnosis.

In order to have some income, she decided to start a business and solicited loans from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to buy and sell foods, such as corn, sweet potatoes, ginger and cocoyam (taro root) so she can raise money to pay the school fees for her children. She also plans to feed her family with some of the food sold.

She will repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase cocoyam, corn, ginger and sweet potatoes

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 23833

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking woman who has been of much support to her husband through her business of selling of cooked water fufu and eru. Water fufu is grated and fermented cassava eaten with eru (a wild vegetable) and is an appreciated dish in this area.

To increase on her income, she decided to add embroidery and raising pigs to the existing business. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA ), she plans to cook and sell water fufu and eru, embroider dresses and fatten and sell pigs.

The profit raised will be used to pay the school fees for her three children. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Purchase of eru, water fufu, thread, cloth, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en: Ramahani is a 27-year-old mother of two and resident of the Maziwa area in the Buguruni community. She runs a small restaurant in the Kisiwani area. She has been running this business  for the past ten years. She wants to remodel her restaurant to meet the health standards and guidelines set by the city council. She needs $325 to make these changes.

loans.use: Remodel restaurant to meet health codes

loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
Bih M. is a widow and the mother of six children. Her husband died leaving neither money nor property for her and her children.

Faced with the difficulty of single-handedly providing for her children, she sought a loan from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to start cultivating and selling cassava, corn and ripe bananas, through which she will raise money to pay the school fees and apprentice fees for her children.

She believes she will succeed in repaying her loan because her children will help her sell the ripe bananas. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Hire farm labor and buy corn seeds

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha A., 30, lives in Kisiwani,  in the Buguruni area of Dar Es Salaam city. For the past six years, she has been running a restaurant in the Kisiwani area. She has developed her entrepreneurial skills through the Youth Self Employment Foundation. She now wants to expand her restaurant  to cater to more customers at a time.  She is asking for $325 to enlarge her restaurant.

loans.use: Enlarge her restaurant

loans.name: Sirri Neba

texts.en:
Born in 1953, M. is married and the mother of five children. All her resources were invested in the education of her first son, who unfortunately died. This was a great loss for the family. Since then, it has been difficult for the other children to be educated because of a lack of school fees. In order to feed the children, she started selling some food items.

Given a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to add to the food items, firewood and palm oil. The profit raised will be used to pay apprentice and school fees for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa H. is a 42-year-old father of three. He lives in the Kisiwani area. He has been in the business of collecting scrap metal for the past four years. He sells the scrap metal to small manufacturers of various machines. He uses some of the metal himself, to manufacture charcoal stoves. He is asking for $375 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his scrap metal business

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Lum C. is 22 years old and the mother of one child. Constant maltreatment from her husband forced her to start selling so she could be less dependent.

In an attempt to increase her business, she sought a loan from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to add to the firewood and the cultivation of ginger. The profit raised will be used to buy food and medication for her child and herself.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and ginger seeds

loans.name: Ngu Theophilus

texts.en:
Theophilus is a hard-working father of five children who has faced a lot of challenges in his family including the death of his first son, joblessness and poverty.

This challenged him to start the business of welding, poultry and rabbit rearing. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), he plans to continue in the same line of business and use the profit to pay school fees for his children and buy them food.

He plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and rabbits and pay workshop rent

loans.name: Hemed

texts.en: Hemed is a 32-year-old father of three. He lives in the Kisiwani area. He runs a shop selling cosmetics and other ladies’ beauty supplies. He developed his entrepreneurial skills through the Youth Self Employment Foundation. He is asking for $375  to expand his shop.

loans.use: To expand his cosmetics business

loans.name: Albino Jose

texts.pt:
José Albino T. was born on March 13, 1974 in the Province of CaT. in Maputo. He was raised by his grandparents and studied until the 6th grade. He is 33 years old, married and father of 4 children. Jose supports a family of 6. To put himself through school, he fished and in 1993 he left for South Africa. There he got sick and was forced to return 5 months later. He returned to fishing and in 2002 he build a small home. He has been working as a photographer for 6 years, despite his lack of formal education. Jose also has a small shop where he employs 2 people.

With this loan he plans on buying pool tables and to increase his inventory. In the summer he is able to sell up to 4.000mt a week in drinks and pool table rental fees. Lately he has had less customers and his monthly income is down to 9,000.00. With the income from the business Jose supports his family and tries to save. In the future, he wants to invest in his business. Jose believes these loan have had a positive impact in his business.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chalí-caT.-Maputo Cliente: José Albino T. Actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 50.000,mzm ( 2.000 USD) Aplicação: compa e venda de produtos Início: 07-11-07 Fim: 30-04-09 José Albino T. , nasceu aos 13 de Março de 1974 em CaT. Província de Maputo, tem 33 anos de idade, estudou apenas até 6ªclasse , casado maritalmente tem 4 filhos e vive com 6 pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Passou a sua infância junto dos seus avôs devido a problemas sociais envolvendo os seus progenitores. Para sustentar os seus estudos , ia a pesca nos tempos livres em 1993 por influência de amigos , teve que abandonar os estudos e ir a R.S.A ( Republica de Aafrica do Sul) onde foi obrigado a regressar seis meses depois devido a uma doênça que havia contraído lá. E algum tempo depois melhora e volta a dedicar se na pesca tempo depois aprende a fazer o negócio atravez do pai até que em 2002 constroi a sua barraca . Actualmente dedica se no negócio e serviços fotográficos, a faz este negócio a 6 anos e não tem nenhuma formação . Tém duas empregadas uma tem 5 filhos e outra tem 2 filhos. Com este empréstimo, pretende comprar mais uma mesa de bilhares e reforçar a mercadoria na barraca, abre o seu negócio as 7 horas e tem ido a pé, a mercadoria para o negócio tem adiquirido na cidade de Maputo e tem alugado uma carrinha de mão vulgo tchova para transportá-los.

O melhor período para o seu negócio é no verão e a receita diária é de 4,000.00mt. O produto que dá mais lucro são as bebidas e jogos de bilhares e tem feito registos de vendas. A única dificuldade tem surgido quando haver mão tempo baixa o movimento de clientes e a margem de lucro mensal tem sido de 9,000.00mt. Com os rendimentos do negócio paga o crédito , sustenta a família , faz o reinvestimento e uma parte deposita no banco . No futuro pensa ampliar o seu estabelecimento e comprar mais uma Mesa de Bilhares e para tal precisará de um outro empréstimo. Em geral acha que o empréstimo modificou positivamente o seu negócio uma vez que comprou uma mesa de bilhares e está lhe rendendo muito pelo que está satisfeito.

loans.use: To increase stock and buy pool tables for the business

loans.name: Etruda

texts.en: Etruda is 32-year-old mother of three. She lives in the Buguruni area of Dar Es Salaam city. She has been in business for the past six years, running  a small pharmacy in the Buguruni area. She now wants to expand her pharmacy and is asking for $375.

loans.use: To expand her pharmacy business

loans.name: Silva

texts.pt:
Silva U. was born in the province of Sanga in Niassa, on January 30th 1967. He supports a family of 5. He was raised by his family with his twin brother. When he was 14 years old left home to join the military. He received a scholarship to go to Hungary where he finished High School and studied Economy and management. Years later he returned and started working for CMGM. He was introduced to lhuvuku by friends.

He joined the credit program hoping to improve his home. Silva works at CMGM and pays for the schooling of his children, supports his family and pays for the construction of the house. With the loan of 60.000mt, he plans on finishing the wall and painting the home In the future he wants to request another loan to pay for his twin brother’s wedding.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao: Maputo matola texlom Actividade: Habitaçao Valor empréstimo: 60.000,00MTN Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de material de construçao Início: 06-11-07 Fim:28-02-09 Silva U., nascido em Sanga Provincia de Niassa a 40 anos aos 30 de Janeiro de 1967, sustenta 5 pessoas e reside na casa propria que adquiriu em 2002. Cresceu e viveu num ambiente familiar onde tina 10 irmaos e sendo ele gémeo. Quando tinha 14 anos separa-se da familia para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório a vida foi dificil nos primeiros dias mas porque o estado organizava-se, sensibilizava e encorajava os novos soldados em prol da defesa do país, acabou se adaptando e é assim que o tempo foi passando. Teve uma bolsa de estudos para hungria onde ,prosseguiu com os estudos fez o ensino médio e depois licenciou-se em economia e gestao.

Anos mais tarde voltou ao pais e foi afecto no CMGM como gestor administrativo . ate que um dia ouviu falar da lhuvuku através de colegas seus que trabalhavam numa escola de fuzileiros navais. Decidiu também procurar a instituição e solicitar um emprestimo para melhorar a sua casa. Assim durante a sua actividade não tem tido dificuldades porque esta la a esposa a velar por tudo que lhes diz respeito, assim como tem controlado a obra e dar o relatório diariamente ao seu esposo porque este sai de muito cedo de casa e volta bastante tarde devido aos estudos no perodio pós laboral. Actualmente para além de trabalhar no C.M.G.M, faz assinatura de contas em varia instituições e que com o salario consegue pagar os seus estudos ,escola dos filhos e manter a casa assim como poupar para a obra.. Com o empréstimo de 60.000,00 ( secenta mil meticais)pretende concluir o murro e fazer a pintura de casa. A sua perspectiva futura e terminar o crédito e fazer um outro empréstimo para fazer um casamento comum com o seu irmão gémeo.

loans.use: to buy construction material to finish up his house

loans.name: Ahmed Abdulah

texts.pt:
Abdallah Ahmede Razaque was born in Bangladesh in the city of Sylhet 37 years ago on the 9th of August 1970. He supports three people and still lives in the home of his wife's parents. He studied in Bangladesh and has a degree in economics. He was raised among his family and is the second child. He had a good childhood since his father was a doctor and made a reasonably good living. He worked for various companies as an economist, but when his country was invaded and at war he became a refugee in Mozambique in 2000. When he arrived to Mozambique life was difficult due to the cultural differences and because he had to leave his family behind. He became friends with others who had come from Asia and through them was able to use the savings brought from his home country to establish as small general store and to marry a young woman from Mozambique. Among his customers at the store he became friends with a general of the FADM who told him about HLUVUKU. He decided to apply for a loan to increase the stock of merchandise in his store. He successfully repaid his first loan. Now he wants to take out an additional loan to expand his business. He recently invested in another store and does not have sufficient capital to puchase enough merchandise to stock the store, especially with the increased demand of the holiday season. Through this business he has gained a lot of good experience and has a vision for the future of his business. He currently has 8 employees, with an average of 4 children each. With the earnings from the store he pays his employees' salaries, covers his taxes, reinvests in additional merchandise for the store, and has just enough to cover his daily expenses. With a loan for 160,000MT he intends to purchase additional basic household goods to stock his stores. His business has no problem to do this because he owns his own transportation and when he cannot travel to purchase goods for the store he can send one of his employees. His wife also contributes to the success of their business. His vision for the future is to expand the business to import/export products to the north, purchasing beans and peanuts to sell in Maputo and to take basic goods from Maputo to sell in the north. The business is currently doing well and he is motivated to invest his money to buy a truck for the business.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Abdallah Ahmede Razaque, nasceu em bangladesh na cidade de Sylhet a 37 anos aos 09 de Agosto de 1970, sustenta 3 pessoas e reside ainda na casa dos seus sogros, fez o ensino superior onde licenciou se em economia em Bangladesh. Viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais e irmãos, sendo ele o segundo filho. A sua infância foi boa, uma vez que o pai é médico tinha uma vida razoável. Trabalhou em vária empresas como economista, mais porque o pais de origem foi envadido pela guerra acabou se refugiando para mocambique em 2000. Chegado em Moçambique, a vida foi dificil dado a diferença cultural e também porque deixou para atrás os familiares. Familiarizou se com algumas pessoas de origem asiática e foi assim que conseguiu adquirir a mercearia através das poupanças que efectuava na sua terra, casou-se com uma moçambicana. Dos clientes que tem aparecido na mercearia acabou fazendo amizades com um brigadeiro das FADM que lhe falou da existência da LHUVUKU decidiu fazer o empréstimo de para aumentar o vulume do seu negócio levantou e com sucessos conseguiu terminar o primeiro empréstimo. Agora pretende outro empréstimo para ampliar o seu negócio porque comprou mais uma mercearia e não dispoe de montantes suficiente para apetrechar a loja e também porque se aproxima a época festiva no mercado tem havido carência de produtos, é nessa óptica pretende comprar os produtos mais cedo possivel e apetrechar a mercearia. Durante a sua actividade tem adquirido mais experiência e também vai tendo novos horizontes para o seu negócio.Neste momento dispoe de 8 empregados dos quais cada um tem uma média de 4 filhos. Com o o rendimento da mercearia paga salários aos seus trabalhadores, os impostos, consegue comprar mais produtos e ainda cobre as suas despesas do seu dia a dia . Com o empréstimo de 160.000,00MTN ( cento e sessenta mil meticais),pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para abastecer as duas mercearias. Quanto o seu negócio não existe nenhuma deficuldade porque dispõe de transporte próprio e quando não consegue ir por si fazer as compras manda os empregados. A esposa também tem contibuido muito para o sucesso do negócio do casal. A sua perspectiva futura passa necessariamente na expansão do seu negócio fazendo a exportacão e importação e ainda ir ao norte buscar feijão e amendiom para Maputo assim como levando de Maputo para o norte produtos de primeira necessidade. A fase actual do negócio é bom e está bastante motivado a angariar aos poucos dinheiro para comprar um camião.

loans.use: To increase stock to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia A. is 35 years old and is married with 6 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells cooked food and provisions.  She has 6 years of experience in the business.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member and promises to repay her loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more cooked food & provisions to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Mrs. A. Ngozi is 49 years old and is married with 3 children.  She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Eki

texts.en: Mrs. Eki O. is 45 years old and is married with 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she operates a salon and sells clothes to people.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more weavon, hair cream and clothes to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member and is also the secretary of her union.  She promises to repay her loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream and clothe for sale

loans.name: Abdalah

texts.en:
Abdalah, age 42, is the father of 3 boys. He and his wife have started businesses within the past two years to support their family. In February 2006, Abdalah opened a shop where he sells vegetables, sodas, ice pops, and general-needs items. His shop has around 45 customers each day, and he makes a profit of around $9. In the past, Abdalah has taken out two successful loans. He hopes to take out a third loan, which will also be used to build up his shop’s inventory.

In January of this year, Abdalah’s wife was able to open her own breakfast café, which brings a profit of about $2.50 a day. Because of starting these businesses, Abdalah and his wife say that they no longer have problems paying general expenses such as school fees and hospital bills.

Abdalah belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and support one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

payments.comment: Abdalah was able to make the remaining payment on his loan before the end of the loan term!!

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mrs. Mebel S. is 37 years old and is married with 2 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells drinks to people.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member and has been in business for 4 years.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Mrs. Happiness O. is 32 years old and is married with 5 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she fixes hair for people and sells hair cream.  She spent a year and a half learning her business and opened her own in 1996.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more weavon, hair cream & relaxer to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream & relaxer to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary C. is 45 years old and is married with 7 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells cassava products.  That means, she processes cassava into our local food called "satana" or "fufu" and sells it to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 1986 and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more cassava, which she will process into local food.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to process and sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith O. is 30 years old and is married with 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells fish to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 2000 and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more fish to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Mrs. O. E. Charity is 25 years old and is married with one child.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells fish to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 1999 and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more fish to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tzvetelina

texts.en: Tzvetelina T. lives in the village of Medkovetz, near the town of Vratza. She is a registered agricultural producer. More specifically, she has 18 cows, 13 of which are being milked. The milk is then sold to a local dairy. Tzvetelina lives with her boyfriend and their child. At present Tzvetelina T. needs $750 so that she can buy enough fodder for her cows to last through the winter.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for her cows for the winter period

loans.name: Elitza

texts.en: Elitza N. lives in the village of Medkovetz. She works in a dairy farm in the village, but she wants to buy a cow for herself so that she can start a cow breeding business. She is not married and she lives with her parents. She is requesting $750.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Naiden

texts.en: Naiden N. lives in the village of Medkovetz. He works in the nearby town of Vratza, where he and his parents have a farm. More specifically, they breed cows. At present, they have three cows. His parents are retired and take care of the stock. Naiden and his parents need to buy fodder for the winter period and are applying for a $750 loan so that they can do so.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for the winter period

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en: Nikola R. has been a registered agricultural producer for 4 years. Previously, he was a constructing engineer and his wife was a teacher; now, they have both retired and are focusing on their farming business. More specifically, Nikola now breeds 60 cows on his own farm. People think well of him in the village in which he lives. Nikola R. is applying for a $750 loan, which he will use to buy more fodder for his cows.

loans.use: Purchasing more fodder for his cows

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. sells provisions & foodstuff in her area in Edo State.  She is 47 years old and is married with 2 children.  She has been in this business since 2000.  She is requesting a loan of $625 to enable her to buy more provisions & foodstuff to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuff  to sell

loans.name: Rangel

texts.en: Rangel K. lives in the village in Medkovetz, near Vratza. He has a farm with eight cows near the house in which he and his wife live. He and his wife are unemployed; consequently, this farming business is their family's only source of income. Rangel needs $750 so that he can buy one more cow for his farm.

loans.use: Purchasing one more cow for his farm

loans.name: Metodi

texts.en: Metodi A. is married and has three children. He lives in his parents’ house. Metodi is a trader. More specifically, he deals with grain. In his free time he helps his parents in their farm. Recently he decided to start a cow breeding business. He wants to buy a cow so that he can found a cow farm together with two other villagers. He is requesting a $750 loan so that he can do this.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Donka

texts.en: Donka B. lives with her boyfriend in the village of Medkovetz. She has two children. Her boyfriend works as a railroad worker. After meeting the MIKROFOND staff, Donka decided to start a farming business. She is requesting $750, which she will use to purchase a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector lives on the Simeón Roncal Street in the area of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. By day, he works as a public servant in the mayor's office and by night, he works a taxi driver to supplement his income. The loan that he requests is for a deposit to restore his home and convert part of it into a kitchen and live more comfortably.

For his credit history, you can access it through a new loan. In his credit history, you can find four previous loans that have been all paid off in total. Hector has been a client with IMPRO since 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hector vive en la calle Simeón Roncal de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleado publico en la alcaldía durante el día y por la noche trabaja como taxista para mejorar sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su vivienda, habilitando el depósito para que sea una cocina y así poder vivir más cómodamente. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. En su historial de créditos se encuentran cuatro créditos anteriores que han sido cancelados en su totalidad. Hector es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2000.

loans.use: To restore his home to convert part of it into a kitchen

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel M. is single and lives in his parents' house, where he helps his parents in their farm. More specifically, he breeds sheep and goats. He is applying for this $750 loan in order to be able to buy fodder for the winter period.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder

loans.name: Gentcho

texts.en: Gentcho A. lives with his wife in the village of Medkovetz. They are both retired and now have a farming business. More specifically, they breed sheep. Gentcho is applying for a $750 loan, which he will use to buy 10 more sheep for his farm. Any remaining money will be spent on fodder.

loans.use: Purchasing 10 more sheep

loans.name: Biser

texts.en: Biser N. gets social benefits because he is a cardiac patient. He is not married but lives with his girlfriend and has two children. In addition to working as a guard in the village school, he breeds geese. He wants to buy some more geese and some corn for them. He is requesting a $750 loan so that he can do this.

loans.use: Purchasing geese and corn

loans.name: Victor H.

texts.es:
Victor lives in the borough of Tembladerani in La Paz, the capital city of Bolivia. He supports his family with his salary as a driver. He lives in his father-in-law´s house along with wife and children.

The credit will be used to turn a storage room into a bedroom for his children. Right now the kids share one room, but have grown and need more space.

This is Victor´s first time with IMPRO, and according to his credit score he qualifies to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor vive en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como chofer asalariado con lo cual mantiene a su familia; vive en la casa de su suegro con su esposa y sus hijos. El crédito que solicita es para transformar la habitación de depósito en dormitorio para sus hijos ya que actualmente ellos viven en una sola habitación y los niños ya crecieron y necesitan mayor comodidad, No tiene antecedente con Impro pero según la evaluación socio-económica efectuada Victor califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: Turn a storage room into a bedroom for his children

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget I. is 47 years old and is married with one child.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells jewellery & clothes.  She has been in this business for 3 years and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $550 to enable her to buy more jewellery & clothes to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more jewellery & clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raina

texts.en: Raina K. is married and works together with her husband. They have a farm on which they breed hens and geese. Their two kids are students. Raina will spend this $750 loan on stock and corn.

loans.use: Purchasing stock and corn

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly lives with her husband and children in their house in La Paz, the capital of Bolivia. She sells shoes - women´s shoes, kids´, sneakers, among others. She has a store in the zone "El Alto" and sells there on teh market days every Thursday and Friday. Other days of the week Nelly sells her shoes according to orders she receives.

Nelly has been a Kiva client once before. She timely paid off her loan and made good use of the money. The current loan will be used to buy more shoes and thus continue increasing her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly vive en casa propia en la calle Bolívar de la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de calzados de damas, niños, tenis, etc. Tiene un puesto fijo en la ciudad de El Alto y allí vende únicamente los días jueves y domingos que son días de feria; los demás días acomoda el producto de acuerdo a pedido. Nelly ya fue cliente de Kiva y el crédito anterior ya fue cancelado e hizo una muy buena utilización del dinero. El crédito que solicita ahora es para compra de más mercadería y así seguir aumentando su capital. Su antecedente Histórico es bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, thus continuing to increase her stock

payments.comment: Early payoff. Nelly is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo Q. lives with his wife and children in a rented place in La Paz, the capital of Bolivia. He supports his family with his job as a taxi driver. He is asking for a loan to cover the costs of maintenance and spare parts for his taxi.

Ricardo is a client of IMPRO since 2006. He has previously applied for and paid back three loans, and qualifies for this new credit, now having a good history with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ricardo Q. vive en anticretico en la av. Buenos Aires de la zona San Martin de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos; la actividad que el tiene es de taxista con la cual mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para cubrir los costos de mantenimiento y compra de repuestos para su taxi. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006. Ha tenido tres créditos anteriores que han sido cancelados en su totalidad y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito ya que tiene un buen antecedente.

loans.use: To cover the maintenance and spare parts for his taxi

payments.comment: Early payoff. Ricardo will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad lives in the borough "Las Lomas" in La Paz, the capital city of Bolivia. From a very young age she worked preparing and selling food. With the credit she obtained previously, through Kiva and IMPRO, she added furniture to the area where she currently sells food. She sells primarily to drivers, since she is located right in front of a "minibus" stop.

The new credit is destined to buy ingredients to prepare her food, now since the Bolivian economy has recently been attacked by inflation. She will buy at the high costs, although this won´t have a large affect on the prices of the different meals she sells.

Felicidad is a former Kiva and IMPRO client and with her good history she is approved to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Felicidad vive en casa propia en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona Las Lomas de La Ciudad de La Paz; desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida. Con el crédito que se le concedió anteriormente, via Kiva, amobló la pensión donde actualmente vede comida a los chóferes ya que ella vende justo en la parada de una línea de minibuses. El nuevo crédito que ahora solicita será para la compra de materiales para producir su comida, ahora que el efecto inflacionario está atacando el mercado boliviano, y así comprar a precios que aunque están altos, aun no influirán mucho en sus precios de venta de los diferentes platos que ella cocina. Ella ya es parte de los clientes que pidieron préstamo a través de Kiva. Es cliente antigua de Impro y por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food stand

payments.comment: Early payoff. Felicidad will apply for another loan.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy I. is 35 years old and married with 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells foodstuff and has been in this business for 7 years.  She is requesting a loan of $550 to enable her to buy more foodstuff to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German Flores rents and lives with his wife and children in La Paz, the capital city of Bolivia. He has a car with which he works as a taxi driver and with this job he supports his family. His car needs some repair, and German is applying for a loan to buy auto parts so he can continue working as normal. His taxi job is the family´s one source of income.

German was previously approved two loans with IMPRO, all the scheduled payments paid back in full. Because of this good history, German is approved to receive this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

El señor German Flores vive en alquiler en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos; tiene un auto que él mismo trabaja como taxi con cuyos ingresos mantiene a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar repuestos que el auto necesita y poder seguir trabajando con normalidad ya que es su única fuente de ingreso. Por su antecedente Histórico el puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Dos créditos anteriores fueron concedidos a German, los cuales fueron pagados completamente en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: To buy new parts for his taxi

payments.comment: Early payoff. German will apply for another loan.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is from Edo State.  She is 42 years old, married with 6 children, and sells tailoring materials.  She has been a LAPO member for four years, and has been in business since 2003.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Mrs. Sandra E. is from Delta State but lives in Benin City, Edo State.  She is 28 years old and married with 2 children.  She sells baby and women's clothes, and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting the sum of $400 to enable her to buy more baby and women's clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more baby and women's wear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chairs, tables and other fixed assests for his restaurant

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate E. is from Edo state.  She is 40 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a store where she sells kitchen utensils.  She has been in this business since 2004 and has been a LAPO member for the past 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $625 to buy more kitchen utensils to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Mrs. Rita O. is 30 years old.  She is married with 2 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria.  She runs a business center where she types and makes photocopies for people living in her community.  She spent 2 years learning the business before she started her own in 2005.  She is seeking a loan of $475 to buy more computers for typing.  She is grateful.

loans.use: To buy more computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her store and to purchase a copy machine

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es:
Business Description

Neyda sells products to meet the basic needs of her customers. She has run this business for five years now with the help of her daughter. She also sells clothing to clients who hire her to clean their homes, which is another source of income for her family.

Loan Use

She needs the loan to finish equipping her store and to buy more merchandise to keep her customers satisfied.

Personal Information

Neyda is 45 years old and is currently separated. She has two children who are both students. Her house is made of different material and her family life is stable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Neyda tiene a la venta productos de primer necesidad, este negocio lo inicio hace cinco años con la ayuda de su hija. Actualmente no solo vende estos productos sino que vende ropa de forma ambulante a las personas donde la contratan para hacer limpieza en las casas, que ademas es otro ingreso para su familia.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el credito para terminar de adecuar el local donde vende sus productos y para adquirir mas mercaderia y tener satisfechos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 46 años y actualmente esta separada tiene dos hijos que estudian y su casa es de construccion mixta, tiene estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: To equip her store

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is 33 years old.  She is married with 2 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria.  She fixes and braids hair, and is currently a LAPO member.  She is seeking a loan of $475 to buy weavon, hair cream and relaxer to sell.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream and relaxer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her classrooms

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy O. has been in the business of selling cooked food and drinks since 2005.  She is 45 years old and married with 2 children.  She lives in Benin City and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 to enable her buy a deep freezer, which will help her to cool her drinks and preserve her food stuff.  She thanks you.

loans.use: For the purchase of a deep freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Elumwenma

texts.en: Mrs. Elumwenma O. sells fried bush meat to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 2001.  She is 32 years old, married with 4 children, lives in Benin City and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to enable her to buy more bush meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bush meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase utensils and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make improvements to business location and purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional products for kitchen/eatery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 47 years old and married with 5 children.  She sells frozen food, plastic rubber, notebooks and pure water.  She has been with LAPO for 3 years as a secretary.  She comes from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since the year 1992.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more frozen food, plastic, notebooks and pure water to sell.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food, plastic, notebooks and pure water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seafood and adapt his store

loans.name: Shu Olivia

texts.en:
Shu Olivia is married to Neba George and is the mother of two children under 15 years of age. In order for her to support her husband in providing for the family, she was sponsored by her husband in a vocational training center where she was trained as a seamstress.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to sew and sell dresses. She also plans to train other apprentices in tailoring in the future. The profit will help her support her husband in paying their kids' school fees.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase sewing thread, buttons and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her store

loans.name: Neba Florence

texts.en:
Florence and her five kids are suffering from a broken home and, as a result, have gone through a lot of suffering, including lack of food to eat and lack of school fees.

Motivated by these problems, Florence became a GHAPE member. with a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in the business she already runs, that of selling drugs and cosmetics and running a telephone booth. The profit will enable her pay the school fees for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase materials for construction of a booth, buy drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Angwi Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widow with two children all below the age of 15 years. As an unemployed single mother, she has not found it easy providing for these children.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA) she plans to invest in sales of water fufu and ‘’ndzah.’’ Water fufu is grated and fermented cassava while ndzah is the local name for certain fruit, in most cases huckleberries.

The profit will enable her to pay school fees for her children and buy food for them. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Purchase of ndzah, water fufu

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like fabric and needles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork at wholesale prices

loans.name: Ulvi

texts.en:
Ulvi is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ulvi's business is translation of texts from Azeri to English and vice versa. Now he wants to purchase a new computer so as to be able to have internet connection at home. That's why he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for $425 loan.

loans.use: To buy a computer to use for his translation business

loans.name: Che Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a single mother of four children, two of which are below the ages of 15 years. Even though she is a single mother, she tries her best to see her children get the minimum education. Her business selling food items has been their only source of income.

In order to invest more capital in to this business, she requested a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA). The profit will be used to meet the basic needs for her children and pay their school fees.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase food items, soap, matches and toilet paper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Mankaa

texts.en:
Mankaa E. was born in 1979 and is a single mother of one child. As the eldest daughter of the family, she has had a lot of difficulty covering her responsibilities because she has made very little profit from her small business selling food items.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in this business and even sell body lotions. The profit will be used to support and feed her family and to pay school fees for her child.

She plans to repay the loan in 12-15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase materials to construct a booth, buy drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alim has an internet computer cafe in the center of Saatli city. The business is quite interesting but demands investment from time to time, otherwise Alim would  risk losing his customers. This summer Alim applied for a loan of US$ 500 from Normicro's Saatli branch to renovate his internet cafe. If he is able to do this, Alim will have higher income to support his parents.

loans.use: To buy a new computer for his internet cafe

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Business Description

Beatriz has been working in this job for 18 years. She began by purchasing piglets with a small amount of capital, which she would raise and sell. She has recently began selling food as well. She works from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Her daughters help her with the food sales, and she sells pork in the areas near her home.

Loan Use

This loan will be invested in the purchase of more piglets for later sale. She will also use the money to modify her tricycle which she uses to distribute the food that she sells.

Personal Information

Beatriz is a a single mother. She has 4 adult children who help her in her business. She is currently adding to her home. Through her earning she has been able to begin construction using cement. She would like to finish it, and to set up a place to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Beatriz tiene una experiencia de 18 años en su actividad. Se inicio con un capital pequeño comprando chanchitos para criarlos y después venderlos. Hace poco tiempo también se esta dedicando a la venta de comida. Mantiene un horario de trabajo de 8 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. Sus hijas le ayudan en la venta de comida. Y en la venta de carne de chancho recorriendo los sectores de su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de más chanchitos para su posterior venta. Además de adecuar su triciclo en le cual realiza el recorrido de la venta de comida.

Información Personal

Beatriz es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos los que son adultos y le ayudan en los negocios que ella posee. Actualmente ella esta adecuando su casita. Ha logrado gracias a sus ganancias comenzar la construcción de cemento. Su deseo es poder terminarla y montar ahí un local de venta de comida.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of piglets

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Business Description

Angela has been working in this job for 6 years. Her husband helped her get started so that she could work on her own. They now each have their own business, bringing income into their home. They both work buying and selling plastic pipes. Angela works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Recently they aquired a truck which they use to purchase work material.

Loan Use

This loan will be used to purchase recycled raw material for later sales. She has orders for this recycled material.

Personal Information

Angela is 31 years old. She has 4 children in school. She is currently living in her the home of her in laws. Her husband works in the same business, but with different kinds of material. They hope to save money in the future and purchase a lot of their own where little by little they will build a home of their own.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ángela tiene una experiencia de 6 años con su actividad. Su esposo la guió para que ella trabaje sola. Actualmente cada uno tiene su propio negocio y genera ingresos para el hogar. Su negocio consiste en compra y venta de tubos plásticos. Tiene un horario de trabajo de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Hace poco adquirieron un camión en el cual realizan las compras del material de trabajo.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de materia prima como reciclaje para su posterior venta. Tiene pedidos de este material reciclado.

Información Personal

Ángela tiene 31 años. Y 4 hijos los cuales estudian. Actualmente ella vive en la casa de sus suegros. Su esposo realiza la misma actividad con otra clase de materiales. A futuro esperan poder ahorrar y comprar un solar. Donde poco a poco construir su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of plastics to recycle and sell

payments.comment: Client has prepaid their loan, business doing well

loans.name: Audrey

texts.es:
Business Description

Autrey has been working for 6 years selling clothing, cosmetics, and costume jewelry. Her husband helped her to start with $100 in capital. She works the areas near her home every day, in the afternoons. In the mornings, and into the afternoon she works providing domestic help in a private home.

Loan Use

This loan will be invested in supplying the business with merchandise. This is a good time of the year, and she has pending orders for various articles.

Personal Information

Audrey is 42 years old and married. She has just one daughter, who is about to graduate from the national police academy. Her husband works as a security guard at a company in the north part of the city. They have a small car which she uses for work in the evenings after her husband gets off work. Their home is made of cement. They have been able to finish it thanks to their income.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Autrey tiene una experiencia de 6 años con la venta de diferentes artículos como lo son: prendas de vestir, cosméticos, bisutería. Su esposo le ayudo con un capital de 100 dólares con que se inicio. Trabaja todos los días de la semana por las tardes. Recorriendo los sectores cercanos a su domicilio. Por las mañana y parte de la tarde trabaja realizando quehaceres domésticos en casa particular.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio con mercadería. Esta época del año es muy buena. Además ya tiene pedidos de varios artículos.

Información Personal

Audrey es casada. Tiene 42 años y una sola hija la cual esta próxima a graduarse de policía nacional. Su esposo trabaja de guardia de seguridad en una empresa del norte de la cuidad. Poseen un carrito el cual el lo trabaja por las noches después que ha salido de su guardianía. Su casa es de cemento. Gracias a sus ingresos han logrado terminarla.

loans.use: Supply business with merchandise

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan owns and operates a clothing stand in the bazaar of his hometown of Saatli, which is located in the central plains area of Azerbaijan. He is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and quality of his clothing inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his clothing inventory and improve his turnover

loans.name: Janeth Bethy

texts.es:
Janeth is 32 years old and she sells groceries in the market in Sacaba. She has 3 children, who are 6, 9, and 11 years old, all school-aged. Her husband is a taxi driver. They live in a single-family home.

The business is grocery sales and she has more than 4 years of experience in it. She sells a variety of products: noodles, rice, canned goods, chuño (a type of freeze-dried potato), spices, different types of corn, condiments, macaroni, sodas, cereals, chilies, cooking oil, and other common food products. Business is good and there is much demand. There is a lot of competition in Sacaba’s market. Everyone is always trying to sell but Janeth’s business is well stocked and her prices are always a little lower than those of other vendors, and that is how she is able to sell so much merchandise. The prices of some products are lower because she buys them at whole-sale price.

Janeth has credit history with Agrocapital, works loyally with the institution, and has paid her loans on time. She was very shy about having her photo taken and that is why she does not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

JANETH DE 32 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN EL MERCADO DE SACABA. TIENE 3 HIJOS DE 6,9 Y 11 AÑOS, TODOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR EL ESPOSO NO PARTICIPO DEL CREDITO POR MOTIVOS DE VIAJE, ÉL SE DEDICA AL AUTOTRANSPORTE VIVEN EN SACABA EN CASA FAMILIAR. EL NEGOCIO ES LA VENTA DE ABARROTES CUENTA CON MAS DE 4 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA VENDE DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS FIDEOS, ARROZ, CONSERVAS, CHUÑO, ESPECIAS, MAICES, CONDIMENTOS, MACARRONES, REFRESCOS EN BOLSA, CEREALES, PICANTES,ACEITE Y OTROS PRODUCTOS QUE SON DE LA CANASTA FAMILIAR TIENE UN NEGOCIO BUENO Y SOBRE TODO CON MUCHA DEMANDA. LA COMPETENCIA ES MARCADA YA QUE EN EL MERCADO DE SACABA TODOS SIEMPRE ESPERAN VENDER PERO EL NEGOCIO DE LA CLIENTE ES MUY SURTIDO Y SIEMPRE TIENE PRECIOS UN POCO MAS BAJOS QUE LOS OTROS, ESTO ES LA BASE PARA QUE PUEDA VENDER MUCHO MAS LOS PRODUCTOS. LOS PRECIOS SON MENORES EN ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS YA QUE ELLA COMPRA AL POR MAYOR LA CLIENTE CUENTA CON EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION ESTA FIDELIZADA A TRABAJAR CON AGROCAPITAL, ES UNA CLIENTE NORMAL EN SUS CANCELACIONES. SE HACE NOTAR QUE LA CLIENTE SE ENCONTRABA MUY SUCEPTIBLE A QUE LE SAQUEN LA FOTO POR LO QUE PREFIRIÓ NO SALIR EN LA MISMA.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery business

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 48, married with three children, and lives in a village near Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Akif has a small shop and sells hardware. He cannot develop his business because he has no collateral to use to get a loan from commercial banks. That is why he applied for a US$ 500 loan (one that can be made without collateral) to Normicro's Saatli branch. Now he is awaiting some investments from KIVA lenders so that he will be able to increase the variety of goods he sells. The higher income could help him to develop his business and better support his family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Business Description

Fernanda does computer work, and also provides a copy service. She also cuts both mens' and womens' hair. She has 6 years of experience in this field, having learned from a family member who trained her while she saved money to begin her own business. Her work day is from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.

Loan Use

Fernanda is asking for a loan to purchase more stationary material, including pictures, notebooks, pencils, and other childrens' school supplies. Because of the growth of her client base, Fernanda has seen the need to offer additional merchandise, so that she can continue to serve her client's needs.

Personal Information

Fernanda has two children and is 29 years old. One of her children attends school, an opportunity made possible by Fernanda's hard work. She and her husband have a friendly cement home. Fernanda's desire is to grow her business and increase her capital, for the benefit of her children and her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Fernanda se dedica a realizar trabajos en computadora como también copias a documentos, además de cortes de cabello tanto para hombre como para mujeres. Teniendo como experiencia 6 años, trabajando en este tipo de negocio, ya que esta actividad lo aprendió de un familiar quien le inculco esta labor, en la que con capital propio saco adelante su propio negocio. Trabajando desde las 8am, hasta las 19pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Fernanda solicita el crédito para comprar más materiales de papelería como: láminas estudiantiles, cuadernos, lápices y otros artículos para la educación de los niños. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Fernanda se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su mercadería, para de esa manera tener a sus clientes muy bien atendidos.

Información Personal

Fernanda tiene 29 años de edad, en donde solo vive con sus 2 hijos, que actualmente los tiene a uno estudiando, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza en su actividad a podido darle esa oportunidad de estudio, además su domicilio es de estructura de cemento muy acogedora, donde también vive con su conyugue. Los anhelos de Fernanda es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de sus hijos, en si de la familia.

loans.use: Purchase of stationary materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials for furniture finishing

loans.name: Mahir

texts.ru:
Mahir J. was born and lives in Saatli Town, Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old and grew up in a poor family. 5 years ago Mahir started his own business. At first he rented a two room location in the center of town, purchased 5 computers and got internet service. At the same time he provided his clients with computer programs and spare parts.

Mahir now needs to upgrade his computers or risk losing his clients due to technology advances. He relies on his income to support his parents and family and cannot risk losing his business. Mahir will use his loan to purchase new equipment for his Internet Café.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Махир родился и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 30 лет, он выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. 5 лет тому назад он начал своё дело. Для начала он арендовал двух комнатное помещение в центре города, оборудовал его, купил 5 компьютеров, провел в салон интернет. И в то же время он поставлял своим клиентам программное обеспечение и запчасти. Конечно же скорость морального старения компьютерного оборудования прямо пропорциональна скорости развития техники. И сегодня Махир оказался перед дилеммой обновления оборудования или потери клиентуры. Последнее грозит Махир быть роковым, т.к. его заработок обеспечивает необходимым минимумом его родителей и семью. Поэтому Махир обратился к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру KIVA- за предоставлением ему займа чтобы получить возможность переоборудовать свой Интернет клуб.

loans.use: To puchase computers

loans.name: Aleircina Medina

texts.en:
Aleircina is an active and very positive woman who is striving to make a living.  She is married with four children.  Two of them, the eldest, attend the public school of the town.  Her husband is a taxi driver. 
Aleircina is a clever businesswoman and her entrepreneurial spirit has helped her be successful in her business activities.  
Six months ago, she took a loan from our organization and started to sell clothes for children.  She operates her business in a public place and could obtain a lot of customers.
She says that with this activity she better supports her family and now she can save money for emergency issues.
Currently, the entrepreneur needs more credit to make her business larger.  She wants to buy larger quantities of garments in Santo Domingo, the capital, in order to augment her sales and income.  As such, Aleircina will have more facilities to help her husband financially support the family.

loans.use: To purchase big quantities of children's clothes in order to make her business larger.

loans.name: Ulvi

texts.en: Ulvi owns a small electronics goods store in the small town of Saatli located in the central region of Azerbaijan. Ulvi is married with two children and is looking for funding so that he can expand his inventory to cover a wider range of goods and provide his shop assistant (that 's the man in this photo) with a higher salary. For this purpose he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 500 loan.

loans.use: To increase the variety of of his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 27 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Roman rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful but needs some investment to increase the daily turnover.

Roman has no collateral to use in applying to the commercial banks. That's why he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 500 loan. This loan would allow him to buy and sell bigger amount of goods and to provide better the necessities of life of his parents.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Afig

texts.en: Afig is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 27 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He sells software products to customers and provides their computers and mobile phones with programs, games, etc. But he is not satisfied with his own, old computer. He plans to buy a new one to be more flexible so as to better serve his clients.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his working capital.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 25 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Samir owns and operates a small food market in Saatli town; he has been in this business for 5 years. The business is stable because Samir has been collecting his customers over the time he has been running this shop. Unfortunately, he has no capital to invest to diversify his inventory, increase turnover and thereby the income to provide all the necessities of life. Comercial banks demand collateral to give Samir credit, but Samir has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, where we disburse loans without demanding collateral. Samir has requested a loan of US$ 500. This loan would allow him to buy and sell bigger amounts of goods and to develop his business for the good of his family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory and thus his profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter is 34 years old and married. He works as a mason and his wife works as a maid. Walter lives with his wife and three children in their own house. He has a lot of experience working in construction and, because of the fine work he does, he never lacks for jobs. Currently the demand in construction is very high, due to a shortage of labor. Walter is currently working outside of the city. He never lacks for jobs because he has many acquaintances who are familiar with his work. He will build a bathroom in his house, which will make his family more comfortable. He only has credit in Agrocapital. He doesn’t have loans with other institutions, nor guarantees.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.
