WALTER ES UN SEÑOR CASADO DE 34 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SUS SERVICIOS COMO MAESTRO ALBAÑIL CONTRATISTA Y SU ESPOSA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA. WALTER VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS TRES HIJOS EN SU CASA PROPIA. EL CLIENTE TIENE MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO DE LA CONSTRUCCION Y POR SU TRABAJO FINO ES QUE NO LE FALTAN OBRAS. ACTUALMENTE LA DEMANDA EN EL RUBRO DE LA CONSTRUCCION SE A ELEVADO BASTANTE DEBIDO A LA FALTA DE MANO DE OBRA, WALTER ESTA CON TRABAJO ACTUALMENTE FUERA DE LA CIUDAD, NO LE FALTA YA QUE CUENTA CON BASTANTES CONOCIDOS QUE SABEN DE SU TRABAJO. EL CLIENTE CONSTRUIRA UN BAÑO EN SU VIVIENDA,CON LO CUAL DARA MAYOR COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA. EL CLIENTE SOLO TIENE CREDITO EN AGROCAPITAL,NO TIENE MAS CREDITOS EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES, NI OTRAS GARANTIAS.

loans.use: To improve his house by building a bathroom

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
Raimundo is 35 years old and he works as a salesman in a micro-credit store that sells household appliances. His family is made up of his wife and two children, who are 2 and 6 years old. They live in the neighborhood of La Esperanza, on San Javier Avenue, in the Los Cachos zone.

Raimundo is one of the longest-employed and hardest working employees in the store where he has been working for 7 years. At the store they sell things on credit, such as: blenders, cameras, irons, televisions, DVD players, washing machines, cellular phones, and even freezers and refrigerators, in addition to stereos and other things. Raimundo is one of the best sales people in the store. This has allowed him to increase his income from the bonuses that he gets for every sale completed.

The price of gold varies according to supply and demand. Raimundo buys 18 karat gold at $13.00/ gram and sells it at $16.00/ gram. This is the third loan for Raimundo and he has a good payment history. His previous loans were for $600.00 each and he paid the last two loans only two days late.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

RAIMUNDO DE 35 AÑOS TRABAJA COMO VENDEDOR EN UNA TIENDA DE MICROCREDITOS DE ELECTROMESTICOS PARA EL HOGAR. SU FAMILIA ESTÁ CONFORMADA POR SU ESPOSA Y DOS HIJOS DE 2 Y 6 AÑOS RESPECTIVAMENTE. VIVEN EN EL BARRIO LA ESPERANZA DE LA AV. SAN JAVIER ZONA LOS CHACOS. RAIMUNDO ES UNO DE LOS CLIENTES MAS ANTIGUOS Y TRABAJADORES DE LA TIENDA CON 84 MESES DE ACTIVIDAD. EN LA TIENDA DONDE TRABAJA, SE DAN A CREDITO DESDE UNA LICUADORA, CAMARA FOTOGRAFICA, PLANCHA, TELEVISOR, DVD, LAVADORA, CELULARES HASTA FRIZZER Y HELADERAS ADEMAS DE EQUIPO DE MUSICA Y OTROS. RAIMUNDO ES UNO DE LOS MEJORES VENDEDORES DE LA TIENDA, ESTO LE HA PERMITIDO AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS POR LOS BONOS QUE RECIBE POR CADA VENTA REALIZADA. EL PRECIO DEL ORO VARIA DE ACUERDO A LA OFERTA Y DEMANDA DEL MERCADO, EL QUE COMERCIALIZA RAIMUNDO LO COMPRA DESDE $us.13 y LO VENDE A $us.16 EL GRAMO DE ORO DE 18 KILATES. ESTE ES EL TERCER CREDITO DEL CLIENTE TIENE BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGO, LOS ANTERIORES CREDITOS FUEROS DE $us 600, CADA UNO CON TAN SOLO DOS DIAS DE RETRASO EN LOS DOS ULTIMOS CREDITOS CANCELADOS.

loans.use: For his business of buying and selling gold and to obtain papers to legalize a parcel of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Yanilda

texts.en:
Yanilda is 23 years old and married with three children.  They all go to the public school of the zone. Yanilda dedicates herself to the sale of flowerpots.  She sells different kinds and sizes of these products.  Her clientele is maD. up mostly of florists and nurserymen.  She has been operating this business for more than one year.
Actually, she sells the flowerpots in a public place during the day, and at night she has to take them to her house or keep them in a storehouse close to the place.  Therefore, she has to incur expenses for the storage of the flowerpots.  She says that the storehouse is not safe, since sometimes flowerpots disappear or get broken.  Thus, she is thinking seriously about renting a small location where she can her operate business and make sure that her flowerpots will be safe.
She has applied for a loan in order to reach these goals.  The entrepreneur has a very good credit history since she has already taken from us a loan which she had repaid successfully.

loans.use: To rent a small location to operate her business.  The entrepreneur sells flowerpots and needs to keep them in a safe place.

loans.name: Migdalia Cabral

texts.en:
Migdalia is very active, with all the youthful energy and positivity of a hard-working woman.  She is 20 years old and has a one-year-old son.  She dedicates herself to the sale of tennis shoes, shirts and pants.  She started her business six months ago with a loan which she had taken from our organization.  She wisely used the funds and could repay the loan on time.
She gets the products in the capital and resells them in her community and other provinces.  Her mother helps her , since she works every weekend in the field and got a lot of customers there.
The entrepreneur confesses that her midterm plan is to have a location to run the clothes store.  Meanwhile she is working a lot selling good in the streets.  
She plans to invest the loan requested to buy more second-hand tennis shoes and shirts to sell in December.  That way the entrepreneur will have more means to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: The funds will be used to buy second-hand clothes and shoes to supply the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Ferminia

texts.en:
Ferminia is 25 years old and married with a 5-year-old son.  Actually, she is pregnant and will give birth to a child in a few months. 
Ferminia sells women’s clothes.  She opened her business with credit she had obtained from FSMA.  She could successfully achieve her goals, and the sales activity has been profitable.  Now, she has a lot of loyal customers.
Like any businesswoman, the entrepreneur wants to see the business flourish.  She would like to get more clients and obtain more profit.  She has applied for a second loan to spend to purchase more clothes so as to increase profits.  Ferminia trusts that before long she will get that loan, which will considerably change her business and help her prepare for the birth of her second child.

loans.use: With this second loan, the entrepreneur will purchase bigger quantities of clothes to move her business forward.

loans.name: Mermena

texts.en:
Mermena dedicates herself to the sale of natural juices and fried food.  She started to run this business five months ago with a loan she had obtained from FSMA.  Profits from that activity helped her repay the loan and take care of her two sons (2 years old and 1 year old).  Her husband works as a blacksmith.  Actually, the couple’s weekly income is about USD 100.00.
The entrepreneur is asking for a second loan to enlarge her business.  With the funds, she will buy large amounts of raw materials so that she can prepare and sell more goods.  She will also buy a small freezer so as to preserve the fruits and keep the juices iced .  Like so, the beverages will be more pleasant to the customers.  The entrepreneur really worries about offering good quality service to the clients.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to prepare food and natural juices and to buy a small freezer to preserve fruit.

loans.name: Arelis

texts.en:
Arelis is an optimistic and assiduous woman who is doing her best for the sake of her family.  She is a living example of a persistent and successful businesswoman for the other women of her community.  She is unable to speak, but doesn’t let that disability prevent her from fulfilling her dreams. She has three children that go to the public school of the zone.  Her husband works as a blacksmith.
For more than five years, Arelis has been selling clothes for women.  She started the business with credits she got from FSMA.  She sells the clothes in her house and has a lot of customers.  When she really has difficulties being understood by the clients, she uses a little blackboard and a piece of chalk to convince people to buy her products.  That strategy has had goods results.
Now the entrepreneur wants to augment profits from her business.  She is requesting funds to buy more women’s clothes and introduce men’s clothes in the business in an attempt to satisfy her customers' needs and have new clients.  With the loan, she will keep on teaching people that anyone can succeed in life if she works hard.

loans.use: The entrepreneur, who is unable to speak, will use the funds to buy more women's clothes and introduce men's clothes in the business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is 52 years old and has been a taxi driver for more than 7 years. He is a member of the May 29th Public Transport Taxi union, whose taxi stop is located in front of the Agrocapital office. Antonio resides with his family in the Villa Dolores “F” zone, where they have lived for 15 years.

His son works in a photocopy store that is three years old. Antonio has his own car, which he uses to work and earn his income. Though there is competition, he offers good transportation service, tending to his customers in an efficient and punctual manner. His success is also due to the age of the business. Also, the taxi stop is centrally located in a part of town where busses arrive from the interior of the country.

Antonio will use the loan to buy a photocopy machine. The prices of these machines vary, from $1,200.00 to $1,500.00. He doesn’t have any negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau. Antonio wanted his photo taken of him inside his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ANTONIO DE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DEL AUTOTRANSPORTE DESDE HACE MÁS DE 7 AÑOS, TAMBIÉN ESTÁ AFILIADO AL SINDICATO DE TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO TAXISTAS 29 DE MAYO, CUYA PARADA SE ENCUENTRA EN AL FRENTE DE LA OIFCINA DE AGROCAPITAL. ANTONIO VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA CALLE "B" ESQUINA CALLE 7 # 104 EN LA ZONA VILLA DOLORES "F", CON UNA RESIDENCIA DE 15 AÑOS, SU HIJO TRABAJA EN UNA TIENDA DE FOTOCOPIAS CON UNA ANTIGÜEDAD DE TRES AÑOS. ANTONIO CUENTA CON UNA MOVILIDAD PROPIA LA CUAL LA UTILIZA PARA TRABAJAR Y GENERAR EL SUSTENTO DIARIO. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, EL CLIENTE OFRECE UN BUEN SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE, YA QUE ATIENDE A SUS CLIENTES DE MANERA EFICIENTE Y PUNTUAL, EL ÉXITO TAMBIÉN SE DEBE A LA ANTIGUEDAD DEL SERVICIO, TAMBIÉN SE PUEDE MENCIONAR QUE LA PARADA SE ENCUENTRA EN UNA ZONA CENTRICA DONDE LLEGAN LAS FLOTAS DEL INTERIOR DEL PAIS. EL CLIENTE DESTINARA EL PRESTAMO A LA COMPRA DE UNA MAQUINA FOTOCOPIADORA, LOS PRECIOS DE ESTAS MAQUINAS FOTOCOPIADORAS OSCILAN ENTRE $US. 1,200.- A 1,500.-. EL CLIENTE NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURO DE INFOCRED. SE HACE NOTAR QUE ANTONIO QUISO SACARSE LA FOTO DENTRO DEL TAXI.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier machine

loans.name: Germania

texts.en:
For more than seven years, this 45-year-old single mother has been selling men’s clothes.  She has five children.  Two of them work as translators in Bávaro, a tourist province located on the east coast of the country.  Two others go to university, and one has her own family.
Germania is an experienced businesswoman and has numerous customers.  She gets garments in Santo Domingo, the capital, and in Elías Piña and Dajabón, two border provinces with Haiti.
Germania is thinking about having a location to run the business after a lot of years selling clothes in the streets.  She is asking for credits to buy more clothes and to invest in the rent of a small location.  In the future, she hopes she will have enough income so that she can by a small piece of land and build a location where she will operate her business.  Thus, Germania will offer improved service to her clientele.

loans.use: Loan will be used to acquire clothes and rent a location to operate the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Five months ago, this entrepreneur got credits from FMSA and with the funds she started a small business. She sells soups, vegetable oil, seasoning, beans and other goods to prepare food. She has bought a little table which she uses to display the goods she is selling.

After the first five probationary months, which were very gainful for Delfina, the entrepreneur made up her mind to really do business. She has applied for a second loan with the intention of acquiring bigger quantities of goods so that she can increase her sales margins. This loan will allow the 27-year-old entrepreneur to improve many aspects of the business, and she will better provide food and education for her two sons.

loans.use: To buy goods such as vegetable oil, condiments and soups to supply her small business and make it grow.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
In spite of her very advanced age, Cecilia wants to keep on selling bread mixed with ‘manba’ (peanut butter). She offers different types of ‘manba’. It can be sweet, salted or spicy. Sometimes, she prepares special bread mixed with peanut butter and marmalade.

Cecilia is a Haitian woman that has been living in the Dominican Republic for more than forty years. She came to the country with her husband, who worked in a cane field. After her husband’s death, she had to manage to make a living. She was obliged to spend all her savings to buy food and other things she needed. She started her small business, which has been moving forward because of her devotion and perseverance. She got credits from FSMA in the past and successfully repaid a loan.

Cecilia is requesting a new loan to enlarge her business. She wants to buy more raw materials to prepare bread with ‘manba’. She will also introduce natural juices to the business.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will spend her loan to buy raw materials to prepare the goods she sells and introduce natural juices to the business.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio is 40 year old and married. He sells CDs at the mini-bus stop. His wife sells clothes and shoes in the Okinawa Market. Patricio and his wife have had these businesses for several years. They have always sold all sorts of things. There aren’t many businesses like this in this part of the city, so there isn’t much competition. These products are accessibly priced and the prices vary with the different type of products offered. They don't have any negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

PATRICIO ES UN SEÑOR CASADO DE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE CD´s EN LA PARADA DE MICROS. POR OTRA PARTE SU ESPOSA ATIENDE EL PUESTO DE VENTA DE ROPA Y ZAPATOS QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL MERCADO DE OKINAWA. PATRICIO Y SU ESPOSA DESDE VARIOS AÑOS ATRAS CUENTAN CON ESTOS NEGOCIOS, SIEMPRE SE DEDICARON A LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN DE TODO TIPO DE COSAS. NO HAY MUCHAS VENTA VENTAS CON ESTOS TIPOS DE PRODUCTOS POR LA ZONA, POR LO QUE NO HAY MUCHA COMPETENCIA. LOS PRECIOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS TIENE UN PRECIO ACCESIBLE Y VARIADO DEBIDO A LA DIVERSIDAD DE PRODUCTOS QUE OFRECEN. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGO Y INFOCRED NO PRESENTAN ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand clothing shop

loans.name: Carlota Mercedes

texts.es:
Carlota lives in San Martín, Peru. Her business, a general store, is in town and dedicated to selling groceries. Thanks to her husband and her hard work she has been able to set up her store; previously she sold fast food out of a wooden stand in the local plaza. Now she has her own shop and customers.

With the loan Carlota is requesting, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase large quantities of groceries such as milk, rice, sugar and different kinds of noodles.

Carlota is 48 years old, and works hard every day with care to keep moving ahead. She is a member of a local communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carlota pertenece al Banco Comunal El Triunfo, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. San Martín S/N y se dedica a vender abarrotes. Gracias a su esposo y a su trabajo ha logrado incrementar su negocio ya que anteriormente vendía en la plaza de armas de su pueblo en una cajita de madera y lo que vendía eran golosinas, hoy cuentas con su local propio y tiene clientes. Con el crédito recientemente obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00,($333.00) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como leche en cajas , arroz y azúcar en sacos de 50 kg., aceite en docenas, fideos en paquetes de diferentes marcas y para varios usos. La señora Carlota tiene 48 años, trabaja diariamente con mucho cariño y esfuerzo para salir cada día adelante.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of various groceries

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
Dona is a very active woman who lives in San Martín, Peru. Her business is located in her own home within the city. It's a general store where she sells groceries as well as cosmetics, lingerie, and, most recently, eggs at wholesale. Thanks to her constant attention and dedication she was able to set up the store with iron shelving and glass display cases and stocks it every day with new products.

With the loan Dona is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase eggs to sell wholesale, 50kg sacks of rice and sugar, cosmetics and canned fish, milk and other non-perishable goods.

Dona is 53 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is very active. She leads a women's community group and is a member of a local communal bank. She's also very kind, which helps her sell cosmetics and lingerie to customers. In the future she wants to have a store selling lingerie, gifts and haberdashery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Dona es una mujer activa, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Inmaculada, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jr. Tomás Villacorta Nº 241 y posee una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, lo cual combina con la venta de cosméticos, lencería fina y últimamente huevos al por mayor. Gracias a su constante esmero y dedicación ha logrado ir implementando la bodega, con andamios de fierro, vitrinas de vidrio y surtir cada día con nuevos productos. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 soles ($ 267.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 javas de huevos, para poder vender al por mayor, arroz y azúcar en sacos de 50kg, un stock de cosméticos en docenas y productos como conservas de pescado, leches y otros enlatados. La señora Dona tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es muy activa, dirige un comité de damas de la hermandad del Señor de los Milagros, es muy amigable, lo cual le permite hacer clientela para la venta de sus cosméticos y lencería fina. En el futuro desea tener una tienda de lencería, regalos y mercería.

loans.use: Purchase various groceries and cosmetics

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva lives in Saposoa, in the San Martín region of San Martín. Her business, a clothing store, is located there and is dedicated to sell clothes for adults and children. Elva is 76 years old, retired from a job in education and lives with her mother. She is single and thanks to her efforts, little by little she managed to have a shop to sell her merchandise and also increase her inventory. She started out selling door to door to gain clients. Every day she works hard, and she stands out because she is a very enterprising woman. She belongs to a local communal bank.

With the $850 loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase a wooden display cases to organize and show off the clothing she sells, and also purchase various styles of clothing for different occasions for men women and children by the dozen. Her goal is to be a wholesale shop in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Elva pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoínas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Cajamarca No. 234 y se dedica a la Venta de Ropas de niños y adultos. La señorita. Elva tiene 76 años, es jubilada de educación y vive sola con su mamá, es soltera y gracias a su propio esfuerzo poco a poco a logrado tener un local donde vender su mercadería y también aumentarlo ya que en sus inicio los ofrecía de casa en casa logrando captar clientes. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) , el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará un estante de madera para organizar y exhibir la ropa que vende, además comprará ropa en variados modelo y para diversas ocasiones para damas, caballeros y niños en docenas ya que en el futuro su meta es ser mayorista. Todos los días trabaja y se destaca por ser una mujer muy emprendedora.

loans.use: Purchase display cases and various styles and types of clothing

loans.name: Emith

texts.es:
Emith is a multitalented woman who lives in San Martín, Peru. Her business, a general store, is located in her home, which she has arranged to accommodate the shop. Emith dedicates herself to the sale of groceries, clothing, and lately is adding hardware, irrigation and drainage products to her item list. She is a member of a businesswoman's communal bank.

With the $400 loan Emith is requesting, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase sheets, various types of shoes, and groceries like milk, canned tuna, and sacks of rice and sugar.

Emith is 54 years old and very enterprising, and her husband helps her with the sales. Their two children manage the investments so that the business grows and in the future becomes a wholesale store, which is her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Emith es una mujer multifacética, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1088 donD. es su domicilio y en el cual ha acondicionado un lugar para poner su negocio. Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general, prendas D. vestir y últimamente está implementando artículos D. ferretería como tubos, accesorios D. agua y desagüe. Con el crédito recientemente recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1200.00 ($ 400.00), el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 1 docena D. sábanas, zapatos en diversos modelos y tallas en docenas y abarrotes en como: leche y atunes en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos. Emith, con sus 54 años es una mujer emprendedora, su esposo la apoya en las ventas, al igual que sus 2 hijos que la orientan en las inversiones para que el negocio crezca y sea en el futuro una tienda mayorista, que es su anhelo.

loans.use: Purchase various grocery, clothing and footwear items

loans.name: Elvira Azucena

texts.es:
Elvira has had her own salon for around 37 years. It's located in a local market in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. Elvira struggled to start her business with only two chairs and a mirror. Since opening it, she has dedicated body and soul to the salon, and that dedication has made it one of the best in the market. Elvira is married with six children and five grandchildren, and is very happy to have successfully grown her business on her own and with the help of CEPRODEL, a micro-loan institution she has worked with for approximately three years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Negocio propio tiene de existir alrededor de 37 años. Está ubicado en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua.

Doña Elvira empezo su negocio apenas con dos sillas y un espejo. Desde sus inicion se dedico a su negocio en cuerpo y alma, y esta dedicacion la que la llevo a destacarse entre los mejores salones del mercado.Casada, con siete hijos y cinco nietos se siente muy dichosa de haber logrado crecer con su propio esfuerzo y la ayuda de CEPRODEL, institucion con la que trabaja desde hace aproximadamente 3 años.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and improve conditions her salon

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Gilma lives in San Martín, Peru, and her business is located in her own home in the Jirón Ramón Castilla neighborhood. She runs a convenience store selling items like vegetables, meats, sausages and soft drinks. It's much like a small mini-mart. Gilma belongs to the Communal Bank of the Immaculate Virgin.

With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, Gilma will purchase supplies like 50kg sacks of sugar and rice, two packages of oil, milk, canned goods, sausages, noodles, detergents, and other items her store needs. Gilma feels that her business helps out a lot and she provides good customer service, keeping her store open for clients all day long. She wants to keep growing the store and buy a cooler.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen D. la Inmaculada, vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. San Martín, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín, su negocio está ubicada en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Ramón Castilla cuadra 6 y se dedica a su bodega donD. venD. Abarrotes, verduras, carnes, embutidos, gaseosas, es como un pequeño mercadito. Con el crédito recientemente recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,500.00 ($ 500.00), que pagará en 4 meses, comprará abarrotes como azúcar y arroz en sacos D. 50 kg cada uno, dos paquetes D. aceite, docenas D. leche, conservas enlatadas, embutidos, fideo en paquetes, docenas D. jabones, detergentes y todo lo referente a la bodega. Gilma, siente que su negocio le ayuda bastante, da buen trato a los clientes que es la clave para que acudan a comprar y mantiene abierto todo el día. Desea más adelante comprar una conservadora D. alimentos y tener su minimarket.

loans.use: Purchase various items for convenience store

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith belongs to the Community Bank "Las Saposoínas". She lives in the San Martón region, in the Huallaga province and the Saposoa district. Her business is located in Avenida Loreto No. 425. She sells a variety of prepared foods.

Thanks to her effort and the good service she gives to her clients she is succeeding in her goal of increasing her sales. She now sells ceviche (a typical Peruvian seafood dish), groceries and vegetables. She also now owns her own premises; she used to sell her products in a rented stall in the market.

With this loan of S/2000 (Peruvian sols, equialent to $666) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 6 months, Judith will buy a glass case in which to display her food, mirrors for her restaurant, dishware (dozens of plates, glasses and coffee cups, along with silverware and cooking utensils), as well as wholesale quantities of shellfish and fish, and raw ingredients for the prepartion of her products. With these purchases she will be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Judith is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. She works daily, demonstrating in this way that she is an enterprising, goal-oriented woman.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoínas, vive en la región San Martín, provincia el Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa, su negocio está ubicado en Av. Loreto No. 425, y se dedica a la venta de la comida variada.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y al buen trato que da a los clientes está logrando aumentar sus ventas, ahora también vende cebiche (comida típica), abarrotes y verduras, por otro lado ahora tiene su local propio ya que antes vendía en un puesto alquilado en el mercado.

Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2,000.00. ($ 666.00),el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una vitrina de vidrio para exhibir sus comidas, espejos para su local, vajillas (docenas de platos, vasos, tasas y cubiertos y utensilios de cocina) además pescados y mariscos al por mayor e insumos para la preparación de los alimentos y así poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.

La señora Judith tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, trabaja diariamente demostrando así ser una mujer emprendedora y con metas.

loans.use: Purchase of a glass display case. Wholesale purchase of raw materials.  Purchase of dishware.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour and other baking ingredients for bread production

loans.name: Madrona De Jesús

texts.es:
Madrona is a hardworking woman, and a member of the Community Bank "Sembrando Futuro". She lives in the San Martín region, in the San Martín province, in the district of Tarapoto. Her business is located in Market No. 2, stall No. 17. For 22 years she has specialized in the sale of spices such as: toasted and ground peanuts, raw peanuts, ground corn, banana flour for mazamorras (a dessert), peanut butter, and seeds of shicashica, a jungle fruit rich in natural oils, along with various vegetables, dry beans and cacao with corn flour.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos for S/ 1000 (Peruvian sols, equivalent to $333), which she will repay in 6 payments, Madrona will buy 200 kg of peanuts with the shells still on with which to prepare peanut butter, yellow corn, sacks of beans and cacao, bunches of green bananas with which to prepare flour, and shicashica seeds.

Madrona is 63 years old. She works tirelessly from 5:00 am. All of her work allows her to support her sons. The good products she sells have brought her a loyal clientele that buys from her every day of the week and is well known around the market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Madrona es una mujer trabajadora, socia del Banco Comunal Sembrando Futuro, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado Nº 2, en el puesto Nº 17. Hace 22 años que se dedica a la venta de especias como: Maní tostado y molido, maní crudo, maíz molido, harina de plátano para mazamorras, mantequilla de maní, semillas de shicashica (fruto selvático) rico en aceite natural, algunas verduras, frejoles secos, cacao con harina de maíz.

Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 soles ($333.00), el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará 200 kg de maní con cáscara para preparar mantequilla, maíz amarillo, frejoles y cacao en sacos, racimos de plátano verde para preparar harina y semillas de shicashica.

Madrona tiene 63 años, desde las 5.00 a.m. trabaja incansablemente, lo cual le permite incluso apoyar a sus hijos, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días y es muy conocida en el mercado. .

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of the raw materials needed to prepare spices

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam belongs to the Community Bank El Triunfo, and lives in the region of San Martín of Peru, in the Picota province and the district of San Hilarion. Her business is located in the street Jr. Bolognesi S/N in San Hilarion's municipal market. She sells convenience items. Thanks to the support of her husband and two daughters and her own efforts she has successfully grown her business and her clientele.

With this loan of S/2000 (Peruvian sols, equivalent to $666), which she will repay in 6 months, Miriam will buy wooden shelving on which to organize the diverse products she sells, and will give a new impulse to her business by buying sacks of fresh vegetables and fruit, bunches of green bananas, groceries such as sugar and rice in sacks of 50 Kg, oil, milk, detergents and soaps in boxes.

Miriam is 33 years old. She works every day, demonstrating that she is an enterprising woman, and when it comes to meeting her goals, she sees no limits and will rise to the occasion with effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Miriam pertenece al Banco Comunal El Triunfo, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de San Hilarión, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi S/N (mercado municipal de San Hilarión), se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus dos hijas y al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, tiene mayor clientela.

Con el reciente crédito obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/.2,000.00,($ 666.00) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará un estante de madera para organizar los diversos productos que venderá, implementará su negocio con verduras y frutas frescas en sacos, plátano verde en racimos, abarrotes como azúcar y arroz en sacos de 50 Kg, aceite, leche, detergente, jabones en cajas.

La señora Miriam tiene 33 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación

loans.use: Buy wooden shelving to organize merchandise. Buy vegetables and fruit wholesale. Buy a variety of grocery items.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.es:
Rolanda is 54 years old and lives in the the Morales district in the province of San Martín and the Department of San Martín. She is a member of the Community Bank "Sargento Lores".

For 10 years Rolanda has owned her own stall in the Market No. 2 in Tarapoto. She sells groceries, personal hygiene items, cleaning products (such as soaps, detergents, disinfectants and brooms), beauty products, and general merchandise, including bags with closures and lanterns. The business has prospered considerably. Still she feels the business could be more prosperous if she offered a wider variety of products. With this loan of S/ 1000 (Peruvian Sols, equivalent to about $333) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 months, Rolanda will buy 2 dozen bags with closures for the market, 2 dozen bottles of shoe polish, shampoos, soaps in boxes, 2 dozen packages of toothpaste, dozens of needles for sewing and needlework, 5 packages of sanitary pads of various brands, 1 dozen pencil cases, 1 dozen money purses, 3 dozen combs of various models, small mirrors, deoderants and 10 packages of toilet paper. She is also thinking about selling shoes and sandals in the near future.

Rolanda lives with her husband and her son, who is finishing his studies. The earnings from the business help to pay for her son's studies. Her husband always helps her around the house and, when needed, in the business. Her wish is that her small stall grows into larger store with a variety of products; she works tirelessly every day to make that wish a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rolanda tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín y es socia del Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”.

Desde hace 10 años tiene su puesto en el mercado Nº 2 de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, artículos de limpieza como, jabones, detergentes, desinfectantes, escobillas, productos de belleza, artículos de higiene personal, artículos de mercería en general, bolsas con cierres, linternas. El negocio ha prosperado bastante y todavía le falta más, ya que cuando tiene variedad de productos siente que vende más.

Con el crédito recientemente recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 ($ 333.00), que pagará en 4 meses, comprará 2 docenas de bolsas con cierre para el mercado, 2 docenas de betunes, champúes, jabones en cajas,2 docenas de cremas dentales, docenas de hilos de coser y tejer, 5 paquetes de toallas higiénicas de diversas marcas,1 docena de cartuchera, 1 docena de monederos, 3 docenas de peines de varios modelos, espejitos, cajitas de mentoles, desodorantes, 10 paquetes de papel higiénico y más adelante piensa vender zapatos y sandalias en cantidad.

Rolanda vive con su esposo y un hijo que está estudiando y con las ganancias del negocio ayuda a pagar sus estudios. Su esposo siempre le ayuda en la casa y a veces en el negocio. Su deseo es que su pequeño puesto se convierta en una tienda más grande con variedad de productos, por lo que día a día lucha incansablemente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise: grocery items, cleaning items and personal hygiene items

loans.name: Gioconda Xiomara

texts.es:
Gioconda is a hardworking and determined woman with 3 school age children. Together with her husband she has fought for the well-being of their family. She started her business selling chicken and similar products around 6 years ago.

With much effort and sacrifice Gioconda succeeded in buying the stall in the Ivan Montenegro market where she runs her business. Her husband has been improving the space little by little.

When Gioconda started her business, she had very little inventory. At this point, she has grown so much that almost all of her sales stall is stocked with various products. She has been able to increase her inventory thanks to her own effort and the support she has received from CEPRODEL.

Gioconda has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and has a record of 8 loans to this date. She feels very happy and proud because her family's quality of life has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Gioconda ha sido una mujer luchadora con tres hijos en edad escolar. En conjunto con su esposo ha luchado por el bienestar de su familia. Ella inicia su negocio de venta de productos como pollo hace alrededor de 6 años.

El local donde esta ubicado en el mercado Ivan Montenegro lo compro con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio y su esposo poco a poco ha ido mejorando la estructura del mismo.

Cuando comenzo el inventario era poco, al dia de hoy ha crecido tanto que casi todo el local esta abastecido de productos varios. Esto lo ha logrado gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo que le ha brindado CEPRODEL.

Gioconda lleva dos años trabajando con CEPRODEL y tiene un record de ocho creditos a la fecha. Se siente muy dichosa y orgullosa porque su calidad de vida y la de su familia ha mejorado.

loans.use: Purchase of products to increase inventory

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta is 44 years old. She belongs to the Community Bank Las Saposoínas and lives in the San Martín region of Peru, in the province of Huallaga, Saposoa district. Her business is located on the street Jr. Lima No. 597 in the city of Saposoa. Violeta and her family sell all kinds of prepared food, and during the evenings they tend to their business selling grilled chicken.

Thanks to the support she receives from her husband and her children and her good service Violeta has successfully grown her clientele. She now even receives institutional orders for special events.

With this loan of S/ 1000 (Peruvian sols, equivalent to $333) from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 6 months, Violeta will buy soft drinks by the dozen, in many different brands, sizes and flavors. She will also buy live chickens in crates of 10 which she use to prepare her grilled chicken, along with the other ingredients she needs for the daily preparation of the food. In this way she'll give her business an important boost and provide a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Violeta tiene 44 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Saposoínas, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Huallaga y distrito de Saposoa, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Lima No. 597, en la ciudad de Saposoa y se dedica, junto a su familia, a la Venta de todo tipo de comida y por las noches atiende como pollería.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo, sus hijos y a la buena atención está logrando tener mayor clientela, ya que incluso tiene pedidos algunas instituciones para eventos.

Con reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000.00,($ 333.00) el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas por docenas, de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, pollos en javas de 10 unidades para la preparación de sus pollos a la braza y demás insumos para la preparación diaria de las comidas y de esta manera implementar su negocio y dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, chicken and food ingredients in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sra. Alejandrina belongs to the Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungainas ("Striving Women of Yungay") community bank. Her business (shop) is located in Yungay in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. The shop is at the Yungay Fairgrounds.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,000 (2,000 Peruvian soles or about US$667), to be repaid in 6 installments, Alejandrina will buy goods at bulk prices (sugar, rice, pasta, milk, cooking oil, soap, etc.) so that she can stock her shop.

Alejandrina, 48, is a widow with 4 children. She started selling general merchandise in a single stall at the Fairgrounds; with the loans she's received, she was able to help her children open their own stalls, also selling general merchandise. With the same drive, she has opened a general store in the nearby "distrito" of Tarica which she operates herself. Her goal is to buy or rent a larger space so that she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alejandrina pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungaínas, su negocio (bodega) esta ubicado en la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash. Su local esta ubicado en el Campo Ferial de Yungay.

Con el reciente préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de mas abarrotes al por mayor ( azúcar, arroz, fideos, leche, aceite, jabón, etc. ) y así poder surtir la bodega.

La señora Alejandrina tiene 48 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, se inicio con la venta de abarrotes en un solo puesto del Campo Ferial, con los créditos obtenidos pudo apoyar a sus hijos en la apertura de sus propios puestos de venta del mismo negocio, del mismo modo ha aperturado una tienda de abarrotes en el distrito de Taricá, Provincia de Huaraz, el cual está a cargo de ella misma. Su objetivo es comprar o alquilar un Stand mas grande y de esta manera ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Faviana Hermelinda

texts.es:
Sra. Faviana belongs to the Las Rosas de Yungay ("The Roses of Yungay") group. Her business is located in Yungay in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), to be repaid in 4 installments, Faviana will buy more kinds of fruit so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers. Her goal is to increase her purchases so that she can take advantage of wholesale prices.

Faviana, 31, is partnered and has 2 children. She's excited to belong the Las Rosas de Yungay group. This is her first loan and her hope is to go on working and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Faviana pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, su negocio esta ubicado en la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 100.) el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mas frutas para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Tiene por objetivo aumentar sus productos y realizar la venta de los mismo al por mayor.

Ella tiene31 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, está muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a un grupo mientras tanto de Manuela Ramos, éste es su primer préstamo, su deseo es continuar trabajando para poder hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of fruit.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Sra. Julia belongs to the Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso ("Forward-Looking Women of Yungay") community bank. Her meat-selling business is located in the market at Yungay in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. Julia, 42, is married and has two children who are in elementary school.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$330), to be repaid in 6 installments, Julia will buy live animals and take them to a local abattoir for slaughtering; by cutting out middle men, she can reduce her selling costs. Julia says that meat sales have fallen because of rising prices; consequently, she not only offers different kinds of meat but also other products demanded by her customers.

Julia hopes to go on improving her business and she'd like to buy modern scales and machines for cutting meat.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Julia pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Yungaínas al Progreso, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Yungay, Provincia D. Yungay, Departamento D. Ancash. Tiene 42 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes están estudiando la primaria.

Con el reciente préstamo que le otorgó Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($ 330) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará animales vivos y los llevará al camal para luego expenderlos en su lugar D. venta, lo que le resulta más beneficioso que comprar a terceros. Comenta la señora Julia que debido al alza D. precios ha disminuido un poco la venta D. carne, por ese motivo no solo ofrece una variedad D. carne sino varios productos para satisfacer a sus clientes.

Su anhelo es mejorar el servicio D. venta D. carnes para lo cual compraría balanzas modernas y maquinas D. cortar carne.

loans.use: Buy live animals.

loans.name: Leocadia Lola

texts.es:
Mrs. Leocadia is part of the Communcal Bank Manuela Ramos of Tinco, and is dedicated to selling flowers. She began this shop selling flowers in Huaraz, and expanded it with more varieties of flowers, which led to her traveling to Lima for more sales. Today she has stores in the city of Huaraz, the Department of Ancash and another one in Lima. She takes flowers from Huaraz to Lima and while there, purchases other varieties of flowers that she then sells in Huaraz.

With the recent loan awared by Manueal Ramos of S/. 2,500.00, which will be repaid over 6 months, she purchased dozens of flowers of many varietes in order to sell them during the month of november in the fiesta of "Todos los Santos" (All Saints Day).

Her dream is to have her own space in Huaraz or in Lima, in order for her to be able to be more established and travel less.

She is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her profits allow her to support her husband in educating their children. Two of her children are at the University in Lima, one is in Carhuaz and is a technician in a hospital, and the other one has an incurable disease. Mr. Leocadia has resigned herself to taking care of him and continues to work in order to provide more for her sick son.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Leocadia, pertenece al Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos de Tinco, se dedica a la venta de flores, inició su negocio vendiendo flores en Huaraz, fue ampliando su negocio con mas variedades y comenzó a viajar a la ciudad de Lima, ahora tiene dos puestos en la ciudad de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash y otro en Lima. Lleva flores de Huaraz a Lima y estando allí compra otras variedades de flores y las vende en las florerías de Huaraz. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, ha comprado flores por docenas de las diferentes variedades para venderlas en el mes de noviembre en la fiesta de “Todos los Santos”. Su deseo es tener un local propio en Huaraz o en Lima, para que pueda tener mayor estabilidad y viajar menos. Ella tiene 48 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Sus ingresos le permite apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos. Dos de ellos están en la Universidad en Lima, una está en Carhuaz y es Técnica en enfermería y el otro tiene una enfermedad incurable, la señora Leocadia se ha resignado a ello y seguirá trabajando para apoyar mas a su hijo enfermo.

loans.use: Purchase many more flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new refrigerated glass display case

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Mrs. Reina is a member of the Communcal Bank of Yungaínas Women for Progress, and her business is run from her home, in the city of Yungay, Province of Yungay, Department of Ancash.

With the recent loan request of Manuela Ramos of S/. 2,3000.00 ($ 765) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will improve her Confectioner's Shop/Bakery, through purchasing flour and tart making utensils/dishes. She is currently waiting on orders for events (birthdays, weddings, baptisms, promotions, etc) which are prepared months ahead of time. At the same time she dedicated herself to selling Shoes and Cosmetics, realizing in those days she did not have any orders for Cofections/Pastries. Her goal is to expand her store and to arrange an area for sales in a central location where she can expose her products.

In this way, with the profits she will purchase dozens of shoes in various models to fulfull the orders she has for this business.

She is 45 years old, has a live-in partner and 2 sons. Her sons are students and her income allows the kids to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Yungaínas al Progreso, su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio, ubicado en la Localidad de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300.00 ($ 765) que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, mejorará sus servicios de Pastelería, comprará harina, arreglos para tortas, actualmente atiende pedidos para eventos (cumpleaños, matrimonios, bautizos, promociones, etc) inclusive con varios meses de anticipación. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de Zapatos y Cosméticos, lo realiza en los días que no tiene pedidos de Pastelería. Su meta es ampliar mas su negocio y alquilar un local en un lugar céntrico en donde expender sus productos. Así mismo, con este capital comprará varias docenas de zapatos de diferentes modelos para atender los pedidos que le hacen. Ella tiene 45 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Sus hijos estudian y los ingresos le permite educarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for confectioner's shop/bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for store.

loans.name: Angelica De

texts.es:
Angelica de C. A. is 43 years old and she has a grocery store, located in the Villa Adela neighborhood of the city of El Alto, and it is open Monday through Sunday. She has been living in a rented house for six years, also in the Villa Adela. She has two children, both of whom are studying in the neighborhood high school. Her husband works as a salaried driver.

Angelica has been working in the grocery business for 12 years and is a punctual client of our institution. Though she faces competition in the market, she has her own clientele because of her gift for good customer service. There is not a fixed price, and because of the variety of grocery merchandise the customers buy the following types of products: sugar, rice, noodles, corn starch, oatmeal, cremola, etc.

Angelica does not have negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau. She was not present at her business the day photos were being taken, so that is why there are two photographs (one of her, one of her business).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ANGELICA ES UNA SEÑORA DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD QUE TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES UBICADA EN EL PLAN 560 MZNA 307 #16 DEL BARRIO VILLA ADELA DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO CON LA VENTA DIARIA DESDE EL DIA LUNES A DOMINGO. LA CLIENTE VIVE EN ANTICRETICO DURANTE SEIS AÑOS, UBICADO EN EL PLAN 560 MZNA. 307 #16 DEL BARRIO DE VILLA ADELA TIENE DOS HIJOS LOS CUALES ESTUDIAN EN EL COLEGIO DEL MISMO BARRIO, EL ESPOSO TRABAJA DE CHOFER ASALARIADO. LA SRA. ANGELICA A. DE C. TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO COMO 144 MESES DEDICADO AL NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES,SIENDO UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, ELLA TIENE SU PROPIA CLIENTELA YA QUE TIENE EL DON DE ATENCION AL CLIENTE. NO EXISTE UN PRECIO FIJO, YA QUE POR LA VARIEDAD DE MERCADERIAS EN ABARROTES LA CLIENTE COMPRA LAS SIGUIENTE VARIEDAD DE ABARROTES (AZUCAR, ARROZ,FIDEO,HARINA MAIZENA, AVENA,CEMOLA,ETC). LA CLIENTE NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURU DE INFOCRED. SE HACE NOTAR QUE LA SEÑORA NO SE ENCONTRABA EN SU PUESTO POR ESA RAZÓN SE PRESENTAN DOS FOTOGRAFÍAS.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a grocery business

loans.name: Victor Alberto

texts.es:
Victor is 41 years old and has a fruit tree farm. He has this business on his property in Sapahaqui. He sells his products mainly in the markets of La Paz, El Alto, and sometimes in the cities of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. Victor lives with his family in the community of El Pabellon, in the county of Sapahaqui, in the province of Loayza. His wife is Aurora Mamani Lopez and she works with him in the cultivation and care of the fruit trees. Their children are studying in the same town.

Victor has more than 20 years of experience in fruit tree cultivation. Though there is competition in the market, he has his own clientele because of the good way he treats his clients. He is preferred by them due to his punctuality in the delivery of the fruits, especially in Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. There are no fixed prices in the sale of the different types of fruits. They vary according to the season and weather each year. Victor does not have any record of negative credit history with the Risk Center or the INFOCRED Bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

VICTOR DE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE REMOSION Y PLANTACION DE ÁRBOLES FRUTALES DE SU PROPIEDAD EN LA LOCALIDAD DE SAPAHAQUI, LA PRODUCCIÓN DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS PRINCIPALMENTE LOS COMERCIALIZA EN LOS MERCADOS DE LA PAZ , EL ALTO Y ALGUNAS VECES EN LAS CIUDADES DE COCHABAMBA Y SANTA CRUZ. VICTOR RADICA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE EL PABELLON DEL CANTON SAPAHAQUI PROVINCIA LOAYZA, JUNTO A SU FAMILIA, SU ESPOSA ES LA SRA. AURORA MAMANI LOPEZ, QUE SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO Y CUIDADO DE FRUTALES JUNTO A SU ESPOSO, SUS HIJOS ESTUDIAN EN LA MISMA LOCALIDAD. VICTOR CUENTA CON MÁS DE 20 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO DE CULTIVOS FRUTALES. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, EL TIENE SU PROPIA CLIENTELA YA QUE POR LA FORMA DE ATENDER A SUS CLIENTES Y PRINCIPALMENTE LA PUNTUALIDAD EN LA ENTREGA DE LAS FRUTAS ES UNA DE LOS MAS PREFERIDOS, SOBRE TODO EN COCHABAMBA Y SANTA CRUZ. NO EXISTE UN PRECIO FIJO EN LAS COMPRAS DE LA VARIEDAD DE FRUTAS, LOS MISMOS VARIAN DE ACUERDO AL TIEMPO CLIMATOLOGICO DEL AÑO. EL CLIENTE NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS NI EL BURU DE INFOCRED.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Ylse De

texts.es:
Maria is 45 years old and dedicates herself to selling groceries and beer. She also rents her car to other people. She lives with her spouse and children. Many years ago she began her businesses and she also receives rent for the maintenance of her children. Businesses with characteristics similar to hers do not exist in the zone, therefore the competition is low. Her prices fluctuate in accordance with the variety of the products and their popularity. Maria has debts pending with the financial companies Banco Sol and Mutual La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CON 45 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES, CERVEZA Y PARALELAMENTE RENTA SU AUTO. ACTUALMENTE VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE Y SUS HIJOS. DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS ATRAS SE DEDICA A ESTO NEGOCIOS Y TAMBIÉN RECIBE RENTA PARA LA MANUTENCIÓN DE SUS HIJOS. NO EXISTEN MUCHAS VENTAS DE ESTAS CARACTERÍSTICAS POR LA ZONA, POR LO QUE LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA. LOS PRECIOS DE LA VENTA VARIAN DE ACUERDO A LA VARIEDAD DE LOS MISMOS Y AL PRECIO DE VENTA DE LOS QUE COMPRAN AL POR MAYOR. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGOS E INFOCRED TIENE DEUDAS EN ESTADO VIGENTE CON LAS FINANCIERAS BANCO SOL Y MUTUAL LA PAZ.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jero Tirta

texts.id:
Jero Tirta married Putu Suardana who works as a tenant farmer. Jero Tirta has 2 children who are still in Grade school. Income from farm is not enough to pay for daily expenses, and also children schooling expenses. Jero Tirta decides to borrow Rp2,000,000 (about US$220). Jero Tirta used this capital to buy a mother pig for Rp800,000 (about US$90). But that pig is not in a stall, since that stall is being built, paid from the rest of the loan. Although this is new business, Jero Tirta is strongly convinced that it will move and expand so that she could help her husband to pay their living expenses, and pay for childrens education to higher levels, so that it could change their lives for the better.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Jero Tirta menikah dengan Putu Suardana yang bekerja bebagai seorang petani. Jero Tirta memiliki 2 anak yang masih duduk dibangku Sekolah Dasar. Dari hasil ladangnya tidak mencukupi untuk biaya hidup sehari –hari dan juga biaya sekolah anak –anaknya . Jero Tirta memutuskan untuk meminjam modal sebesar Rp 2.000.000,-. Jero Tirta mempergunakan modal ini untuk membeli induk babi sebanyak dengan harga Rp.800.000,-. Tetapi babi ini belum dikandangkan karena sedang dalam proses pembuatan kandang .Yang dananya diambil dari sisa modal yang dipinjam tersebut. Walaupun usaha ini baru dirintisnya, tetapi Jero Tirta tetap memiliki suatu keyakinan yang kuat bahwa usaha ini akan terus berjalan dan berkembang agar bisa membantu suaminya untuk biaya hidup mereka. Dan bisa menyekolahkan anaknya sampai tingkat tinggi yang nantinya akan merubah kehidupan mereka menjadi lebih baik dari sebelumnya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and build a stall

Membeli induk babi dan pembuatan kandang

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Hang S., 27, is a mother of two little kids and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She works selling fruits at an open-air market, earning on average about $2 per day of profit, while her husband earns only meagre money from working as a solider. Mrs. Hang S. has recently requested a loan of $700 to build the rest of her house which is not completely done. She and her family are honestly appreciative of your trust and support.

loans.use: To build the rest of her house which is not completely done

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Mrs. Ngov M., 33, is married with one child and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a business at a busy market selling a variety of vegetables and provisions, making on average $7.50 per day of profit. With a steadily increasing number of clients, Mrs. Ngov M. has requested a loan of $1000 to expand her inventory to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more stuffs to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Ni Putu Puri

texts.id:
Most women in the village own Pig farming business. So is Ni Putu Puri who chose to raise pigs as main family income, besides husband's income as construction worker. Ni Putu Puri bought 2 fattening piglets with a loan from Dinari for Rp2,000,000 (about US$220). Ni Putu Puri bought 2 fattening piglets for Rp500,000 (about US$55); the rest for feed capital. Every day Ni Putu Puri started work at 8:00 AM. First Ni Putu Puri cleans the stall then feeding. Ni Putu Puri fed 2X/day. Sometimes Ni Putu Puri add greeneries as additional feed. Until harvest, Ni Putu Puri spent Rp1,500,000 (about US$165) for feed for 6 months. Bruto income received about Rp2,600,000 (about US$290). So nett profit received by Ni Putu Puri is Rp600,000 (about US$66). With that profit she could help to pay for household expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu-ibu yang hidup di pedesaan sebagaian besar memiliki usaha beternak babi. Begitu juga dengan Ni Putu Puri yang memilih usaha beternak babi sebagai mata pencaharian keluarga yang utama disamping pendapatan yang diperoleh suaminya sebagai seorang buruh bangunan. Ni Putu Puri memiliki 2 ekor penggemukan yang dibelinya dari uang yang dipinjam dari Dinari sebesar Rp.2.000.000,-. Ni Putu Puri membeli 2 bibit babi dengan harga Rp.500,000,-. Sisanya untuk modal pakan. Setiap hari Ni Putu Puri memulai pekerjaannya mulai jam 8.00 pagi. Pertama-tama yang dilakukan oleh Ni Putu Puri membersihkan kandang setelah itu baru memberi makan Putu Puri memberi makan 2 kali perhari. Untuk selingannya Ni Putu Puri memberi hijauan sebagai makanan tambahan. Sampai panen Putu Puri menghabiskan modal pakan Rp.1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Penghasilan kotor yang diterima Rp.2.600.000,-. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang diterima Ni Putu Puri Rp. 600.000,-Dengan keuntungan ini bisa dipergunakan untuk membantu semua pengeluaran rumah tangganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Suos

texts.en: Mrs. Suos S. O., 30, is married with one little kid and lives with her husband and her younger sister in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. In order to supplement their household income she and her husband work raising small rubber trees and selling them after one to two months. They can typically earn about $4 each day. This couple would like to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike to assist in their family and business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to assist in their family and business transportation.

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him N. , ages 49, is a mother of six children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband are brokers, buying and reselling yams to wholesalers and earning together on average around $7 each day.  One of her children is a construction worker; another one is a mechanic and the rest are enrolled in school. Mrs. Him N. hopes to use this loan to invest in her business which is slightly increasing day by day.

loans.use: To invest in her business by purchasing more yams.

loans.name: Jero Ketut Taman

texts.id:
Living in a village where the majority raise pigs, so is Jero Taman who has a fattening piglet business. Loan from Dinari for Rp3000,000 (about US$330) used to buy 4 fattening piglets at a price of Rp1,000,000 (about US$110). The rest was to buy feed. Every day Jero Taman started her work at 8:00AM. First she cleans the stall, then feeding. Sometimes she gave alternative feed like leafs as additional feed. Until harvest she spent Rp1,500,000 (about $165) for feed for 6 months. Income was Rp4,600,000 (about US$500), so nett profit is Rp1,200,000 (about US$132). With this profit she used to support & pay for household expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup di pedesaan sebagian besar memelihara ternak babi. Begitu juga dengan Jero Taman memiliki usaha beternak babi penggemukan. Pinjam dari Dinari sebesar Rp.3.000.000,-. Dipergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi dengan harga Rp.1.000,000,-. Sisanya untuk modal pakan. Setiap hari Jero Taman memulai pekerjaannya mulai jam 8.00 pagi. Pertama-tama yang dilakukan membersihkan kandang setelah itu baru memberi makan.. Untuk selingannya diberi pakan alternative seperti dedaunan sebagai makanan tambahan. Sampai panen menghabiskan modal pakan Rp.1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Penghasilan kotor yang diterima Rp.4.600.000,-. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang diterima Rp1.200.000,-.Dengan keuntungan ini bisa dipergunakan untuk membantu semua pengeluaran rumah tangganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Ni Ketut Karni

texts.id:
With a loan from Dinari for Rp1,900,000 (about US$210), Ni Ketut Karni started her business. Ni Ketut Karni bought 2 mother pigs with a price of Rp600,000 (about US$66)/piece, so for 2 mother pigs it was Rp1,200,000 (about US$132). The rest Rp700,000 (about US$77) was used to buy feed. Every day Ni Ketut Karni is busy with her animals besides being a mother raising 1 school aged child. According to Ni Ketut Karni raising mother pigs would bring faster results, because the 2 mother pigs will bore piglets and feed expenses would not be too high compared to fattening piglets. Usually every 5 months mother pigs could bore around 5-6 piglets per mother pig. From potential sales from 2 mother pigs could reach Rp2,500,000 (about US$275). Feed expenses only Rp500,000 (about US$55). So nett Ni Ketut Karni could profit Rp 2,000,000 (about US$220). With this profit Ni Ketut Karni likes to buy 1 more mother pig, to increase income and to enhance family life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan pinjaman modal yang di dapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.900.000,- Ni Ketut Karni memulai usahanya. Ni Ketut Karni membeli 2 induk babi dengan harga perekor Rp.600.000,- jadi 2 induk babi harganya Rp 1.200.000,-. Sisanya Rp.700,000,- dipergunakan untuk modal pakannya. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Karni sibuk mengurus usaha ternaknya disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang mengurusi 1 orang anaknya yang masih sekolah. Menurut Ni Ketut Karni memelihara induk babi lebih cepat menghasilkan, karena nantinya dari 2 ekor induk babi ini akan beranak dan untuk biaya pakannya pun tidak terlalu mahal dibandingkan dengan memelihara babi pengemukan. Setiap 5 bulan induk babi ini akan melahirkan anak yang rata –rata bisa beranak antara 5 sampai 6 ekor per induk dari hasil penjualan anaknya dari 2 induk babi pendapatan kotornya bisa mencapai Rp 2.500.000,-. Pengeluaran pakan hanya Rp.500.000,-. Jadi bersihnya Ni Ketut Karni bisa memperoleh keuntungan Rp 2.000.000,-. Dengan keuntungan ini Ni Ketut Karni ingin membeli induk lagi 1 ekor agar bisa menambah hasil dan memperbaiki kehidupan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and feed

Membeli induk babi dan pakan

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin H. is 68 years old.  She is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She buys yams from growers and then resells them, earning about $3 profit each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works driving a motor-taxi and makes on average around $3 each day.  One of her children is a broker and the rest are laborers. Mrs. Chin Hok is humbly requesting a loan to purchase more yams in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to improve her business.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin is a 53-year-old, married man. He is a farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort.

Aydin purchases calves, breeds them with the assistance of his daughter (she is pictured here), slaughters them, and sells the meat to a butcher who works at the big local market.

Unfortunately, the income is not enough to cover all of Aydin’s family expenses. To increase the profit from his cattle-raising business, Aydin needs to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. This summer he applied to Normicro for US$ 500 to buy four calves. In a half a year their value could be twice as much. If Aydin receives the requested loan from KIVA lenders, he hopes to expand his business and better care for his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Elmardan

texts.ru:
Elmardan lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 49 years old, is married and has 4 children. Elmardan is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling livestock at the local market. Every year he purchases young calves from local villagers and raises them over an 8-9 month period and later sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today Elmadran is thinking about expanding his business, as his current earnings are not enough to provide for his 4 children. He plans to increase his annual purchase of calves by 5. For this he needs to invest and borrow $500.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mp. Алимардан живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 49 лет, он женат, имеет 4-х детей. Алимардан является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Алимардан думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его четверых детей. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 5 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Алимардан обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 40 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Novruz owns and operates a small food market in Saatli town; he has had his business for 15 years. The business is stable because Novruz has been collecting his customers during the time he has been running this shop. Unfortunately, he has no capital to invest to diversify his inventory and increase his turnover, so he does not make enough income to provide all the necessities of life for his family.

Commercial banks demand collateral to give credit, but Novruz has nothing to mortgage. That's why he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, which gives loans free of collateral. He is requesting a loan of US$ 500. This loan would allow him to sell bigger amounts of more diverse goods and to develop his business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory and improve his turnover

loans.name: Makharram

texts.ru:
Mr Makharram lives in the city of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is 57, married and has 4 children. Makharram purchases calves, raises them with the help of his wife (see photo) and then sells them when they are grown up on the local market. This business allows him to provide his family with the bare minimum needed to survive in a small village setting. The children, however, are growing and so are their needs. Makharram is thinking about increasing the profit from his business by investing additional funds into it. He has come to the local microcredit organization - Normico, a partner of Kiva, asking to borrow $500 in order to increase the size of his business. With this money Makharram will be able to purchase 5 more calves than he usually purchases on an annual basis.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мр. Махаррам живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенной в Закавказье. Ему 57 лет, он женат, имеет 4-х детей. Махаррам занимается закупкой телят, их варащиванием с помощью супруги (см. фото) и в дальнейшем продажей уже зрелого крупного рогатого скота на местном рынке. Таким образом он обеспeчивает свою немалую семью тем необходимым минимумом, на который можно жить в условиях небогатой деревни. Но дети растут так же быстро, как растут и их потребности. Сегодня Махаррам подумывает о увеличении прибыли с его бизнеса путём вкладывания инвестиций. Он обратился в местный филиал микрокредитной организации "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - с просьбой предоставления ему кредита с суммой в 500 долларов для расширения бизнеса. На местном рынке цена одного телёнка 100 долларов. Так что Махаррам сможет на эту сумму кредит купить 5 телят дополнительно к тем, которые он уже закупает ежегодно.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables, chairs and utensils for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes and accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sodas, juices and food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food and drink inventory.

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.ru:
Mr Aflatun lives in the viscinity of the city of Saatli in Azerbaitsjan. He is married and has three children. His family is a low income family. His only source of income is a small herd of sheep and calves. Each year in August his wife (see photo) and him purchase lambs and calves with the money that they have been able to save over the year. They raise them on their property and then sell them to butchers on the local market. They use the money they obtain to provide for the family. However, the children are growing and so are their needs. Aflatun is planing to increase his income by increasing the amount of cattle he has in his herd. In order to do this he came to Normico, a Kiva partner, hoping to borrow $500.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мр.Афлатун живет в пригороде Саатлы Республики Азербайджан расположенном в Южном Кавказе. Он женат, имеет троих детей. Семья у него малообеспсченная. Единственный источник дохода это небельшое стадо овец и телят в приусадебном хозяйстве. Ежегодно в августе он и его жена (см. фото) покупают на накопленные деньги ягнят и телят, выращивают их и продают на местном базаре мясникам. На вырученные деньги они обеспечивают семью минимумон потребностей. Но дети растут так же как и их потребности и Афлатун подумывает о увеличении своего дохода путём увеличения численности поголовья скота в своём стаде. С этой целью он обратился к местому отделению Нормикро - партнёру КИВА - с просьбой о предоставлении ему кредита в 500 долларов.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Business Description

Clarisa’s business involves the sale of a variety of household goods such as sheet sets, pots and pans, silverware, quilts, blenders, etc. She travels throughout the Isla sector offering her products, where she is known for augmenting her earnings through her business to sustain her home. She works every day of the week.

Loan Use

Clarisa asks for a loan to purchase additional merchandise, specifically those which bring a good profit and are in high demand. She also wants to increase her inventory to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Personal Information

Clarisa is 25 years old and has a 6-year old child. Her husband works at a garage. He tells us he would like to have your support with his wife’s request for a loan, as the additional income she can generate greatly helps the family. Clarisa’s desire is to grown her business to generate enough income so that they could save money to buy their own lot and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Clarisa tiene negocio de venta de artículos para el Hogar: Juegos de Sabanas, Juegos de Ollas, Juegos de Cucharas, Edredones, Licuadora y otros enseres para el Hogar. Clarisa recorre sector de Isla ofreciendo sus productos, ella es conocida al igual que su familia que tiene esta línea de trabajo como fuente generadora de sustento para su hogar. Clarisa labora todos los días de semana.

Uso del Préstamo

Clarisa solicita el crédito para comprar más artículos, específicamente aquellos que tienen una inversión mayor y los realiza sobre pedidos. Clarisa también necesita incrementar sus mercaderías y ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de Productos. Además viene época de Navidad y las ventas son buenas.

Información Personal

Clarisa tiene 25 años de edad y 1 hijo de 6 años. Esposo trabaja como empleado en un Taller de Ventas. El nos dice que le gustaría que le apoyen a la esposa con el crédito, porque de esa manera se generan otros ingresos que benefician a la familia. El anhelo que tiene Clarisa es crecer más su negocio y generar mayores utilidades que les permitan ahorrar y poder comprar un terreno y luego construir.

loans.use: Purchase household goods to improve her sales/variety of inventory.

loans.name: Pelaho

texts.en:
As a divorcee, it is difficult for M. to take care of herself and her two children, who are in school. Paying their school fees has been a major problem since her sales of pastries is giving her very little profit.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in the same business and use the profit to pay the school fees for her children and buy food for them.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Tp purchase flour, oil, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seasonal products for the holidays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a freezer for store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw goods.

loans.name: Ngwa Christina

texts.en:
Christina is an orphan and the mother of five children. The death of her twin babies is something she will never be able to forget.

As a hardworking woman, she has a small bench in front of her house where she sells food and other basic items. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in the business she already runs.

The profit will enable her to pay school fees for her children and buy food for the family. She believes the business will succeed as her small store is known in her residential area.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase rice, palm oil, magi, groundnuts and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rebuild two classrooms for school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw materials and new sewing machine for clothing business.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Mas Ardani

texts.id:
Ardani has been in the profession of Food and vegetable sales since 2 years. Starting as a hobby in cooking and a having lots of free time. Wife of Putu Widana, up to now still childless started to fill in her free time by making food assortments, like: vegetables, cake and fish. Afterwards Ardani brought her cooking to a foodstalls, or to a travelling sales person in her village. Since Ardani's income looks promising, this is currently the family's main income. Profit of Rp25,000 (about US$3)/daily is felt by Ardani not enough for the family, so Ardani works harder. To expand the business, Ardani borrows the capital from Dinari, that she used to buy a motircycle to support her business, since with a motorcyle, Ardani who earlier brought her production to foodstalls or other salesperson as middlemen, could sell directly to the consumers, by travelling sales in her village, and also other villages. This activity is done 2X/day, morning from 5:00-8:00 AM, and afternoons from 2:00-6:00PM. Income / profit received by Ardani also increases to Rp60,000-80,000 (about US$7-()/daily.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Berprofesi sebagai pedagang sayur dan makanan sudah dilakukan Ardani sejak 2 tahun yang lalu. Berawal dari hoby memasak dan banyaknya waktu luang yang di miliki. Istri dari Putu Widana, yang sampai saat ini belum di karuniai anak ini memulai mengisi waktu luangnya dengan membuat berbagai jenis masakan seperti: sayur, kue dan ikan . Kemudian oleh Ardani semua masakannya itu di serahkan ke warung –warung ataupun di titip pada pedagang sayur keliling yang ada di desanya. Melihat hasil yang di dapat oleh Ardani sangat menjanjikan , usaha ini dijadikan sebagai sumber pendapatan utama keluarganya saat ini.
