Keuntungan Rp 25.000, / hari yang di dapat oleh Ardani dirasakan kurang mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya , hingga Ardani harus bekerja lebih keras lagi . Untuk mengembangkan usahanya Ardani meminjam modal dari Dinari , yang di pergunakan untuk membeli sebuah sepeda motor untuk menunjang kelancaran dari usahanya, karena dengan sepeda motor ini Ardani yang dulunya hanya menyerahkan hasil produksinya pada warung atau pedagang lain , kini Ardani bisa menjual langsung kepada konsumen (pelanggan )dengan berkeliling di desanya bahkan sampai keluar di desa-desa lain. Kegiatan ini dilakukan Ardani sampai dua kali sehari, yaitu pagi dari jam 5 sampai jam 8, dan sorenya mulai pukul 2 sampai 6 . Hasil / keuntungan yang di dapat Ardani pun meningkat yaitu berkisar Rp 60.000,- sampai Rp. 80.000 / hari .

loans.use:
To buy a motorcycle to support business activities

Membeli sepeda motor untuk menunjang kelancaran usahanya

loans.name: Nforteh Margaret

texts.en:
Born in 1972, Margaret is married and is the mother of four children. Her husband lost his job some years back and it has been so difficult for the children to go to school.

Also, her sales of foodstuffs have not been able to give her enough profit to cater to their needs because of her small investment capital.

With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in her business and also cultivate cocoyam (taro root). She plans to buy from neighboring villages and sell at a higher price in the urban market. The profit will be used to pay school fees for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12-15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, bananas and cocoyam

loans.name: Ndung Irene

texts.en:
Irene has suffered from an illness locally called "god fire," which manifests as burns on the skin. This illness, which is usually difficult to heal, drained her of almost all her finances. In addition, her husband abandoned her with four children.

Motivated by these problems, Irene became a GHAPE member. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to sell food which she cooks. It is her first loan, and she believes she will be able to repay it since she plans to sell the food near a school campus. The profit will help her provide basic needs for her children and buy medications for herself.

She plans to repay the loan in 12-15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase beans, potatoes, palm oil and corn

loans.name: Claudina Celeste Mas

texts.pt:
Claudina Celeste Massunga P. is a 41-year-old single mother of three and lives in the Hulene neighborhood of Maputo. She runs a stand at the Mavalane market, where she sells a variety of beverages such as soft drinks, juices, fresh milk, etc. She is new to the program and is taking on an initial loan of 6,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months. She will invest the funds in the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudina Celeste Massunga P. é mãe solteira de três filhos, tem 41 anos de idade e vive no bairro de Hulene em Maputo. Tem uma barraca no mercado de Mavalane onde vende bebidas diversas, refrigerantes, sumos, leite fresco, etc. É nova no programa e vai tomar um empréstimo de 6.000MT para pagar em 5 meses, o qual pretende aplicar no negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Tume Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a widower who lives with relatives who take care of his son and help out in his carpenter’s workshop. His carpentry business is doing well and he has many happy clients. Lawrence believes that this is a good time to expand his business, and has come to us for a loan to make that expansion possible. He will use part of the loan to buy wood and other items he needs to make more furniture, and the balance to buy baby chickens that he will raise and sell in the local market.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens, planks, nails and varnish

loans.name: Ni Made Sri Wahyuni

texts.id:
Besides being a housewife whose daily work are to care for children and other household work, Ni Made Sri Wahyuni also has a business that supports their family income. That business is cacao sales. She has been in this business for almost 2 years, and has given satisfactory income of Rp25,000 (about US$3)/day from the Rp500,000 (about US$60) capital she owned. Buying harvest from cocoa farmers, Made Sri started her activities daily from 10:00 AM to 4:00PM buying cocoa fruits from farmers and selling it to wholesalers, and the profit came from difference between buying & selling price. Lack of capital, has been a problem in the past, and she could not compete with other salespersons. However, after receiving capital help from Dinari, her business grows, and more farmers too sold their harvest to Made Sri. Today Made Sri could buy 200kg with a profit of Rp100,000 (about $11)/day. With that Made Sri could support her 2 children, Luh Sinta who already goes to Grade school, and Made Sonia, who is still a toddler.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Di samping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang dalam keseharianya mengurus anak dan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya , Ni Made Sri Wahyuni juga memiliki usaha yang sangat mendukung pendapatan keluarganya . Usaha itu adalah Usaha sebagai Pedagang Kakau . Usaha yang telah di jalankannya hampir dua tahun ini mempunyai hasil yang sangat lumayan yaitu sebesar Rp 25.000/hari dari Rp 500.000 modal yang dimiliki . Dengan membeli hasil panen dari petani yang memiliki tanaman kakau , Made Sri memulai kegiatannya setiap hari dari pukul 10.00 pagi sampai 04.00 sore membeli buah kakau dari petani dan menjual kembali kepada pengepul ( pedagang besar ) dengan keuntungan yang di peroleh dari selisih harga beli dan penjualan . Kekurangan modal , dulu sering menjadi hambatan Made Sri dalam menjalankan usaha ini sehingga kalah bersaing dengan pedagang lain . Namun setelah mendapat bantuan modal dari Dinari , usahanya semakin berkembang dan petani pun makin banyak menjual hasil panennya kepada Made Sri. Rata-rata saat ini Made Sri bisa membeli barang dagangan 200 Kg dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp 100,000,- / hari . Dengan hasil ini Made Sri dapat membiayai dua orang anakNya yaitu Luh Sinta yang telah duduk di bangku SD dan Made Sonia yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To add capital so that could buy more cocoa beans

Sebagai tambahan modal usaha agar dapat membeli biji kakao dalam jumlah yang lebih banyak

loans.name: Ngwafu Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is married and the father of five children, all of whom are currently in school. Because he recently lost his job, Lucas fears that he may have to pull his children out of school. To prevent that from happening, he has applied for a loan that he will use to buy food items -- such as groundnuts, corn, salt and beans -- that are in heavy demand in his area. He will resell the items to the people of his village, and use the profits to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of food items

loans.name: Mwahija

texts.en:
Mwahija is 40 years old and works in multiple small trades in order to support her household. Left by her husband 4 years ago, she single-handedly takes care of 10 children – 4 of her own, 2 stepchildren from her husband, and 4 orphans. Her main business is a cement store called “Mwahija Y. Kabira,” which opened 8 years ago. In one month, Mwahija is able to earn a profit of around US$350 from selling 200 sacks of cement at her store. On the side, she sells corn flour, charcoal, chicken feed, and rents out 6 rooms from her house.

Mwahija’s last loan, which she paid back successfully, was spent on school fees and buying cement. She now hopes to take out a new loan of US$900 to buy another load of cement.

Mwahija belongs to a group called Subira (Swahili for “patience”) - the group has 22 members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cement

payments.comment: Mwahija was able to pay the remaining amount before the end of the loan term!

loans.name: Júlia Francisco

texts.pt:
Júlia Francisco D. is a 46-year-old single mother of 4. She lives in the Infulene “A” neighborhood of the city of Matola. She is new to the program. She is a teacher and runs a business selling linens (used clothing) from her home, instead of traveling. She plans to take a loan of 5,000 MT, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to strengthen her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Júlia Francisco D. tem 46 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro de Infulene "A" no Município da Matola.É nova no programa. É professora e tem um negócio de venda de lençois(roupa usada) em sua casa , para além de praticar o mesmo negócio de forma ambulante.Pretende tomar um empréstimo de 5.000MT a pagar em 6 meses para reforçar o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Nebasfeh George

texts.en: George comes from a family where children were not able to attend secondary school because their parents could not afford the fees. Today, he is married with one child and responsible for providing both for his parents and his younger brothers and sisters. George has been trained as a carpenter, and has applied for a loan to buy the wood he needs to make furniture. He will also use a portion of the loan to buy baby chickens that he can raise and sell in the local market. He will use the profits from his business to pay for his sibling's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of baby chickens and wood for carpentry shop

loans.name: Lum

texts.en: Lum R. is a 67-year-old widow who is her family's main breadwinner. She needs to increase her income because she is responsible for the care of both her children and her grandchildren. Lum has applied for a loan that will allow her to grow yams, corn, beans and cocoyams on her family's plot. She will use the income made possible by this loan to buy medicines she needs, and pay school fees for her children and her grand children.

loans.use: Buy seeds to grow yams, corn, beans, cocoyams; pay for transport to market

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina, age 46, lives in a 2-room house with her 4 daughters and 1 grand-daughter. Her husband left them several years ago, and her son is now in the army. Two years ago, Selina opened a business, “Masagese Grocery,” to support her family. At her store, Selina sells alcoholic beverages, sodas, cookies, and water. Each day, she sells about 50 bottles of beer at around 95 cents each and 50 bottles of soda at about 25 cents each. In a week, she earns a profit of around US$200, which she uses on school fees and to pay for inventory delivery.

Earlier this year, Selina took out a loan to increase the store's inventory and paid it back successfully. She now hopes to take out a bigger loan of US$275 for the same purpose. She belongs to the group Subira (Swahili for “patience”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Increase of inventory

payments.comment: Selina was able to pay the remaining of her loan back before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Ni Komang Swastini

texts.id:
Her husband’s income as a construction worker is often insufficient to cover the family’s expenses, thus Ni Komang Suastini contribute by working to generate additional income. Ni Komang Suastini’s effort of choice is to trade in produce, purchasing several varieties of farmers harvests like banana, mango, coconut, jackfruit, etc., depending on the season. Then transported to the state market to be sold. Daily, Ni Komang Suastini, generate income ranging from Rp. 30.000 to Rp. 35.000 (USD3 to USD4), - from a funding outlay of Rp. 500.000 (about USD50), - . The activities performed by Ni Komang Suastini commences from 10 in the morning using motorcycle used to seek produce to trade, after having collected sufficient produce, around 1600 hr., the produce were immediately taken to the state market to be sold to traders who have become her permanent customers. Such activity being carried out almost daily. Receiving this funding loan from Dinari enable Ni Komang Suastini to increase purchases and also maintain the motorcycle to carry out this effort smoothly.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Penghasilan suami yang pas-pasan sebagai tukang bangunan bahkan sering tidak cukup untuk biaya hidup keluarga, membuat Ni Komang Suastini turut bekerja keras untuk mendapatkan tambahan penghasilan . Usaha yang menjadi pilihan Ni Komang Suastini adalah sebagai pedagang hasil bumi, yaitu membeli berbagai jenis hasil panen petani seperti Pisang , mangga, kelapa, nangka ,kakau ,dan yang lainya tergantung musim. Kemudian di bawa ke pasar Negara untuk di jual kembali. Dalam sehari Ni Komang Suastini mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 30,000,- s/d 35.000,- dari modal yang hanya Rp 500.000,- . Aktifitas yang dilakukan Ni Komang Suastini mulai dari pukul 10.00 pagi berkeliling dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya untuk mencari barang dagangan , setelah barang terkumpul dirasa cukup , kira-kira pukul 16.00 barang itu langsung di bawanya ke pasar Negara untuk di jual pada pedagang yang sudah menjadi pelanggan tetapnya . Demikian kegiatan ini dilakukan hampir setiap hari. Mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari oleh Ni Komang Suastini di gunakan untuk menambah modal dan juga untuk memperbaiki sepeda motor yang ada sehinga usahanya berjalan lebih lancar.

loans.use: Increase funding for purchasing more produce and maintain motorcycle (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli dagangan lebih banyak lagi dan memperbaiki sepeda motor sebagai sarana untuk berjualan)

loans.name: Rose Neh

texts.en: Rose is 72 years old, but still hearty enough to work and use her income to buy the medications she needs as well as food for her children and grandchildren. She very much regrets never having had the chance to go to school, and is determined that every one of her grandchildren will get an education. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan that she will use to plant crops on the small plot of land she owns. She will use her profits to pay her grandchildren's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
I. Akbar is a young and pleasant businessman. He has run his own food shop in Khujand for over 8 years. During these years, he has become a skillful salesman and is always ready to meet all clients' needs. He is very polite with clients and carefully takes their orders. He has a wide assortment of goods and his food products are of high quality. Today his shop is one of the better-known shops in the area. He is one of Microinvest's more active clients and repays his loans on time.

Akbar is married and has one child. His wife is a housewife and is fond of raising their young child. Akbar tries to meet all of his family's needs and to create comfortable living conditions for them. He hopes to open a trading stall or space in the center market in Khujand. For this purpose, he is seeking a loan with which to expand his business and save money for the new trading stall.

loans.use: To open a trading stall/ space in the centre of Khujand.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, age 30, opened her business two years ago and named it “Mama Dan Restaurant” after her son. Living with her two boys (12 and 5 years old) and her husband, Zuhura spends her days cooking and overseeing her four employees at the restaurant. Open from 6am until 10pm, her restaurant brings in 30-40 customers a day, allowing her to earn a profit of around US$13. Similar to most restaurants in the area, a plate of food in "Mama Dan Restaurant" costs around 90 cents.

Earlier this year, Zuhura received a loan which she used to purchase food items for her restaurant. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes to take out another loan of US$275 to buy more dishes and chairs.

Zuhura belongs to the group Subira (Swahili for “patience”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other in paying back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of dishes and chairs for a restaurant

payments.comment: Zuhura has completely  paid back her loan before the end of the loan term

loans.name: Atália António

texts.pt:
Atália António M. is a 34-year-old married mother of 2. She lives in the Mahotas neighborhood and runs a used clothing business on the Praça dos Combatentes plaza in Maputo. She is new to the program and is taking on an initial loan of 3,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Atália António M. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de dois filhos. Vive no bairro Mahotas e tem um negócio de venda de roupa usada na Praça dos Combatentes em Maputo. É nova no programa e vai tomar um empréstimo inicial de 3000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Neba Evelyn

texts.en: Neba Evelyne is 35 years old and the mother of two children. She has been abused by her husband and his family because she is unable to have additional children. Because she and her children receive virtually no support from her husband, she has gone into business for herself frying and selling potato chips. She has applied for a loan that will allow her to continue her current line of work, as well as sell bananas and raise chickens. She will use her income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy bananas, potatoes and baby chickens

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
J. Solijon is an experienced businessman. He has been engaged in the trade of electronic goods for over 8 years. His business is located in Ovchikalacha, in the district of Khujand. His wife is dead and he lives with his 4 children.

Solijon sells different kinds of goods. Every day, his sons help display and arrange his goods in his stall. He buys his goods from local workshops and sells them at his trading stall in the market. He spends the profit from his business on his family's daily needs and expenses. In the near future he wants to rent an additional trading stall for his son. He plans to use this loan to expand his assortment of goods.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Negman

texts.en:
M. Nemat is a specialist in repairing refrigeraters. He is married and has two children. His current job is to sell refrigeraters and other kitchen equipments. He has his own workshop at home and takes his goods for sale on two market’s days each week.

Nemat has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and has many regular clients. He plans to use his future loan from KIVA on buying new instruments with which to repair kitchen equipment.

loans.use: Purchasing instruments for his kitchen equipment repair business.

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.en: S. Mirzoali is an experienced butcher, as he has been in this business 7 years. He is married and has 5 children. According to him, this is a family business as his father and grandfather were butchers too.In fact, he now has his two elder sons apprenticing him in the store. The turnover of his business is fast and he is not hoping to buy two bulls for his business. He plans to use his loan to increase the amount of meat he has available because the people of Tadjikistan usually buy save reserves of broiled meat for the winter season.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Flora Antonio

texts.pt:
Flora lives in Neighborhood 4 in Macia, Bilene district. She entered the program this year. She is a widowed mother of 4. All of Flora's children attend school. She entered the loan program in order to expand her business and thereby cover the household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Flora vive no Bairro 4 da Macia ,distrito do Bilene.Entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Ela e viuva e mae de 4 filhos. Todos os 4 filhos de Flora estao a estudar. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito para poder ampliar o seu negocio de modo a poder custear todas as despesa da casa.

loans.use: Flora would like to use the money to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
B. Karim is married and has 3 children. He has over 5 years of experience in his business. He started his business activities in 1990, beginning in the trade of perfumes. His wife and children help him when he goes to to Istaravshan to purchase goods After more than 5 years of working in the market, he has accumulated enough experience to conduct his business successfully and has constant clients.

Step by step, he developed his business and rented a premises for his food shop. Today his elder son sells perfumes and other household goods at his father’s old trade place and Karim sells food products at his little food shop. He plans to use his future loan to purchase food products for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase food products.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en: Ochilov Shuhrat runs his own business selling DVDs. He is not married and lives with his parents. He has been engaged in this business for over 6 years. During this time, he has been able to attract many clients with his professional service. All clients are satistifed with their interactions with him, as he always is polite and ready to meet all their needs. They said that he completes his orders and meets his commitments more quickly than others in the same business. Thus, his business gets larger every month. He plans to spend his next loan on increasing the volume of his disks on sale. He does not want to lose his clients and for this purpose, wants to increase the assortment of disks he has to sell.

loans.use: To expand his volume of DVDs for sale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She has two sisters, and they have been living with her since her mother died. She has a small sewing shop in her house, and she applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and new fabric. She also wants to paint the shop and renovate it; make some advertising for the shop; and hire one unemployed person to help her in work. She wants to increase her income and save for a better life for her big family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rosa Paulo

texts.pt:
Rosa is single but lives with a man with whom she has 5 children. She sells wooden posts used to build “wattle and daub” houses and also sells firewood. She would like to use the money to buy more firewood for resale. She entered the program this year. This is the first loan she will take. She runs the business out of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. Ela vende estacas que servem para construir casas de pau a pique e vende tambem lenha. Ela quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de lenha para a venda. Ela entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Este e o promeiro emprestimo que ela quer tomar. Ela desenvolve o seu negocio na sua residencia.

loans.use: Rosa would like to use the money to buy more wooden posts and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: S. Shahnosa is young businesswoman who is married and has one child. She runs her own food shop in the center of a large market in Ovchikalacha, in the district of Khujand. Her husband is her business partner and he is responsible for supplying food products to her shop every day. He buys products from local confectioneries and meat workshops, and gets other products such as candies and drinks from Panjshanbe market in Khujand. S.'s shop is located in a busy neighbourhood and she sees a lot of customers each day. She is requesting a loan so that she can afford to buy more products for her store.

loans.use: To expand the range of food products sold in her store

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
K. Sharif is an active client of Microinvest. He is 46 years old and has 3 children. His business is to repair travelling gears of cars. Before the collapse of the USSR he worked as an engineer in a factory. Today he rents a premises for his business. He has many clients and the turnover of his business is good.

However, he faces the problem of his repair equipment eroding and is therefore requesting a KIVA loan to purchase more equipment.

loans.use: Purchasing car repair equipment

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.pt:
Maimuna is a single mother and lives in Mangundze with her only son, who is 14. She is the owner of a shop where she sells various essential products, clothing as well as bread, as she also has an oven. As the month of December approaches, which is the peak season for buying cashew nuts from farmers, she plans to use the current loan to purchase wrap skirts in bulk for trading in the context of the cashew nut campaign. Her son attends school. She entered the program just this year. This is the second loan she will take.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Maimuna e mae solteira e vive em Mangundze com o seu unico filho de 14 anos. Ela e proprietaria de uma loja onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade, roupa e pao uma vez que tambem tem um forno onde fabrica pao, e vende tambem roupa. Uma vez que se aproxima o mes de Dezembro altura previlegiada para a compra da castanha de caju aos camponeses, ela pretende usar o actual emprestimo para a compra de capulanas em grande quantidade para a troca no contexto da campanha da castanha de caju. O seu filho esta a estudar.Ela entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Este emprestimo e o segundo que ela esta a tomar.

loans.use: Maimuna runs a shop where she sells various products. She would like to use the money to buy wrap skits for trade in the cashew nut campaign.

loans.name: Aintonio

texts.pt:
António S. was born in Niassa, Mozambique in 1960 and moved to Maputo when he was 18, to live with his older sister. His sister brought him up and saw him through school until 1979, when he decided to join the National Liberation Army. He was trained in basic military business (was sent to Russia to conclude High School), and currently works for the Mozambique Department of Defense. He has 4 children and lives in a rental house in the neighborhood of Machava. A Client of Hluvuku since 2005, and having paid off two previous loans in full, António is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy construction materials to finish up his own house, located in one of the two pieces of land he bought back in 2002 – he hopes to finally stop paying rent soon. All the construction materials for the house are bought in hardware stores in the city, and he has to rent a truck to transport them to the project's location. Hluvuku's loans are helping António improve his family's quality of life. Once their home is finished and the family is moved in, he plans to restart work on another construction project he was forced to abandon a while back due to lack of resources.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Marracuene-Maputo Cliente: António S. Actividade: Habitacão Valor de empréstimo: 60.000,00 Mt ( 2.400USD) Aplicação: compra de material de contruçao Início: 07-11-07 Fim: 30-04-09 António S., nasceu em Cuamba na Provincia de Niassa aos 12 de Junho de 1960, veio a Maputo quando tinha 18 anos onde viveu na companhia da irmã. Foi a irmã que foi responsável do seu sustento bem como dos seus estudos até ao ano de 1979 que por vontade própria incorpora –se nas Forças Armadas de Libertação de Moçambique. Durante este periodo fez o curso básico de Administração militar tem continuado o nivel médio na Russia actual união Soviética, desde então faz parte do quadro do Ministério da defesa de Moçambique. António S. tem 4 filhos e actualmente vive numa casa arrendanda no Bairro da Machava. Sendo cliente da Hluvuku desde o ano de 2005, tem 2 (dois) pedidos concluido com sucesso os quais estavam direccionados a projecto de habitação. Com o crédito de 60.000,00 mts( setenta mil meticais) , pretende concluir dependência de forma a deixar de viver na casa arrendada. De referir que porjecto localiza a cerca de 30 km da cidade de Maputo em direcção Norte ao longo de Avenida de Moçambique. O espaço onde está localizado o projecto adquiriu em 2002, pelo pagamento de 80.000,00 mts( oitenta mil meticais) e os materiais usados para a construção foram adquirido nas principais ferragens cidade de Maputo e foram transportados por viaturas alugadas. No futuro já com a fámilia fixada pretende concluir com a residência principal e de seguida reativar o projecto da salinas que já tinha abondonado,pelo que, conta com mais pedidos de financiamento. O seu projecto tem impacto social positivo pois consiste no melhoramento das condições habitacionais a perioridade para o bem estar e conforto familiar.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish his house so he can stop paying rent

loans.name: Investimento Group

texts.pt:
The Investimento Group has 3 members: Maria Talvina, president of the Group, Maria Gilda and Helena N.. The group was formed in 2006 by Maria Talvina and Maria Gilda, who were the sole members at the time. Helena joined them just this year. All the members sell used clothing at Limpopo, one of the markets in the surrounding areas of the city of Xai-Xai. They all have children and live with their husbands. With the money from the loan, they would each like to buy more bundles of used clothing for resale, as used clothing sells very well at the Limpopo market. Maria Talvina would like to take 6,160 MT, Maria Gilda 5,120 MT and Helena 6,160 MT. Each would like to repay her loan within 4 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

o Grupo Investimento tem 3 membros a saber Maria Talvina que e a Presidente do Grupo, Maria Gilda e Helena N..O grupo foi formado em 2006. Eram na altura apenas 2 membros as sras Maria Talvina e Maria Gilda. A sra Helena juntou-se a elas ainda este ano. Todas elas vendem roupa usada no mercado Limpopo. Um dos mercados nas redondezas da Cidade de Xai-Xai. Todas elas tem filhos e vivem maritalmente com os seus maridos. Com o dinheiro do emprestimo querem cada uma comprar mais fardos de roupa usada para a venda uma vez que roupa usada tem muita saida no mercado Limpopo.Maria Talvina quer tomar 6.160,00 Mt, Maria Gilda quer tomar 5,120,00 Mt e a Helena quer tomar 6.160,00 Mts.Todas elas querem pagar em 4 meses

loans.use: The members of the Investimento group would like to use the loan money to buy more bundles of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Localização:Bairro Chalí, Catembe-Maputo
Cliente: Isabel Chale
Actividade: Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo:60,000.00Mt ( 2.400usd)
Aplicação: Compra de Produtos para revenda
Início:21/08/2007
Fim:11/02/2009

Isabel Chale, nasceu aos 04 de Março de 1969 em Catembe na província de Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade , casada maritalmente tem 5 filhos estudou apenas até 6ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira dos seus progenitores.
Passou uma parte da sua Infância com seus tios na capital ,Maputo durante 7 anos onde, depois da Escola  dedicava se na venda de Badjías( produto feito com feijão que de seguida é frito e come -se com o pão) para ajudar nas despesas de casa . Algum tempo depois volta á catembe junto dos pais onde não continuando com os estudos , passou a dedicar se na venda de Pão.
Aos 19 anos junta se com seu marido e muda de negócio passando a vender Peixe e porque o negócio não estava a correr bem , decide procurar emprego tendo conseguido na Feira Popular de Maputo onde trabalhou durante 6 anos. Momentos depois a Empresa veio a  fechar e como solução imediata para garantir o sustento da família voltou  ao mundo de negócio tendo arranjado uma banca e passou a vender hortículas e outros produtos da primeira necessidade.
Conheceu a Hluvuku por meio de amigas e solicitou o primeiro empréstimo com o qual começou a erguer a sua infraestrutura comercial. Nao possui nenhuma formação do seu negócio, tendo ganho experiênça ao longo dos anos de trabalho , com os empréstimos seguintes transformou a sua barraca( infraestrutura comercial precario)em Mini mercearia e comprou uma viatura caixa aberta o qual lhe ajuda no transporte de mercadoria. Actualmente conta com uma Merceária que é propriedade sua e uma outra  arendada.
Vive actualmente com 8 pessoas na sua responsabilidade, e no seu negócio emprega duas pessoas uma das quais tem 2 filhos.
A sua actividade inicia as 8 horas e não precisa de transporte porque a mini mercearia localiza-se junto de casa e só para ir a outra é que tem se deslocado do carro próprio.
 A sua mercadoria adquiri do outro lado da baía, na cidade de Maputo onde tem alugado um carro para levar a mercadoria até na atravessia isso porque o seu carro é pequeno e não poderia transportar todos produtos duma só vez. Depois de atravessar a mercadoria, tem usado o seu transporte para a distribuicão pelas Mercearias.
O melhor período no seu negócio é no fim do mês e no verão onde a receita diária chega a atingir 10.000,00mt e os produtos que mais vende são os cereiais , leguminosas , óleo ,vegetais ,e açúcar . 
Tem feito registos no seu negócio e a única dificuldade no seu negócio é  no transporte de mercadoria uma vez a sua viatura é menor o que lhe obriga a ter que alugar outra .
O seu negócio  está tomando um rumo satisfatório e a sua margem de lucro mensal tem sido na ordem de 15,000.00mt e com este rendimento uma parte aplica na ampliação e melhoramento da sua casa , nas despesas domésticas e uma parte vai para a poupança.
Com o presente crédito de 60,000.00mt aplicou no apetrechamento do estabelecimento que alugou junto á baía. E ,futuramente pretende diversificar o seu negócio  abrindo uma ferragem e comprar uma viatura maior pelo que  ainda recorrerá ao empréstimo.
Este empréstimo e outros anteriores modificaram positivamente o seu negócio e a  sua vida e está muito entusiasmada .

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Usmonjon

texts.en: G. Usmonjon is loves animals very much and owns a  dog, cat, calf and bull at home. His family plays with their pets every day. In 2003, Usmonjon began a cattle breeding business. He fattens bulls, sells them in the market and buys more calves to fatten. He became a client of Microinvest last year and has shown himself to be  a responsible and client who repays his loans punctually. He is requesting a loanto purchase feed for his animals.

loans.use: Purchasing animal feed

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.en: R. Mahsudjon is a young farmer. He is married and has one child. His farm is located in Kuybushev, in the district of Khujand. He has been engaged in business for over 6 years. He has 6 bulls and uses his loans for fattening them for market. With his loans from Microinvest he purchases fodder for them. When they become fat enough, he sells them in the animal market and buys the next group of bulls. He says that he loves his business and in future he plans to increase the number of his bulls. Currently he is requesting a loan to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder.

loans.name: Mutia

texts.en: Mrs. Mutia A. is 35 years old, married and has 3 children; she lives in Mushi, Lagos State of Nigeria. She sells baby items and has been in this business since 1987. She has been a LAPO member for the past 4 years. She needs the loan of $400 to buy more baby items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby items for sale

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Mrs. Dupe K. is 34 years old, married and has 2 children; she lives in Mushi, Lagos State of Nigeria. She sells cocoyams & sweet potatoes. She is requesting for a loan of $400 to buy more cocoyams & sweet potatoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cocoyams & sweet potatoes for sale

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en: Zarif has been in business for over 15 years. He is married and has 3 children. Zarif’s profession is plasterer and painter but at home he has an additional business: cattle breeding. His wife and his children help him to take care of their animals. Currently he has 3 cows from which he receives 20 liters of milk. He sells the milk to cheese workshops every day. He additionally has 2 calves and he plans to fatten them for sale. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan from Kiva and is going to spend it for purchasing hay and mixed fodder for his animals for the winter.

loans.use: Purchasing hay  and mixed fodder.

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Mrs. Folake A. loves selling bread, a business which she started in 2003. She hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. She needs the loan of $400 to buy more bread for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Shavkat has loved raising sheep since childhood. He has been engaged in the livestock business for over 5 years now. Shavkat is married and has 3 children. His family is friendly and his wife helps him in his business activities. Currently he has five sheep and plans to purchase fodder for his animals. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder for sheep.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq A. is a client of Microinvest who is engaged in the cattle breeding business. He has managed to acquire a lot of experience during his 15 years in this business and so is a specialist in this sphere. He lives in the Gafurov district in Khujand and he has a big stockyard near his house. He has 4 children and they all help in their father’s business.

Currently Rafiq has 4 big bulls and two calves. With this loan he wants to purchase fodder for the winter season. At present, the price for hay and other fodder is cheaper as it is still the season of gathering in the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for his animals

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Alexandre Mateus V. was born in 1951, in Gaza, Mozambique and moved to Maputo when he was 18. He was emprisoned at the age of 19, when he tried to join the political group Front for the Liberation of Mozambique (FRELIMO), and released a few years later as the war for independence went on. Alexandre is the father of 7 children and a client of Hluvuku since 2003. This is his 6th loan cycle and he intends to use the requested amount to repair one of the two mini-buses he owns and runs as public transportation. His limited insurance won't cover the repair costs and he needs the vehicle in order to make a living. His transportation business employs two full-time drivers and two part-time helpers. Buses run from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and consistently bring in a good profit after all expenses are paid. The money he makes from the business goes toward household and school expenses, and to the maintenance of the two vehicles. His activities have a very positive impact on his community, since the mini-buses are the most commonly form of transportation used by it. Alexandre hopes to improve his business in the near future by adding more mini-buses.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Polana Caniço-Maputo Cliente: Alexandre Mateus V. Actividade: Transporte, reabilitacao da viatura Valor de empréstimo: 100.000,00 ( 4.000 usd) Aplicação: , Reabilitacao da viatura Início: 07-11-07 Fim: 30-04-09 Alexandre Mateus V., nasceu aos 22 de Junho de 1951 em Macalauane, Distrito de Chibuto Província de Gaza, apartir dos 18 anos veio a Maputo onde viveu com sobrinho, qual foi responsável pelo seu estudos. Durante este periodo a companhava frequentimnte a Voz Da Frelimo( Frente da libertação de Mocambique), aos 19 anos na primeira tentativa de se filiar ao partido foi preso. Ficou um tempo na cadeia como preso pólitico e apenas foi liberto com a intensificação da guerra . Deste lá até então faz parte do quadro dos funcionário do Ministério da Defesa, actualmente tem 7 filhos e é cliente da Hluvuku desde 2003. Duarnte este periodo até agora tem 5 emprestimo concluidos. Com empréstimo de 100.000, 00 mts ( cem mil meticais), pretende reparar a sua viatura que sofreu um acidente viacão e uma vez que a viatura apenas está assegurada contra os tereceiro, ele é que deverá se responsabilizar pela reparação Segundo nos informou trata-se de uma activiadade rentável, actualmente possui dois Mini-bus e em emprega a tempo inteiro 2 chefes de familia e 2 cobradosres sazonais. Actividade inicia as 6 horas da manhã e o término as 19 horas, os rendimento diarios despois da pagas todas as despesas é de 1.000,00 mts( mil metical) Com os rendimentos do negocio garante o incremento da renda mensal da familia bem como a manutenção das viaturas. Esta actividade tem um impacto basatente positivo na vida da comunidade pois tem é o meio de transporte usual para comunicar os diferente pontos da cidade assim como estabelece a ligacão cidade - periferia servido. Futuro presepectiva fortiifcar está área adquirindo mais viatura pelo que conta ainda com outros empréstimo

loans.use: To repair one of the two mini-buses that are  part of his public transportation business

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon has been in business for over 7 years. His business is selling sportswear for all ages. His business place is located in the open air, in Panjshanbe market, Khujand. He has good turnover of his inventory, which he brings from Istaravshan's wholesale market. He has established a reputation as a good businessman who sells high quality merchandise. He has a lot of customers who purchase his goods with pleasure. His business place is convenient for clients as it is situated in the center of Khujand.

Gafurjon wishes to receive a loan from KIVA and plans to spend it to put a roof over his place of business. That will give him the opportunity to hang his goods in rainy and snowy weather.

loans.use: building a roof over his stand

loans.name: Annamaria

texts.en:
Annamaria is 32 years old. She lives with her husband, 2 farm and house attendants, and 4 orphaned children from her sister and brother. She and her husband have no children of their own. Annamaria owns a business - she started a bird farm 5 years ago, and is currently raising 60 chickens, 23 turkeys, 80 ducks, and 30 guinea foul. The poultry business - sale of meat and eggs to supermarkets - allows her to earn a profit of around US$280 a month. Annamaria uses around US$65 of this amount for the maintenance of her farm. She also opened a candy store 3 years ago, which brings in a weekly profit of US$25-40. The combined income from the two businesses is sufficient for covering home expenses, school fees, and construction of a house for the family.

From a previous loan, Annamaria was able to buy more ducks for her farm, and to continue the construction of their house. She now hopes to take out a bigger loan of US$900 to buy candy, juice, soda, cake, and cookies for her shop, and to have more repairs done on the house.

Annamaria belongs to the group Subira (Swahili for “patience”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of store inventory and repair of a house

payments.comment: Annamaria has completed paying back her loan before the end of the loan term

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.en: Sadridin started his business in 2006. He is married and has 4 children. His business was just selling candies and other sugary products. By increasing his working capital, he is now also able to include pastas and several kinds of tea. His business is located in the food market of Ovchikalacha, in the district in Khujand. His business is developing successfully. Every month his assets are increasing and he repays his loans on time. He plans to use this loan to further expand his growing business.

loans.use: expansion of his business inventory and thus turnover

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira M. is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan republic. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is the only breadwinner in her family. She began her business with $200 in 2005, dealing in mobile industry goods and retail trade. She also started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she can hardly earn enough money to meet the family's food and important consumption needs.

Elmira needs $600 to expand her business. She wants to increase her assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes that this will help her expand her business and further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods

loans.name: Bizumrad

texts.en: Bizumrad M. is an active client of Microinvest. She has been engaged in selling children's clothes for over 6 years. Her business is located in Ovchikalacha in the clothes market district, in Kujand. She has a good turnover of her working capital and many faithful customers. Currently she needs extra capital for expansion of her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothes for children for resale

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is 35 years old and runs a beauty parlor. The parlor opened 5 months ago, after Jamilah received her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Prior to running the salon, she had moved from house to house for the previous 4½ years as a traveling hairdresser. Jamilah's salon now allows her to earn US$18 a day on weekdays and US$60-70 a day on weekends and during festive seasons. The rent for the salon space costs about US$640 a year. Jamilah also employs a full-time assistant hairdresser.

Jamilah lives with her husband, 2 children (ages 12 and 4), 3 orphans (20, 15, and 10 years old), and the beauty salon assistant. Her husband works for an NGO that focuses on promoting HIV/AIDS prevention.

With the profits from her business and with a new loan of US$900, Jamilah hopes to open a tailoring business and begin selling sarongs. She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchases for a tailoring business

payments.comment: Jamilah has successfully paid the remaining of her loan before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Iyabode

texts.en: Mrs. Iyabode O. is 35 years old, married, with 3 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, sugar, and salt in the market. She has been in business since 2000. She needs a loan of $400 to buy more     provisions, sugar, and salt for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, sugar, and salt for sale

loans.name: Bahri

texts.en: Bahri P. has been selling household supplies for over 2 years. She is mother of 5 children. Her business place is located in a big market in the Ovchikalacha region, in Khujand. She said that her stand is profitable and she has a lot of faithful customers. The turnover of her goods is fast and she goes to purchase inventory in Istaravshan once a week. Her elder son stays at her stand during the time when she is on the trip. She has regularly repaid her loan from Microinvest. She is taking part in the Kiva program with the aim of increasing her working capital.

loans.use: expansion of her inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives with her husband, three children (ages 18, 13, and 8), two younger sisters, and their assistant. She opened a new restaurant called “Mama Rwecho Café” a month ago. Prior to that, Maria was a charcoal vendor, but found that it was not a stable source of income. Her café is now open from 6am until 11pm each day, and serves around 50 customers. A meal costs about 91 cents per plate. While Maria makes a profit of around US$18 a day, almost US$3 goes toward rent. She also employs 4 cooks to help her.

Previously, Maria took out a loan to open the restaurant. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes to take out another loan of US$900 to buy rice and other cooking items in bulk quantities.

Maria belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cooking items for a restaurant

payments.comment: Maria has successfully paid the remaining of her loan before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa S. is 48 years old. He is married to Aminata, who is a housewife, and has 8 children. He lives with his family in Adjamé, a populated suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. Moussa sells various women's fashion articles in the Adjamé market. Moussa has been in this business for many years, and has been able to earn enough to support his family. Moussa is a dynamic tradesman. His shop is well-replenished with ladies' fashion articles, and he manages to make a good profit margin from selling these goods. In expectation of the coming celebrations of Aid El Kebir, Christmas and the New Year, Moussa would like to purchase more goods for sale, in order to meet his customers' needs. He is asking for a loan of US$1025 for this purpose. Moussa has been enrolled in the AE&I microcredit program since 2005 and has had a good credit performance since then.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Fahosat

texts.en: Mrs. Fahosat G. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells  building materials. This is a business she learnt from her mother.She is in needs of $475 to buy more  building materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more  building materials for sale.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: Muhayo H.  rents a stall in the market in the Ovchikalacha region in Khujand. Her business a candy store. She is married and has 2 children. She has3 years' experience in this line of work . Her stand is profitable and the turnover of her working capital is fast. She buys her goods from supplies from Uzbekistan, making her purchases three times a month. Presently she wants to spend her loan for her next purchase of candies so as to expand her inventory.

loans.use: expanding her inventory to increase her turnover

loans.name: Agostinho

texts.pt:
Agostinho U. was born in 1967 in the province of Niassa, in Mozambique. He lives with his family in the house he bought in 1999, and is the sole provider for 6 people. He himself comes from a large family of 10 kids. Agostinho left his family at the age of 14, when a scholarship led him to Cuba to study at the Polytechnic Institute of Havana and, later, to graduate from college as an Economist. He currently works for the Finances and Planning Department of Mozambique. Agostinho heard about Hluvuku from his twin brother, who is a Marine Officer. Since the family is getting bigger, he decided to apply for a loan to buy construction material to make additions/improvements to his house. Once he's done with the home improvements and has paid off his loan, he plans to take another one to help his brother have a simple wedding party.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao: Matola texlom Actividade: Habitaçao Valor empréstimo: 150.000,00MTN ( 6.000usd) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de material de construçao Início: 06-11-07 Fim:28-02-09 Agostinho U., nascido em Sanga Provincia de Niassa a 40 anos aos 30 de Janeiro de 1967, sustenta 6 pessoas e reside na casa propria que adquiriu em 1999. Cresceu e viveu num ambiente familiar onde tinha 10 irmãos e sendo ele gémeo. Quando tinha 14 anos separou-se da familia, prosseguiu com os estudos no instituto comercial de ngungunhana e daí ganhou uma bolsa para Cuba onde foi fazer o ensino médio no instituto politécnico de Havana e o ensino superior como economista. A vida foi deficil porque teve que se separar da família e ir em busca de conhecimentos para o seu sustento. Nos fins de semana era obrigado a trabalhar em havana para obter dinheiro para as despesas do seu dia a dia. Anos mais tarde foi afecto no Ministério de plano e finanças onde trabalha actualmente como chefe do departamento financeiro ate que um dia ouviu falar da lhuvuku através do seu irmão gémeo que trabalha na Marinha de guerra. Decidiu também procurar a instituição e solicitar um empréstimo para melhorar a sua casa porque agora vive na dependência e como a familia esta cada vez mais a aumentar pretende erguer uma casa maior. Assim durante a sua actividade não tem tido dificuldades porque como tem um sobrinho a viver com ele, este controla a obra e dá o relatório diariamente ao tio uma vez que tem saído muito cedo de casa e só volta depois das 22 horas. Actualmente para além de trabalhar no Ministério do Plano e Finanças, faz também assinatura de contas em várias instituições e que com o salário consegue pagar os seus estudos ,escola dos filhos e manter a casa assim como poupar para a obra.. Com o empréstimo de 150.000,00 pretende cobrir e terminar com a obra. A sua perspectiva futura e terminar o crédito e fazer um outro empréstimo para fazer um casamento comum com o seu irmao gemeo..

loans.use: To buy construction material to improve his home

loans.name: Elisa Armando

texts.pt:
Elisa Amado C. was born in 1965, in Maputo, Mozambique. She's 42 years old and lives with her partner and children. At the age of 6 she went to live with her grandparents, and was able to attend school until 4th grade. She has been with her partner, the father of her children, since she was 17. Right after starting a small business selling basic groceries, in 1992, Elisa got ill and was forced to stop working for a year. Once she got better she decided to dedicate herself to the business of selling clothes, which she has been doing for 4 years now. Elisa buys the clothes in downtown Maputo (the children's clothes are the most lucrative ones) and rents a car to have the pieces delivered to her neighborhood, where she sells them at a stand located near home. Elisa doesn't have a bookkeeping system to keep track of her transactions (she doesn't know how to do it and says she prefers to keep it all "in her memory.") Business is going very well for her, and she wants to use her loan to increase her inventory. Profits from the sales are divided between helping with the household expenses, reinvesting in the business and saving. The Hluvuku loans have had a very positive impact on Elisa's life so far, and she hopes it will help her buy a piece of land in her home province, one day.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro ferroviário –Maputo Cliente:Elisa Armando C. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 15,000.00mt ( 600usd) Aplicação: venda de Roupas Início: 08/10/07 Fim: 30/01/2009 Elisa Armando C., nasceu aos 25 de fevereiro de 1965 em Namaacha província de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente tem filhos estudou até 4ªclasse . Viveu com os pais até aos 6 anos e com ausência do pai teve que ir viver com os avôs até aos 16 anos , aos 17 anos junta-se com seu marido. Em 1992 iniciou o negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade num dos mercados da cidade, algum tempo depois fica gravemente doente facto que lhe obrigou ater que parar durante um ano.depois de melhorar retoma o negócio tendo mudado o tipo de negócio passando a vender a roupa até então e faz este negócio a 4 anos. Não tem formação neste negócio e não emprega ninguem por enquanto.Com o empréstimo de 15,000.00mt comprou fardos de roupa para revenda. Abre o seu negócio as 8 horas e para chegar no seu posto de trabalho não usa nenhum meio de transporte por este se localizar perto de casa. Adquiri a mercadoria na cidade e aluga uma viatura para transportá-la. O melhor período do negócio tem sido no fim do mês, a receita diária tem sido de 1,000 a 1,500,00 sendo a roupa da crainças que tem dado o maior lucro. Não faz registos de vendas por igoráncia acha que não tem muitas contas a fazer tudo oque faz é possível afixar na sua memória. As dificuldades tem sido em certos momentos onde o puder de compra diminui mas que não pode prejudicar os reembolsos de crédito uma vez que o seu marido trabalha e é pensionista e poderá lhe ajudar nesses momentos. O negócio está caminhar bem e a margem de lucro mensal tem sido de 5,000.00 mt e com os rendimentos faz o reinvestimento , ajuda o marido no sustento da família e uma parte deposita no banco. Futuramente almeja abrir uma machamba na sua terra natal e para tal poderá recorrer ao empréstimo. O empréstimo modificou positivamente o seu negócio e está satisfeita.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Haelen

texts.en:
HAELEN, age 34, runs a general store called "Imma's Shop" (named after her son Immanuel), and also sells clothing from house to house. She lives with her shopkeeper (her niece) in back of the store in a one-room house. Haelen sends money to her mother in the village, who is raising her 14-year-old son. She was brought to Dar es Salaam over 4 years ago by her sister in order to find work, after she and her husband separated. Since then, her sister has passed away.

Haelen opened her shop in 2003. There, she sells sugar, beans, rice, sodas, ice cubes, and other general food items. She makes about $18 a week from this business. Rent for her shop costs about $20 a month and she pays her shopkeeper a salary of the same amount.

Realizing that the shop business was not dependable because of the fluctuating costs of her inventory, Haelen started selling clothes on the street about 6-7 months ago. From this business, she makes a profit of about $35 a week. Her customers generally pay her by weekly installments. Besides paying for school fees and general expenses, she is using her profits to build a house on land that she recently purchased.

Earlier this year, Haelen took out a loan which helped her move her shop to a different location. Having paid this back successfully, she hopes to take out another loan to increase her shop’s inventory and to buy more clothes to sell.

She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

payments.comment: Haelen was able to pay the remaining amount of her loan early. She is thankful for the loan and how it helped her business. Her shop is doing well and she is hoping for another loan from Tujijenge soon.

loans.name: Bodurin

texts.en: Mrs. Bodurin T. is 45 years old. She is divorced with 4 children, and lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fish and has been in business since 1993. She needs a loan of $400 to buy more fish for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abduchabor is a cheerful person. His business is selling sports clothes for children and teenagers. He has been in business for over 10 years. His stand is located in Ovchikalacha, Khujand; it is very profitable since it is situated in the centre of the clothing market.

Abduchabor buys his goods from Istaravshan's wholesale market every week. Because of his years of work in this business, he has plenty of experience with serving his customers and knows their style preferences and needs. He always tries to sell fashionable but serviceable clothes. He says that his goods are competitive so as to attract more customers. His business is going well and he is going to spend his hoped-for loan purchasing warm sports clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: Purchace of warm sports clothes for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.pt:
Miguel Tomás M. was born on September 13th, 1967 in the province of Inhambe. He was raised by his grandparents and studied until the 5th grade. He is 40 years old, married and father of 6 children. When he was 12 years old he started working in a furniture factory as a carpenter. His company got into financial trouble so Miguel left and started working as a carpenter. He got married when he was 18 years old. Today, he has 6 employees. One has 6 children and the other supports 13 people. He has a small shop in his home where he sells furniture. He buys the lumber in cities nearby. The best time for business is in the end of the year. His monthly income always varies.

All his products bring in income, however he has been experiencing difficulty because of the rise of the price of lumber. His profit margin has been of 6.000mt to 10.000mt. With the income he pays his employees, reinvests in the business, and tries to save. In the suture he plans on building a bakery for when he is no longer strong enough to work as a carpenter. He already ahs a lot where he plans to build the bakery. He is very pleased with the credit program. He wants to increase his inventory and income.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Ferroviário- Maputo cidade Cliente:Miguel M. Actividade: Fabrico e venda de Mobília Valor de Empréstimo:20.000,00mt ( 800usd) Aplicação: Compra de Madeira Início: 18-09-07 Fim: 10-01-09

Miguel Tomás M. , nasceu aos 13 de Setembro de 1967 na província de Inhambane, tem 40 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e tem 6 filhos estudou até 5ªclasse. Passou uma parte da sua infância com os avôs em Inhambane aos 5 anos parte á Maputo onde passou a viver com sua Mãe e Padrasto. Aos 12 anos começou a trabalhar numa fábrica de mobília onde aprendeu a carpintaria e juntava dinheiro com o qual ia comprando ferramentas de trabalho, algum tempo depois a Empresa começou a ter problemas financeiros facto que lhe fez deixar a Empresa e começar a trabalhar a conta própria na área da carpintaria não tendo formação formal e , faz este trabalho a 18 anos ,em 1989 junta se com a sua esposa . Tem 6 empregados dois quais um tem um filho e outro tem 6, vive com 13 pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Possui uma oficina junto de sua casa e uma loja de venda de mobília a meio kilómetro de casa. Os seus estabelecimentos abrem as 7 horas e não precisa de nenhum transporte para se deslocar por ser perto de casa. Tem comprado a madeira nas serrações localizadas nos arredores da cidade e aluga uma viatura para o seu transporte, e o período bom para o seu negócio é no fim do ano . Não tem tido receita mensal fixa tendo em conta que as vezes chega a não ter nenhuma receita mensal devido ao tipo de negócio.

Todos os produtos que faz dão lucro e tem registo das vendas e as dificuldades tem sido a financeira devido á subida galopante do preço da Madeira e por ser um negócio que as vezes leva muito tempo para vender. A margem de lucro tem sido de 6,000 a 10,0000.00mt e com os rendimentos tem feito o reinvestimento , pagamento do salário de trabalhadores e uma parte deposita. Futuramente pretende instalar uma padaria para quando não ter mais força para trabalhar com a madeira sendo um trabalho pesado passará a se dedicar no negócio de pão e já possui um terreno para o efeito a 30km da cidade de Maputo. Está satisfeito com o empréstimo embora acha pouco o valor que lhe foi concedido mas ajudou em parte uma vez que aumentou o volume da matéria prima pretende crescer mais nesta actividade.

loans.use: To buy raw material ( wood for furniture)

loans.name: Adeyinka

texts.en: Mrs. T. Adeyinka is a 60 year old widow with 6 children, and she lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells fresh fish, and has been a LAPO member for 4 years. She has been in business since 1970 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Mrs. Abiola A. is 38 years old, married, with 4 children. She lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene to people, and has been a member of LAPO for the past 4 years. She has been in her business since 1996 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Nassirane

texts.en: Nassirane Cheickbane is 44 years old. He is married and has 7 children. He lives with his family in Attecoube, in the north-west of the Abidjan district. Nassirane is a butcher and has a butcher shop in Attecoube market. His wife is a housewife and takes care of their children. Nassirane is a good businessman. He has been in business for more than 15 years, and has been able to fully support his family with the revenues generated from his shop. Nassirane is asking for a loan of US$1,125 to purchase a couple of cows. He obtained his first loan from AE&I in May 2005, and has been an excellent performer since then.

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en:
Firangiz Quliyeva is a refugee from Zengilan region, a territory of Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict situated in the west part of Azerbaijan. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children. She began her business with $300 in 2004. At first, she was selling children's clothing and earning little money. She had difficulty covering her family's consumption needs.

Firangiz wants to improve her business and increase the number of her clients. She needs $500 to open an area of private trade to sell her goods in the central market, to expand her business. She hopes that expanding her business will help her improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To open an area of private trade to sell her goods in the central market

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Mrs. Sarah A. is 50 years old, married, with 5 children, and lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells earrings, powder, soup items, and provisions. She has been in business since 1982 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more earrings, powder, and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more earrings, powder, soup item, and provisions for sale

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim P. is married with three children, and he lives in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He owns a mobile telephone store, which he has been running for the last five years (his employee is pictured here). Alim has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit, thus proving that he is a trustworthy customer. Alim would like a loan of $1,200 to increase his inventory of mobile telephone accessories.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories for his shop

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz K. is a widow with seven children.  All of her children had to quit their studies after their father’s death.  To make household expenses, she started making artificial flowers for a meager income of $50 a month. To support her in managing the domestic everyday expenditures her eldest son works at a local factory as a driver. Her son feels that if he is able to become a partner in one of the factory vehicles, he will get decent profits which will substantially raise their living standard. They request a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: invest in a vehicle

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira B. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a fabric stand in the town of Khachmaz, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Elmira is 37 years old and has been working in this business with her husband for the last six years. She and her husband have two children. Elmira has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit and is currently requesting a loan of $825 so that she can purchase more material for her business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride M. (her employee is pictured) owns a small market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She is a single 53-year-old businesswoman. Feride has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that she is a trusted and valued client. She is currently requesting a loan of $1,000 so that she can increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Oluwatosin

texts.en: Mrs. Oluwatosin I. is 39 years old, married, with 4 children, and she lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a caterer and also sells kitchen dishes. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more kitchen dishes for sale. She is a LAPO member in one of the unions in Lagos State and has been in business since 1995. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen equipment for sale

loans.name: Ouattara

texts.en: Ouattara K. is 39 years old and has 6 children. She lives with her husband and their children in Attecoube, a populated suburb in the north-western part of the Abidjan District. Her husband has retired from his work at a railway company. K. earns income for the family by selling bread and noodles near her home, close to the Attecoube market. This business helps K. cover household expenses, as well as school fees for her children. She is a hard worker, and would like to borrow US$225 to purchase various diverse food items for her catering business. She joined the AE&I microcredit program in 2004, and has since then received and successfully repaid several loans.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for a catering business

loans.name: Gurikhan

texts.en: Gurikhan B. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own and operate a small tea house in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Gurikhan was born in the Russian Federation territory of Dagistan in 1968 and then moved to Khachmaz. Gurikhan and her husband have been operating this tea house for the last ten years and have two children together. They are currently requesting a loan of $500 so that they can purchase new equipment for their tea house.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her tea house

loans.name: Kazimey

texts.en: Kazimey U. was born in the Russian Federation of Dagistan in 1965 and then moved to the town of Khachmaz on the northeast coast of Azerbaijan. He owns his own hauling truck (called a “kamaz” in Azerbaijan), and he makes his living by transporting masonry bricks to construction sites. Kazimey has been working as a truck driver for the last ten years and is married with two children. He is currently requesting a loan of $1,200 so that he can make some much-needed repairs to his truck.

loans.use: To repair his work truck

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz H. and his wife (his wife is pictured) sell wool in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Novruz is 47 years old, has five children, and has been selling wool with his wife for the last 15 years. He has already repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit, thus making him one of our most trusted and valued customers. Novruz is currently requesting a loan of $1,200 so that he can increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Mrs. Abiola O. is 42 years old, married with 3 children, and she hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She rents chairs, canopies, and tables for celebrants of all types of ceremonies. She has been in this business since 1997, and needs the loan of $400 to buy more chairs, canopies, and tables for rent.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, canopies, and tables for rent

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna B. is 42, married and have two daughters. She lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Her elder daughter studies in grade six and the younger one studies in grade five.  Her husband is a tailor and he creates men's clothes. He plans to improve his business and requests a loan of US$350. He will buy raw materials for his business in a suitable quantity.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for creating men wear

loans.name: Zehra

texts.en: Zehra and her family (her son is pictured) own and operate a footwear stand at the bazaar in the town of Khachmaz on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Zehra was born in Sabirabad, in the south of Azerbaijan, but then moved to Khachmaz. She is married with six children and has been working in this business for the last 13 years. Zehra has already repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit,  thus proving to be a trustworthy customer. She is currently requesting a loan of $800 so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Adesuwa O. is 40 years old, married with four (4) children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells building materials to people living in her community and neighbouring town. She learned this business for a year, and 6 months after that, in 2002, she started her own business. She is LAPO member, and wishes to expand her business with an $800 loan which will be used to buy more building materials.

loans.use: To buy more building materials for sale

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en: Azmat P. is a mother of five children, all of whom are boys. All of them attend a local school, except the youngest one who is too young to attend the school at the present. Azmat hopes to give them a prosperous future and requests a loan of US$350 for her husband’s spare parts business. He owns a small shop in a busy city market. His business does well and now he wants to diversify his existing product line by adding car tires. He hopes to have a very well established business in the near future.

loans.use: Diversify the existing product line

loans.name: Salawu

texts.en: Salawu A. is 34 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a tradeswoman, and they live with their children in Yopougon, in the north of Abidjan. Salawu has a mill in Adjame, where he processes various cereals and dry fruit to produce and sell different types of food powder. Salawu and his wife have been able to send their 3 elder children to school. Salawu is dynamic and well organized. He manages his business very well. He benefited from his first loan from AE&I in 2005, using the money to buy machinery parts for his mill. He has since then received more loans that he has successfully repaid. He is now asking for a loan of US$825, which will be used to purchase cereal and dry fruit for processing.

loans.use: Purchase of cereal and dry fruit

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: "People cannot do without food and water, and I specialize in cooking food and selling pure water and drinks. Recently, my customers have increased and the demand for drinks and food has increased too. Due to this, I need a loan of $475 to buy more cooked food, drinks, and sachet bags of water for sale," says Mrs. Patience I.. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She lives in Benin City, and has been in this business since 1997 and with LAPO for the past 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more cooked food, drinks, and sachet bags of water for sale

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia Y. is a married mother of four: three girls and one boy. Two of her daughters are married and have their own families. Earlier Zakia used to stitch on order but now does not because her son is grown up and her family wants her to rest now. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son is a jeweler. He started and established this business with the loans they took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Now he wishes to produce a large variety of jewelry for which he requires a loan.

loans.use: produce large variety of jewelry

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 50 years old, and she sells provisions, drinks and oil to people in her community. She is married to Mr. I., has 4 children, and they live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. In 1973, she sold cooked food and later changed to the selling of provisions in 1989. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years. With a $475 loan she will buy more provisions, drinks, and oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and oil for sale

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat B. and her husband own a restaurant in Lahore, Pakistan.  The restaurant does well and the business has been slowly flourishing since inception. They request a loan of US $250 to buy a freezer so they can store vegetables and meat. This way they will not have to rush daily for vegetables and other items that are out of stock. The freezer will also help serve chilled soft drinks to their customers. She hopes that one day their restaurant will be the best in the town.

loans.use: Buy freezer for the restaurant

loans.name: Mah

texts.en:
Traoré Mah is a dynamic 49-year-old tradeswoman. Mah goes door-to-door to sell clothes. She delivers fashionable clothes to her customers at their home,office,or workplace. This marketing approach has brought her many customers.

She works hard, and contributes significantly to the household expenses of her family. She has also developed a fruit juice business that does very well.

Mah heard about AE&i from her sister last year. Mah received her first loan 4 months later and was very successful.

Mah is married and has one child. Her daughter is in secondary school. Mah lives with her family in Attecoube, a suburb in the northwestern area of Abidjan.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: "This business is the source of livelihood for my family. I sell provisions, drinks, foodstuffs, ice fish, and I grind tomatoes and pepper for people living in my community. I always get my goods from New Benin Market, Mission Road and Penso Market," says Mrs. Helen I.. She is 46 years old, married with five (5) children, and she lives in Benin City. She is a member of LAPO union and has been in this business since 1997. She learned the act of trading from her mother. She is seeking a loan of $625 to buy drinks, provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, foodstuffs and buy an additional machine to grind tomatoes

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has a beautiful flower and indoor plant shop located in the far southwestern Ukrainian city of Beregovo. Her attractively arranged store carries a variety of flowers, plants, and potting materials as well as decorative wind-chimes and other display items.  There is always a demand for flowers and indoor plants which are very popular in Ukraine. Tatyana is a motivated entrepreneur who loves plants and works hard to meet her goals. She has been in business for about two years and currently makes about $375 a month in profit. Tatyana is married and has two children.

Tatyana has requested a loan of $500 to increase her business's working capital.  This will allow her to purchase additional inventory and increase her profits. We are glad for the opportunity to assist Tatyana as she continues developing a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is married and has one child. His business is the main source of income for his family.  About five years ago Volodya started a business selling something he enjoys – home electronics and appliances. His small indoor retail space at the “Fortune” store in Beregovo, Ukaine is packed with TVs, microwaves, washing machines, refrigerators, and other home appliances. These items have been in strong demand in Ukraine as the economy has expanded and should stay in demand with the increased use of consumer credit. Volodya would like to take advantage of the demand and grow his business. He has about $10,000 worth of inventory in his store and he makes about $550 profit in a typical month.
