Volodya has requested a loan of $1000 to increase his available business capital. He has benefited from financial assistance through Nadiya Ukraine in the past and has used funding wisely. We are happy for another opportunity to help him as he works to develop and expand his business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Nelnila

texts.en: Nelnila is a single lady with a small business selling office and school supplies in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She is a very experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for twelve years. Reasonable prices, good product selection and hard work have been the secrets to the success of her business. Nelnina would like to continue that success and has requested a loan of $1000 to increase her working capital. This will allow her to buy new inventory items to sell and enable her to match her products with customer demand so that she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya and her husband Alexander have a small family business selling kitchen supplies and accessories. They have two market vending kiosks in the city of Zaporoshye, located in south central Ukraine, where they sell a variety of dishes, glassware, table linens and other kitchen supplies. Victoriya and Alexander have two daughters ages 15 and 10. Their business is an important source of income for their family.

Victoriya has requested a loan of $1000 to add to their business capital and help purchase new inventory to sell. Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has benefited Victoriya’s and Alexander’s business in the past. We are happy for this new opportunity to help them continue operating a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty lives with her in-laws on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Obispo Bosque district of the city of La Paz. Betty is already a member of Kiva and a previous loan was used to increase her investment capital. The loan helped increase her earnings by helping her offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She owns and operates an auto repair shop selling spare parts. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to acquire an even greater variety of products providing her with a new opportunity to grow her income. Betty’s favorable payment history with Impro qualifies her to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty vive en casa de los suegros en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de Obispo Bosque de la Ciudad de La Paz ; ella ya es parte de Kiva y el crédito que se le concedió anteriormente lo utilizo para aumentar su capital. Actualmente mejoró sus ingresos, tiene mas productos y mas clientela por que surtió su mercadería, ya que ella tiene un taller de repuestos; el crédito que solicita ahora es para seguir surtiendo su mercadería y de esta manera mejorar aún más sus ingresos. El antecedente Histórico con Impro la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use:
Merchandise purchase

Compra de mercaderia

payments.comment: early payoff. Betty will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. María lives with her husband and children in Anticrético, José Saravia street, Tembladerani district, La Paz. She sells fireworks. It’s the second credit she asks for with Impro via Kiva. She used the first loan for capital increase. The new loan will be used to purchase more merchandise and to increase the working capital. She qualifys for the loan as her record guarantees her solvency.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Maria vive en anticrético en la calle José Saravia de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus hijos; se dedica a la venta de juegos pirotécnicos. Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en Impro via Kiva, pues anteriormente ella obtuvo un primer préstamo a través de Kiva, con el cual pudo aumentar su capital. Este nuevo crédito será utilizado para comprar más mercadería y asi aumentar su capital de trabajo. Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, pues su historial crediticio avala su capacidad de pago.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Early payoff. Maria is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa lives at her mother’s in law, Buenos Aires Avenue, Las Lomas district, La Paz city. She sells leisure wear for a living and she travels around the country to purchase merchandise and increase the supply. The incomes are enough to satisfy her personal needs and to pay her monthly instalments. She’s already apply for a credit in Kiva. Her previous loan was entirely paid off and very well used. The new credit will be used to purchase merchandise, increase her variety and to cover the demand. According to her record, she may access a new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Marisa vive en casa de su suegra en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la Ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la comercialización de ropa deportiva. Marisa viaja a diferentes departamentos del país para traer mercadería y así tener variedad de mercadería. Los ingresos que genera de esta actividad alcanzan para sus necesidades personales y para pagar las cuotas mensuales de su préstamo. Ella ya es parte de los clientes que solicitaron crédito a través de Kiva. El crédito anterior fue cancelado en su totalidad y fue muy bien utilizado. El nuevo crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de mercadería para tener mas variedad y cubrir la demanda que tiene. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Early payoff. Marisa is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Mrs. Amen I. is 47 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for 3 years and she is a LAPO member. She needs a $625 loan to buy provisions, meat, and fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs

loans.name: Sirri

texts.en: Sirri and her husband Muma Godlove have been blessed with three children. Because her husband's small business does not generate much income, Sirri and her children do not have enough to eat and are unable to pay the local school fee. To overcome these problems, she has decided to start a small business of her own selling second-hand clothing. Sirri is confident that she will succeed because she has just completed a course in business skills sponsored by GHAPE. She will use the income generated by her business to pay her children's school fees and feed her family.

loans.use: Buy second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is 42 years old, married with 6 children, and she lives in Benin City. She sells akara and akamu to people living in her community and at the market. She has 8 years of experience in this business and 4 years in LAPO as a secretary of her union. She needs a $625 loan for the purchase of a grinding machine, oil, bags of beans, and maize. She says that this will assist her to buy in large quantities, and therefore serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to produce akara and akamu

loans.name: Lum

texts.en: F. is a 55-year-old widow with five children. Raising this many children as a single parent is a very heavy burden, but after her husband died F. rose to the challenge by going into business selling food to the people of her village. Her income is low, and she would like to increase it with a loan that she can use to buy additional food to sell. She will use her income to pay her children's school fees and buy basic items for her family such as food and clothing.

loans.use: To buy cocoyams, bananas, potatoes and corn

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Mrs. Cecilia U. is a dedicated LAPO client. She is 47 years old, married with 5 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling provisions and drinks since 1985, and she learned this trade from her mother. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan of $550 in order to buy more provisions and drinks in bulk for sales. She hopes to pay the loan back within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is the mother of eight children, some of whom are now grown and have children of their own. Recently, her life has been difficult because thieves broke into her home and stole many valuable items. She also suffered from an illness that required her to have surgery. These difficulties mean that she no longer has sufficient money to meet the needs of her family. She is determined to overcome these problems with a loan that she can use to buy firewood and food items to sell to the people of her village. She will use the income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees and buy pots and plates that she can use at home.

loans.use: To buy firewood, oil, salt and other items

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate E. is a faithful LAPO client. She sells provisions and drinks. According to her, this business is the source of income to her family and she wants to keep it growing. She is 29 years old, married to Mr. E., and they both live in Benin City. She is a LAPO member, and she needs a $250 loan to purchase drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Sirri Rebecca

texts.en:
Born in 191949, Rebecca is married and is a mother of four. Her husband F. John is retired and is not able to provide for his family. Rebecca therefore decided to solicit a loan from GHAPE to start a business.
As a new borrower in GHAPE, she plans to use her new loan of 40,000FCFA to cultivate crops like corn, beans cassava on her plot and to sell them in the market. She plans to use the profit to pay school fee for her children, build a house and buy medications for herself. 
She will repay the loan in 12 -15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, transport

loans.name: Sirri Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 60 years old, married and the mother of four. Her husband John is retired and no longer able to provide for his family. That's why Rebecca has decided to apply for a loan to start a business. She will use her loan to grow crops like corn, beans and cassava on her plot of land and then sell her produce in the local market. She plans to use the income she makes from farming to pay her children's school fees, build a house and buy the medications she needs for herself.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pay for the cost of transport

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa belongs to the ‘Sol Naciente’ Communal Bank located at 1085 John F. Kennedy, Jr. Ave. in the A.H. Nuevo Paraíso district of the city of Calleria within the state of Ucayali, Peru. She is 61 years old and is the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a carpenter but does not earn enough to support their family on his own. Because of this Rosa, with a loan from Manuela Ramos, began crafting mats from leftover wooden scraps to help supplement the family’s income. She runs her business from a small shop where she takes scraps of wood and creates the mats. Her husband and children also help. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to make breakfast and then begins working in the shop. Her children then take the mats to the markets in Lima to sell. With the $425 loan she is requesting, that will be repaid within 6 months, Rosa plans to purchase 8 bundles of wooden scraps, 6.6 lbs of nails and increase her work space. Rosita is very happy that her children are willing to help with her small business and hopes that they will help it grow becoming successful entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, Del Jr. Jhon F. Kenedy 1085 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es carpintero, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Rosa, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos deciD. hacer esteras D. desperdicios D. madera. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller donD. teje esteras D. madera, la misma que atienD. conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, se levantan a las 6.00 am. Para hacer el desayuno y después atienD. este taller, sus hijos también se dedican a este trabajo logrando entrar en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Lima. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,200 (US$ 400.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 8 paquetes D. residuos D. madera (tripley), 3 kilos D. clavo y ampliará el local del negocio. Rosita esta muy contenta D. tener a sus hijos dispuestos a integrarse en este pequeño negocio y tiene la esperanza que ellos hagan crecer este negocio hasta ser grandes empresarios.

loans.use:
Purchase of leftover wooden scraps. Incraese work locale.

Compra de residuos de madera (tripley). Ampliación del local.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Romerlia belongs to the Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. She is 60 year olds, a widow and mother of 3. Because of her condition she has to deal with all the home expenses, so with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open a small place to sell typical food.

Currently she prepares and sells typical food (juanes, tacos, tamales) and her local is on the siD. walk of her house, where she has many difficulties when it rains, but she doesn’t give up, and her daughters help her and go out to sell from 4pm to 11pm.

With the loan received of S/.2,500 ($833 approx.) which will be paid in 6 months, she will increase her space and will place a little ceiling to avoid the rain, also she will buy 6 kilos of rice, 2 liters of oil, and 2 bunches of plantains.

Even though Romelia is a widow she is very happy to be working with her daughters who help her in this business but without missing school duties.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Romelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre D. 3 hijos y es viuda. Debido a su condición tiene que afrontar los gastos del hogar, es así que Romelia, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos deciD. poner un pequeño puesto para la venta D. comida regional. En la actualidad elabora y venD. comida regional (juanes, tacacho, tamales) y su puesto D. venta está en la vereda D. su casa, donD. tiene dificultades cuando llueve, a pesar D. ello no se da por vencida, recibe el apoyo D. sus hijas y salen a vender a partir D. las 4.00pm hasta las 11.00 pm. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará su espacio y a su vez pondrá un pequeño techo D. calamina para evitar las lluvias, además comprará 6 kilos D. arroz, 2 litros D. aceite, 2 racimos D. plátano. Romelia a pesar D. estar viuda está muy contenta D. trabajar conjuntamente con sus hijas quienes le ayudan en este negocio pero sin descuidar la escuela.

loans.use: To extend the local and install ceilings. To buy supplies. Ampliación del local e instalación de calaminas (techo).  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariela belongs to Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 37 years old and has 5 children, her husband is employed on a business where he earns only the minimum salary, so Mariela with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos (S/300.00 soles) decided to set a small place to sell cookies and candy.

Currently she has a small grocery store which she attends with her children, she wakes up very early to prepare breakfast and then attend the store.

With the new loan of $/.1,000 ($333 approx.) which will be pay in 6 months, she will increase her business and will buy 1 box of milk, 1 pack of sugar, 5 boxes of soda, 1 gallon of oil and 2 bunches of plantains.

Mariela is very happy to have her kids in school and help her husband financially.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Mariela pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. Constitución 160 A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es empleado de una empresa donde solo le pagan el sueldo mínimo, es así que Mariela, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos (S/ 300.00 soles) decide poner un pequeño puesto para la venta de galletas y golosinas. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega, la misma que atiende junto a sus hijos, se levantan muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y después poder atender la bodega, Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 1 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite y dos racimos de plátanos. Mariela esta muy contenta de tener a sus hijos en la escuela y apoyar económicamente a su esposo.

loans.use: To buy diverse merchandise. Compra de productos diversos.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Mrs. Eva lives in her own house with her husband and children. They live on Buenos Aires Avenue in the San Martin zone of La Paz city. Eva works manufacturing handmade sweets. She sells the sweets to chifleras, who use them to make perfumes. She also travels and sells sweets in different towns of the Department of La Paz.

Eva is one of the clients who obtain credit through Kiva. The credit that they gave to her before was paid off on time. Now she she is asking for a new loan in order to keep increasing her capital and buy more raw materials in order to produce more sweets. Her candies are very appreciated by her clients.

Based on her past record she is eligible to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eva vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona San Martin de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella se dedica a la elaboración de dulces artesanales los cuales vende a las chifleras que los utilizan para sahumerios; ella también viaja y vende sus dulces en diferentes pueblos del Departamento de La Paz.

Eva es parte de los clientes que consiguieron crédito a través de Kiva. El crédito que se le dio anteriormente fue cancelado de acuerdo al plan de pagos. Ahora solicita uno nuevo para seguir aumentando su capital y comprar más materia prima para producir mas dulces, los cuales tienen mucha aceptación entre sus clientes.

Por su antecedente puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials in order to make candy

payments.comment: Early payoff.Eva is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicita belongs to Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 75 years old and has 6 kids, her husband works at a sawmill, but his health is very bad, so Felicita decided to open a small place to sell typical food with her first loan from Manuela Ramos.

Currently she has a small space in the corner of her hose to sell food that she prepares (juanes, patarashca, smoked fish, and tacacho with steak). Every day she wakes up very early to take care of the household and from 5pm on she attends the business until mid night.

With the new loan of $/.2,500 ($833 approx.), which will be paid in 6 months, she will build a small ceiling so she won’t have difficulties when it rains, she will also buy 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, a bunch of plantains, 3 kilos of fish and 1 sack of charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.



La señora Felicita pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. B. Leguia 1098 del A. H. Nuevo Paraiso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero, pero su salud es delicada, es así que Felicita, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto de venta de comida regional. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño espacio en la esquina de su casa para vender la comida que prepara (juanes, patarashca, pescado ahumado y tacacho con cecina). Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender los quehaceres de la casa y a partir de las 5.00 pm atiende el negocio hasta la media noche. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, armará un pequeño techo para no tener dificultades cuando llueve, además comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, un racimo de plátanos, 3 kilos de pescado y 1 saco de carbón. Felicita esta muy contenta de tener este negocio por que así puede atender a su familia en las mañanas y en las noches vender su comida para generar ingreso para los gastos de la casa.

loans.use: To install ceilings and buy supplies.Instalación de calaminas (techo).  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Doris Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. Doris belongs to Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 42 years old and has 2 children, her husband is a fisherman, and Doris decided to saw clothes to sell (women lingerie) with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos.

Currently she has a sawing machine that allows her to create women’s lingerie, as well as fix clothes.

With the new loan for S/.1,000 ($333 approx.), which will be 6 months, she will buy oil to give maintenance to her sawing machine, 10 meters of cotton, yards of elastic and threads to saw.

Doris is very happy with her business as she can help support her home with it.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. Nueva Esperanza 110 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es pescador, es así que Doris, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide coser prendas de vestir (Ropa interior para damas). En la actualidad cuenta con un maquina de coser que le permite confeccionar ropa interior para mujeres, además hacer arreglos de ropas deterioradas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará aceite para el mantenimiento de la maquina, 10 metros de tela de algodón, 2 conos de elástico y 3 conos de hilo para coser. Doris está muy contenta de tener un negocio y a través de ella ayudar en costear los gastos de la casa.

loans.use: To Buy clothes, threads, elastics on wholesale. To give maintenance to her sawing machine. Compra de telas, hilos, elásticos al por mayor.  Mantenimiento de máquina de coser.

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha belongs to Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 30 years old and mother of 3 children, her husband is an auto mechanic, and because of his low income, Bertha started a store to sell parts for motorcars and motorcycles with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos.

Currently she has a small store of parts, which she handles with her husband, while he fixes the motorcycles, she sells the parts.

With the new loan of S/.2,500 ($833 approx.), which will be pay in 6 months, she will improve her business and buy 1 box of parts for motorcycles, 3 sets of keys, 1 box of oil of motorcycles, 1 dozen of hoops for wheels and 3 rims for tires.

Bertha is very happy to have her kids healthy and studying in high school, and to be the main provider of supplies for her husband’s business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, vive en la Calle Constitución 180 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es mecánico de motocar, dado a sus bajos ingresos, Bertha decide poner un pequeño puesto de venta de respuestas de motocar, esto lo consigue gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña tienda de repuestos, la misma que atiende junto a su esposo, mientras su esposo arregla las motos ella le provee de repuestos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 1 caja de retenes (piezas de motocar), 3 juegos de llaves, 1 caja de aceite para motos, 1 docena de aros para llantas y 3 cámaras para llantas. Bertha esta muy contenta de tener a sus hijos sanos y estudiando en el colegio, además de ser la proveedora del negocio de su esposo.

loans.use: To buy parts and accessories for motorcar and motorcycles. To improve her local. Compra de repuestos y accesorios para motocar y motocicletas.  Ampliación del local.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Sra. Angela belongs to the Sol Naciente ("Rising Sun") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a cab driver but his earnings don't cover the family's basic needs so Angela decided, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, to set up a small foodstand. She now earns a living from the business which she tends together with her children. She counts on her husband's support to help with the children and to take them to a nearby school.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$333), to be repaid in 6 months, she will expand her business and buy bulk supplies of rice, chicken, cooking oil and a variety of green vegetables to make the food she sells.

Angela is happy to have the support of her husband, given that the children need a lot of attention.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Angela pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. Argentina Mz E Lt 12 Del A. H. Indoamerica del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es taxista de motocar, pero lo que gana no alcanza para las necesidades básicas del hogar, es así que Angela, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto de venta de comida al paso. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño espacio para vender comida al paso, la misma que atiende junto a sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para atender a los niños y llevarlos a la escuela más cercana.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará el local de su negocio y comprará 10 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 5 litros de aceite y verduras variadas para preparar la comida.

Angela esta muy contenta de tener el apoyo de su esposo dado que los niños necesitan mucha atención.

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Sra. Alicia belongs to the Sol Naciente ("Rising Sun") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a construction worker but his income doesn't cover the family's expenses so Alicia decided, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, to set up a small shop. She now earns a living from the shop. She gets up early to attend to household chores so that she can then tend the shop. Her children are now independent but they're very grateful for all their mother has done for them.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,300 (1,300 Peruvian soles or about US$433), to be repaid in 6 months, Alicia will expand the business and buy supplies of milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil and snacks.

Alicia is very happy to have healthy children and to have succeeded in ensuring that they both finished school. She's also happy knowing that she can help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, Del Jr. Jhon F. Kenedy 990 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es Albañil, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, es así que Alicia, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, se levanta muy temprano para atender los quehaceres de la casa para luego atender la bodega, sus hijos ya se independizaron económicamente pero están muy agradecidos por todo lo que su madre hace por ellos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,300 (US$ 433.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 2 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite, 3 paquetes de galletas.

Alicia está muy contenta de tener a sus hijos sanos y haber logrado que ellos terminen sus estudios, además se siente realizada por que puede apoyar económicamente en su hogar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Teresa Maribel

texts.es:
Teresa is a woman who has had to fight hard to succeed and to earn enough money to educate her children.

About 20 years ago, Teresa decided to place her plastic selling business in the Ivan Montenegro market near the city of Managua. Although she began with only $500 and is working in a less than ideal area, she has been able to build up her business, bit by bit, over time. Indeed, she now has to constantly restock her products.

Teresa has worked with CEPRODEL for three years; this in itself shows that she is responsible and loyal. Her credit record is also very good.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa es una señora que para poder salir adelante y darle educacion a sus hijos ha tenido que luchar arduamente. Ella ha trabajado como domestica y en diversas actividades para llevar el sustento a su casa.

Hace alrededor de 20 años Teresa decisio colocar su negocio de venta de plasticos varios en el mercado Ivan Montenegro en la ciudad de Managua, comenzando asi con un capital de US$500.00, en un local con condiciones precarias, sin embargo ha logrado poco a poco mejorarlo.

Actualmente su local esta bien surtido y su inventario se mantiene en constante movimiento. Teresa lleva tres años trabajando con CEPRODEL, tiempo que demuestra su fidelidad. Su record crediticio es de 15 creditos, los que la han ayudado a superarse.

loans.use: Purchasing different kinds of plastics

loans.name: Magsud

texts.en: Magsud is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 36, is married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Caucasus region in Azerbaijan. Magsud sells beef, while his wife grazes animals. The income from the four bulls they have is too low to support the family. That’s why Magsud has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to buy one more bull, to increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 46, is married with five children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Caucasus region in Azerbaijan. Shamil owns a herd of milk cows. Every day he sells milk to the local milk processing shop. His children help him breed cows in the nearby grazing area.

The income from four cows is too low to support the family, and four cows are not enough to increase the number of cows. That’s why Shamil has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to buy one more purebred cow to make his monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300, and the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 he plans to save for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Eldar

texts.ru:
Mr Eldar lives in the city of Saatli in Azerbaidjan. He is 54, married and has 4 children. Eldar is the only breadwinner for the family. He earns money by raising cattle and selling it on the local market. Each year he buys young calves from nearby farmers and neighboring villages and raises them for 8 to 9 months on his property. When they are all grown up, Eldar sells them to the local butcher shops. Currently Eldar is thinking about increasing the size of his business because current income is insufficient to provide for his four children. He is planing to purchase 2 more calves than usual. In order to be able to do that he requires an additional $500. This is why he came to Normico, a Kiva partner looking for help.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Г-н Ельдар живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 54 года, он женат, имеет 4-х детей. Ельдар является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Ельдар думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его 4-х детей. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 2 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Ельдар обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Neylin

texts.es:
Neylin has her own business, located in the Ivan Montenegro market near the city of Managua. She has had this busness for eight years. Starting this business required great effort on her part, as she had to save up a lot of money.

Even when the area in which her business is located began to go through a difficult time, moreover, she was still able to build up her business bit by bit. In fact, by making many sacrifices, she was able to improve her location in order to better serve her customers.

CEPRODEL has been a helping hand for Neylin. With its support she has been able to expand her business and offer her goods to more people. Neylin has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and has a good credit rating.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Neylin tiene su propio negocio ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua desde hace ocho años. Con mucho esfuerzo logro ahorrar C$20,000.00 cordobas para empezar con su negocio.

Cuando inicio el local donde se encuentra ubicada estaba en malas condiciones, sin embargo poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mejorar la estructura del local brindando asi mejor atencion a sus clientes.

CEPRODEL ha sido una mano amiga para Neylin, ya que gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado ha logrado crecer, ofreciendo sus productos a mayoristas. Neylin lleva dos años trabajando con CEPRODEL y tiene un record de 9 creditos.

loans.use: Purchasing products and raw materials

loans.name: Takhir

texts.ru:
Takhir lives in Saatli Town, Azerbaijan.  He is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children.  Takhir has 3 dairy cows.  Because he is the only provider in the family, he together with his son (see photo) milk the cows and sell milk at the local market.  It is very difficult to provide for a family of 5 children and Takhir plans to increase the number of cows in order to increase his milk supply.  

Takhir is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase dairy calves.  At the local market one calf costs $100, by purchasing 5 calves, Takhir will be able to triple his milk production, which will provide him with an extra $500 in profits every month.

 Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer. 



Мр. Тахир живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 50 лет, он женат, имеет 5-х детей. Тахир имеет три собственные доильные коровы. Будучи единственным кормильцем в семье, он вместе со своим сыном (см. фото) занимается доением и продажей молока на местном рынке. Обеспечивать семью с пятью детьми очень трудно и Тахир планирует увеличить надои и продажу молока путём увеличения количества коров. Поэтому он обратился в микрокредитную организацию "Нормикро"-партнёру КИВА- с просьбой предоставить ему кредит в 500 долларов для покупки телят молочной породы. На местном рынке цена одного телёнка приравнивается 100 долларам, так что Тахир, купив 5 телят, сможет увеличить надои молока в три раза. А это даст Тахир 500 долларов чистой прибыли в месяц.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Hilaria Juliana

texts.es:
Hilaria is 32. She tends a small stand at the Santa Barbara market where she sells cooked vegetables and legumes. Thanks to her good cheer and hard work she has earned a loyal base of satisfied customers. Through daily toil she has been able to cover the medical expenses of her elderly mother, Guillermina, who she so lovingly cares for in their humble home. Hilaria dreams of improving their dwelling. To do so, she would like to expand her product line and increase her sales, so she is asking for a loan. With your help she may soon see her dreams fulfilled.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En un pequeño puesto del mercado Santa Bárbara, encontramos a Hilaria de 32 años de edad, ofreciendo muy entusiasta sus menestras cocidas, negocio que por su carisma, popularidad y amabilidad con la que se desempeña diariamente está obteniendo asiduos clientes y muchas satisfacciones.Gracias a esta labor ha cubierto los gastos de salud de su querida y anciana madre, Guillermina, a quién muy cariñosamente cuida y protege en las instalaciones de su humilde morada.Ella desea ampliar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos , con el fin de ahorrar lo suficiente para terminar de refaccionar su humilde casita y sobre todo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su amorosa madre. Para cumplir sus anhelos Hilaria solicita un préstamo con el que gracias a tu colaboración podrá cumplir en muy corto tiempo su propósito.

loans.use: To expand a line of cooked vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa Haydee is married and has five children, two of whom are school-age. Her children have given her a reason to work hard to maintain a stable family and have enough money for their education.

Over 24 years ago, Rosa sold pork. Still, she was able to find and take advantage of a good opportunity. This resulted in her beginning her own dairy products business.

This business is now one of the best in her area. Her sales have increased substantially over the years as she has expanded her business and improved its structure. Her initial capital was 80,000 Cordobas, which came from her saving and those of her husband.

Rose Haydee has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years now and has a good credit rating.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Haydee es una mujer casada con cinco hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran en la edad escolar. Sus hijos han sido su razon de vivir y por ellos es que ella se ha esforzado, brindandoles asi una familia estable y una educacion para el futuro de ellos.

Hace mas de 24 años Rosa Haydee se dedicaba a matar cerdos y venderlos, sin embargo logro encontrar una mejor oportunidad en su camino y fue asi que ella da inicio a su local de venta de productos lacteos.

Este negocio es uno de los mas destacados hoy en dia en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente al paso de los años, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$80,000 (cordobas) los cuales una parte eran sus ahorros y otra aporte de su esposo.

Rosa Haydee trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los creditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando asi a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 9 creditos.

loans.use: Purchasing products

loans.name: Roz Mery

texts.es:
Roz Mery is 29 years old. She hails from a humble but hard-working line of craftsmen. Since she was a small girl she has made ceramic figurines. Now that she is married she and her husband Jose work from 5:00 in the morning to 7:00 in the evening making their varied and popular figurines. They hope to continue expanding the business and to export their wares, so they are asking for a loan to buy clay. With the proceeds from their craft they hope to finish their humble home and give their 4-year-old son Luisito a better quality of life. Please help this hard-working and talented young couple.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Roz Mery de 29 años de edad, proviene de un hogar humilde pero muy laborioso, desde niña se dedicó a la artesanía en cerámica, trabajo que heredó de sus queridos padres y que ahora satisfactoriamente desempeña junto a su esposo José.Ambos empiezan a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la mañana y culminan sus labores a las 7:00 de la noche, debido a que su mercadería tiene gran demanda por la calidad y variedad de sus productos. El deseo de esta joven pareja es seguir creciendo con esta admirable ocupación hasta lograr exportar sus trabajos.Requiere un préstamo de dinero, para adquirir materia prima (arcilla) para la producción de sus trabajos ; así mismo con los beneficios económicos que obtengan terminar de refaccionar su casita y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su querido hijo Luisito de 4 años.“Ayudemos a esta joven pareja a salir adelante con el talento innato con el que realizan sus bellos trabajos”

loans.use: To buy clay for making figurines.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda and her hard-working husband Pascual share their humble home in the village of Pukará with their only daughter and their grandchildren ever since the daughter's husband deserted her and the children. This talented couple has a pottery workshop where they make unique pieces for sale in nearby towns. Their daughter also works very hard in this enterprise. The family would like to expand their production so they are asking for a loan to buy clay in hopes of increasing their income and standard of living. Let's help this loving and talented family work towards their dreams.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Leonarda y su emprendedor esposo Pascual, tienen un humilde domicilio en el pueblito de Pukará, lugar donde cobijan a su única hija y a sus amorosos nietos, desde que el esposo de su hija mayor decidió abandonarlos sin ningún respaldo económico.Esta humilde pareja posee un taller de cerámica, gracias a sus talentosas manos, paciencia y dedicación que ponen en su oficio. Elaboran hermosos e incomparables trabajos que luego son vendidos en los diferentes pueblos aledaños a la ciudad donde viven. Esta labor los viene llenando de satisfacción porque están logrando obtener rápidamente resultados favorables, con el apoyo incondicional de su querida hija.Ahora Leonarda y su esposo están deseosos de seguir acrecentando el número de sus trabajos y para esto requieren obtener un préstamo de dinero que podrán invertir completamente en adquirir materia prima (arcilla) para la producción de más mercadería y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.“ Colaboremos con este noble afán para que estos amorosos abuelos sigan desarrollando su labor con mucho talento y amor”

loans.use: To buy clay for making figurines.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina is the mother of three. Throughout her life she has shown herself to be very hard-working. She has a true talent for making ceramic and plaster figurines in various patterns and colors. At this time she has a large backlog of unfilled orders but she needs capital to buy raw materials. She is asking for a loan of $1025 to buy the plaster, clay, firewood and paint she needs to meet demand. Georgina dreams of increasing her production in order to give her children a good home and education. She promises to repay the loan in eight months. Please help her fulfill her dreams.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Georgina es una admirable madre de 3 hijos, durante el transcurso de su vida se mostró siempre como una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada al hermoso arte de la cerámica basado en yeso y arcilla, trabajo que desempeña eficientemente, realizando múltiples diseños y pintados y que gracias a su talento innato le está progresando.Actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de solicitudes, pero tiene un problema, no posee suficiente capital para comprar materia prima (arcilla, yeso, leña, etc.) para la producción de su mercadería, es por esa razón que recurre a tu apoyo y solicita un préstamo de 1025 dólares, dinero que le permitirá cumplir con sus pedidos y al mismo tiempo obtener mayor beneficio económico para brindarle estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos. Georgina promete ser puntual en el reembolso del préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Contamos con vuestra gentil contribución para hacer realidad en un corto tiempo los sueños de Georgina

loans.use: To buy clay, plaster, firewood and paint.
